loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Justin wants to construct a shelter to be selling her clothes from.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy nail paintings, files, face creams, body lotions, and body perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane wants to buy textile materials

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.en:
Mrs T. owns a small business in which she has sold groceries and stationary for 13 years, it is located in her home, where she lives with her only daughter, she is a widow.

\\\"My objective is to continue to maintina my business, and it is because of this that I know also sell stationary items, since my husband passed away, I have been responsible to support my daughter, thank God that she is by now grown and sooner or later with start her own family, and I will expand my business to ensure my own future. I am asking for a loan of &1,000.00 dollars in order to buy a variety of murchandise.\\\"

Loan Use: To purchase a variety of merchandise.

La Sra. T. cuenta con un negocio pequeño ella vende abarrotes y papelería desde hace 13 años, lo tiene ubicado en su casa, vive con su única hija, es viuda.

“Mi objetivo es seguir manteniendo mi negocio es por eso que ya cuento con artículos de papelería, desde que mi esposo falleció me he responsabilizado por sacar a adelante a mi hija, gracias a dios ella ya está grande y tarde o temprano formará una familia, anhelo agrandar mi negocio para asegurar mi futuro, solicito $1,000.00 dlls para comprar variedad de mercancía.”

loans.use: compar variedad de mercancía

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
El Sr. G. cuenta con una peluquería improvisada en su casa, su deseo es poder acondicionarla en forma adecuada tal y como la tienen sus hermanos en el centro de la ciudad.

“Hace ya mas de una década que en conjunto con mis hermanos echamos a andar una peluquería en el centro de la ciudad, hoy en día decidí independizarme y acople un cuarto de mi casa, toda mi vida me he dedicado a esto, hoy quiero tener mi propio negocio, solicito $1,500.00 dlls para comprar equipo y herramienta.”

loans.use: comprar equipo y herramienta.”

loans.name: Nohemí

texts.en:
Nohemi is a single mother and has three children, two of them are women and the other one is a man, they are studying. Nohemi live with her family and started her business three years ago, she started her own business because she had to maintain her family and also she had a family member who was sick and she had to support all necessities of her family. She began her business when a friend of her invited her to sell cosmetics articles house by house and she had success because Nohemi is a good saleswoman and has talent to do this kind of business, so she opened her mind and saw that she could sell other kind of things so she started to sell clothes by orders, and little by little her demand began to grow.

Nohemi thinks purchase merchandise in a great quantities because do it this she could offers her merchandise to her clients in a lower prices and for that reason she is requesting for a loan of USD $ 275 and make this investment and also can grow up in her business. She offers to repay the loan in a term of 4 – 8 months.

\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Nohemí es madre soltera con tres hijos, dos de ellas son mujeres y el tercero es un hombrecito, los tres están en estudiando. Nohemí vive con su familia y empezó su negocio hace tres años atrás, justo por la necesidad de sacar a su familia adelante y por que también tuvo a un familiar que se enfermo y tuvo que ver por el. Cuando se inició fue invitada por una amiga a la venta de cosméticos de casa en casa y le fue bien ya que ella es una buena vendedora, entonces al ver que tenía talento para las ventas ella no solo se quedo con ese negocio de los cosméticos, sino que también empezó a incursionar en la venta de ropa a pedido, y poco a poco fue teniendo buena aceptación entre sus clientes.

Nohemí piensa comprar mercancía al por mayor para así poder otorgar mejores precios a sus clientes obteniendo también buenas utilidades de este ahorro en la compra, ya que al por mayor le dan la mercancía a un mejor precio, por ello esta solicitando un préstamo de USD $ 275 para realizar esta inversión y poder sacar a su familia adelante y seguir creciendo con su negocio. Ofrece pagar el crédito en un plazo de 4 -8 meses.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics articles

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe is married and has two sons, one of them has 16 years old and the other one has 20 years old, both are actually studying. Her husband works as a bricklayer in a small company since three years ago and his incomes are not enough to maintain his family, for that reason she decided to help her husband in the family expenses started her own business. Since three years ago Maria Guadalupe was invited for a friend of her to enter in the cosmetics sales by catalogue and she decided to did it, so at the beginning her incomes are lower than she expects, but with the pass of the time she saw that her incomes arise little by little but as her incomes grow, her family expenses too, because her children are growing and they demand more things, for this reason Maria Guadalupe decided to start a food sales business and maintain her cosmetics business as well, and this new kind of business give her a little bit more incomes to her economy and could offer a better quality of life to her family.

Maria Guadalupe is requesting for a loan of USD $ 275 to purchase merchandise and also raw materials to her food business, and she offers to repay this loan in a term of 4 to 8 months.

This text has been translated from the following original business description.

María Guadalupe esta casada y tiene dos hijos, uno de 16 años y el otro de 20 años, ambos están actualmente estudiando. Su esposo trabaja como albañil en una pequeña empresa hace 3 años y sus ingresos no son suficientes para mantener a su familia, fue por ello que María Guadalupe decidió apoyar en los gastos de la economía familiar, empezando su propio negocio. Hace tres años atrás ella por invitación de una amiga se interesó en la venta de cosméticos ya que las utilidades si bien no son excelentes son buenas y ayudan a la economía familiar, al inicio empezó con muy pocas utilidades, pero con el tiempo empezó a ver que si era un buen negocio pero así como sus ingresos se incrementaban, sus gastos también por que sus hijos demandaban mayores cosas por que están creciendo, por ello María Guadalupe decidió además de solo vender cosméticos por pedido, empezar a vender comida por que es muy buena cocinera, y este nuevo producto en sus ventas le ayuda a obtener un poco más de ingreso para poder ofrecer a su familia lo necesario para un mejor nivel de vida.

María Guadalupe esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de USD $ 275 para comprar mas productos de belleza y también insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, dispuesta a pagar este crédito en un período de 4 a 8 meses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Laura Esther

texts.en:
Laura is a single mother of two sons, one of them of 23 and the other one of 15, both are studying and do not help her in the business because Laura’s preference is their studies and will have a better quality of life, do not pass all that she lives and also give their families all support that they will need in the near future. Laura’s business is tacos, hamburgers and food sales and to her sons just dedicate to study she has three person that help her in the business and all of them are her families, her aunt, her brother and her niece, they are working in a small rent place inside a commercial place called Gigante since 4 years ago.

Laura is requesting for a loan of USD $ 475 to purchase raw materials to her food business, because she had a very good demand in this place because this commercial place is very visited, she offers to repay this loan in a term of 4 to 8 months, and also appreciate all lenders that help her to achieve her dream of see one day her children professionals.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Laura es una mujer soltera y madre de 2 hijos, uno de ellos tiene 23 y el otro 15, ambos se encuentran estudiando y no apoyan en el negocio por que Laura prefiere que ellos estudien y tengan una mejor calidad de vida, no pasen lo que a ella le toco vivir y le otorguen a sus familias el sustento que necesitan. El negocio de Laura es la venta de comidas, tacos y hamburguesas y para que sus hijos se dediquen al estudio, Laura tiene a 3 familiares trabajando para ella y son su tía, su hermano y su sobrina, rentando un pequeño lugar en un centro comercial llamado Gigante, negocio que empezó hace cuatro años atrás con la visión de sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Laura esta solicitando un crédito por USD $ 475 para comprar insumos para las comidas que prepara, ya que tiene una buena demanda por que el centro comercial es muy visitado, ofreciendo pagar este crédito en un plazo de entre 4 y 8 meses, Laura les agradece a las personas que la apoyan a obtener el sueño de que sus hijos sean profesionales algún día.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to her food business

loans.name: Eva María

texts.en:
Eva is married has 34 years old and has three children, they have 6, 10 and 15 years old respectively and also they all are studying, her husband is working far of her family in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas as a worker in a company called Stil since two years ago, just visit his family only in his vacations, as her husband is working far of home she had the necessity to obtain extra incomes to support the family expenses and also she wants to stay together with his husband and lives as a unit family that used to be but separates for economics necessities. Two years ago she decided to sell shoes and she was gain little by little more incomes but not enough and for that reason she was thinking what else she could do and decided sell tacos, now she dedicated to works in these two activities, that demonstrate that she is very hard working and entrepreneur woman is.

Eva is requesting for a loan of USD $250 to purchase merchandise and also raw materials for her food sales business, offering to repay this loan in a term of 3 to 6 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Eva esta casada, tiene 34 años de edad y tiene tres hijos de 6, 10 y 15 años respectivamente y todos se encuentran estudiando y su esposo se encuentra trabajando lejos de la familia en Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas como operador en una empresa llamada Stil durante dos años, viniendo a visitar a su familia durante sus vacaciones; como su esposo se encuentra trabajando lejos de casa, ella se vio en la necesidad de obtener cierto ingreso extra como apoyo a su esposo y poder tener mejores ingresos para que en algún momento puedan estar juntos nuevamente como una familia unida que lo son pero separadas por la necesidad económica. Hace dos años atrás ella decidió incursionar en la venta de zapatos y le fue yendo muy bien pero aún sus ingresos no eran los suficientes, por ello decidió vender tacos para obtener mejores utilidades y así lo hizo por lo que ahora se dedica a estas dos actividades, lo que demuestra lo trabajadora y emprendedora que es Eva.

Eva esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 250 para la compra de zapatos en cantidad y también para la compra de ciertos insumos que utiliza en la preparación de sus tacos al vapor, proponiéndose a pagar este crédito en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and also raw materials for her food sales business

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen lives in Escobedo Nuevo Leon Mexico. She began her business 6 years ago in her house\\\'s porches with the hamburger and burrito sales. Carmen is a very hard-working person and surrendered to her family. With a son who she wants to offer him a good education, she undertook her own business. Carmen is married with Adolfo who is working in industrial pieces sales; she knows that her husband\\\'s job has bad seasons, for that reason she looked another way to survive in those difficult seasons when her husband doesn\\\'t win enough money. She wants to give to her son a better standard of life, she thinks that the best inheritance for her small boy is a good education.

Carmen needs a loan of $550 USD to purchase construction material because she wants to put a roof to her house’s porch to improve the place where assists and gives service to her clients. Carmen hopes that with this remodeling her sales increase.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Carmen vive en Escobedo Nuevo León México. Inició su negocio hace 6 años en la cochera de su casa con la venta de hamburguesas y burritos de harina. Carmen es una persona muy trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Con un hijo al cual desea brindarle una buena educación, ella emprendió su propio negocio. Carmen esta casada con Adolfo quien se dedica a la venta de piezas industriales; ella sabe que el trabajo de su esposo tiene malas temporadas, por lo que ella buscó la manera de sobrevivir en esas temporadas en las que su esposo no gana suficiente dinero, por esa razón emprendió su negocio. Ella desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y dice que la mejor herencia para su pequeño es una buena educación.

Carmen necesita de $550 USD para comprar material de construcción ya que desea poner un techo a su cochera para mejorar el lugar donde atiende y da servicio a sus clientes. Carmen desea que con esta remodelación sus ventas aumenten.

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.en:
Juanita is 32 years old; she lives in Escobedo Nuevo Leon Mexico. Her husband does not have a fixed job, for that reason Juanita decided to begin her business. With 4 children to give them clothes, food and a good education, Juanita works in quilts, curtains and house towels sales; she knows that is not easy to cover all the family expenses, but Juanita loves her small children and for them she gives all her life. Already 4 years ago she started her own business, which has brought many satisfactions to her family and hopes that it will be better every time. Juanita says that every day her clients continue increasing.

She requires a loan of $250 USD to purchase products as quilts, spreads and more to cover all her demand this new winter season. Juanita hopes an increment her sales. She needs your support and her family thanks your generosity.

\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Juanita tiene 32 años de edad, vive en Escobedo Nuevo León México. Su esposo no cuenta con un trabajo fijó, por lo que Juanita decidió iniciar su negocio. Con 4 hijos a los que tiene que brindarles ropa, comida y una buena educación, Juanita trabaja en la venta de colchas, cortinas y toallas de casa, ella sabe que no es fácil cubrir los gastos de su familia, pero Juanita adora a cada uno de sus pequeños y por ellos comparte su vida. Hace ya 4 años que inició su negocio, el cual ha traído muchas satisfacciones a su familia y espera que mejore con el paso del tiempo y es que Juanita dice que día con día su clientela sigue aumentando.

Ella requiere de un préstamo de $250 USD para la compra de productos para vender como colchas, cobertores y cobijas para la nueva temporada de invierno en la que Juanita espera un incremento en sus ventas. Ella necesita de tu apoyo y su familia agradece tu generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina has two children and for that reason she works very hard every day to offer them a better quality of life. She began her business already 14 years ago in the clothes and products of beauty sales with the objective to supporting her husband with the family expenses. Constantino is Evangelina\\\'s husband he works as a worker; however his salary does not enough to cover their home basic necessities. At the moment the business has become a family activity because one of her children helps to Evangelina, although they have a very small house, she wants to improve the quality of life from her beautiful family.

Evangelina requires a loan of $250 USD to enlarge part of her house because she wants to use it as a warehouse and place of sales, she is planning to increase her products, but she needs a bigger space to sell her merchandise. Evangelina and her family thank your support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Evangelina tiene dos hijos por los cuales trabaja muy duro todos los días para poderles ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Ella inició su negocio hace ya 14 años en la venta de ropa y productos de belleza con el objetivo de apoyar a su esposo con el gasto familiar. Constantino es el esposo de Evangelina trabaja como obrero, sin embargo su salario no cubre las necesidades básicas del hogar. Actualmente el negocio se ha convertido en una actividad familiar ya que uno de sus hijos ayuda a Evangelina y aunque tienen una casa muy pequeña, ella desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su hermosa familia.

Evangelina requiere de un préstamo de $250 USD para ampliar una parte de su casa y poder utilizarla como bodega y lugar de ventas, ya que ella esta planeando incrementar sus productos, pero necesita de un mayor espacio para vender su mercancía. Evangelina y su familia agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: Enlarge part of her house

loans.name: San Juana Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe has 3 beautiful children and every one is studying, her husband is a worker and works in a private company. She began her business since 4 years ago. With the necessity of supporting her husband with the family expenses, because the incomes that he receives are not enough to cover the family expenses and their child\'s education. She began to selling different articles like gifts. That is the way as every body knew her around her neighborhood, so she started to acquire more and more clients. Her family love has allowed her to undertake her business and she wants to offer a better education to her boy.

Guadalupe needs a loan of $275 USD to purchase merchandise for this Christmas season. She hopes an excellent season to sell her products; she expects your help and generosity. In a term of 4 months Guadalupe plans to return the loan.

\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Guadalupe tiene 3 hermosos hijos y cada uno se encuentra estudiando, su esposo es un tornero y trabaja para una empresa privada. Inicio hace 4 años su negocio ante la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares ya que el salario que el recibe, no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de la familia y la educación de sus hijos. Por lo que comenzó vendiendo diferentes artículos para regalos y novedades, fue así como se dio a conocer a los alrededores de su colonia y empezó adquirir más clientes. Su amor por la familia le ha permitido emprender este negocio y tener la esperanza de ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación.

Guadalupe necesita de un préstamo de $275 USD para comprar mercancía como regalos y novedades para esta temporada navideña. Ella espera una excelente temporada para vender sus productos, por lo que espera de tu ayuda y generosidad. En un plazo de 4 meses Guadalupe planea devolver el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for this Christmas

loans.name: Elvia

texts.en:
Elvia is a very young woman, with 33 years old, she considers by herself as an entrepreneur, intelligent and hard working woman. Gerardo is Elvia\'s husband and he is working in a private company. Even with his job, his salary is not enough to cover up the family expenses, for that reason Elvia started her own business. She has 2 years of experience and works selling products made with ceramic, every day her clients are increasing because she has petty good pleasure and humor. With a beautiful son she wants to offer him a better quality of life.

Elvia requires a loan of $250 USD to purchase of products made with ceramic and she plans to return the loan in a term of 3 months. Elvia requests of your support and she thanks your generosity

\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Elvia es una mujer muy joven, con 33 años de edad se concederá ella misma como una mujer emprendedora, inteligente y trabajadora. Gerardo es el esposo de Elvia y es un empleado de una empresa privada. A pesar de su trabajo no gana el suficiente dinero para cubrir los gastos de su familia por lo que Elvia inicio su propio negocio. Ella tiene 2 años de experiencia se dedica a vender productos hechos con cerámica y cada día sus clientes aumentan debido a su buen gusto y humor. Con un hermoso hijo ella desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.

Elvia requiere de un préstamo de $250 USD para la compra de productos hechos con cerámica y planea regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 3 meses. Elvia pide de tu apoyo y agradece tu generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase of products made with ceramic

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old and she is working on tamales sales and Mexican foods, she has 5 years of experience in her business and her clients have increased year to year, for that reason Carmen is motivated to increase her capacity to produce foods. She has 2 children, who she loves so much and for them she has to work very hard to cover their necessities like food, clothes and studies. Married with Mr. Juan who works in a private company and their salary is not enough to cover the family expenses; Carmen is very worried to go on.

She requires your support; from that way she can offer to her children a good education and a better quality of life. She needs a loan of $250 USD to purchase raw material for the production of her foods, because these next Christmas season, the Tamales is one of the favorite Mexican meal and Carmen hopes excellent sales in the same way. In a term of 3 months, she plans to return the loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Carmen tiene 40 años y se dedica a la venta de tamales y comidas mexicanas, tiene 5 años de experiencia en su negocio y sus clientes han aumentado año con año, por lo que Carmen esta motivada para aumentar su capacidad de producir comidas. Tiene 2 hijos a quienes adora y por los que tiene que trabajar muy duro para cubrir sus necesidades como alimento, ropa y estudios. Casada con el señor Juan quien trabaja en una empresa privada y su salario no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de la familia la preocupación de Carmen es muy grande.

Ella requiere de tu apoyo para que pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Necesita de un préstamo de $250 USD para comprar insumos para la producción de sus comidas ya que estas próxima temporada navideña, los Tamales son uno de los platillos favoritos de los mexicanos por lo que Carmen espera excelentes ventas para esta temporada. En un término de 3 meses, ella planea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.en:
Deyanira is a very young woman; she has 2 small children of 2 and 7 years old. She says that the most beautiful thing in her life is her family and sees how her children grow up. She started her business 4 years ago because she had the necessity to cover her family expenses. Deyanira\\\'s husband works as employee in a private company and he earns a minimum salary. She is working on shoes by catalogue sales for that reason now she is an important part of her family’s economy.

Deyanira says that her sales are increasing because every day every one around her clients has been knowing her and the best thing of her job allows her to have time to assist her children and her home. Deyanira requires a loan of $275 USD to purchase merchandise because she says that this Christmas season is the best season to increase her sales.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Deyanira es una mujer muy joven, tiene 2 hijos muy pequeños de 2 y 7 años de edad. Ella dice que lo mas bonito que tiene en su vida es su familia y por sobre todo ver a sus hijos crecer. Inicio su negocio hace 4 años ante la necesidad de cubrir los gastos del hogar, ya que el esposo de Deyanira trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada y tiene un salario mínimo. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo por lo que desde entonces forma parte importante en la economía de su familia.

Deyanira cuenta que las ventas siguen aumentando debido a que cada día se va dando a conocer entre sus clientes y lo mejor de su trabajo le permite tener tiempo para atender a sus hijos y su hogar. Deyanira requiere de un préstamo de $275 USD para la compra de mercancía porque dice que esta temporada navideña es la mejor para incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angélica Martínez Hernández Angelica lives in Garcia, Nuevo Leon, she has two little kids and for them she works very hard every day. Many years ago she and her husband bought a small house where they are living until now, however they are paying it every month but her husband\\\'s salary does not reach to cover all their family expenses, so Angelica decided to begin her own business, she started to sell products like snacks, sodas and little by little she was having more merchandise to sell. At the moment Angelica’s incomes are an important part in her family economy, but she wants to make grow her business to give to her children an education and a better quality of life.

Besides her children, Angelic lives with her father-in-law who is sick and disabled to work. She needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase merchandise because she hopes to have a bigger quantity of products to sell in her small store, hopping to obtain better revenues. Angelica and her family require your support and they thank your affection.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Angélica vive en la localidad de García, Nuevo León, tiene dos pequeñitos por los que trabaja muy duro todos los días, hace algunos años compraron la casa donde ahora viven, sin embargo se encuentran pagándola y su esposo es el encargado de pagar las mensualidades, por lo que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza a cubrir los gastos familiares. De esta forma, Angélica decidió iniciar su propio negocio, empezó a vender algunos productos como fritos, refrescos y poco a poco fue teniendo mas mercancía para vender. Actualmente Angélica es una parte importante en ingreso familiar, pero ella quiere hacer crecer su negocio para dar a sus hijos una educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Además de sus 2 pequeños hijos, Angélica vive con su suegro quien esta enfermo y esta incapacitado para trabajar. Por lo que Ella necesita de un préstamo de $375 USD para comprar mercancía y tener una mayor capacidad de productos para vender en su pequeña miscelánea, deseando obtener mayores ingresos. Angelica y su familia requieren de tu apoyo y agradecen tu cariño.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria del Carmen began her seamstress business since when she was 15 years old, she studied this profession but she could not conclude for limited economic resources, however it has allowed her to has a job and earns some money. Her husband is an employee but his salary is not enough to cover all home necessities, for that reason Maria del Carmen decided to started her own business and contribute with the family expenses. She has 2 children who are her inspiration to work day by day.

She requires a loan of $375 USD to purchase raw material like cloth, thread and more. She and her family need your support to continue financing the studies of her children. Maria del Carmen plans to return the loan in a term of 5 months, she thanks your affection.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Maria del Carmen inicio su negocio de costurera desde que tenía 15 años de edad, estudio esta profesión pero no pudo concluir por falta de recursos económicos, sin embargo le ha permitido trabajar y ganar dinero ejerciéndola. Su esposo es obrero pero su sueldo no le permite cubrir todas las necesidades del hogar, por lo que Maria del Carmen decidió poner su propio negocio y contribuir con los gastos familiares. Tiene 2 hijos quien son su inspiración para trabajar día con día.

Maria del Carmen requiere de un préstamo de $375 USD para comprar insumos como telas, hilo y más. Ella y su familia necesitan de tu apoyo para seguir costeando los estudios de sus hijos. Maria del Carmen planea regresar el préstamo en un término de 5 meses, ella agradece tu cariño.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start organic vegetable farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is an experience baker.  She has been in the bread making for over 15years in the Sekondi-Takoradi metropolis. The appetizing nature of her bakery products attract several clients to her shop to purchase her product especially bread. She has participated in two TEACH lending programmes. She has developed her business and marketing plan. In realising that, she has increased her sales due to the high demand for her products she has decided to increase her production levels hence, the request for KIVA loan of $750 to enable her purchase an additional oven in order to expand her bakery business operations.

loans.use: expands business - purchase second oven

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda has 8 year working in the elaboration of tamales business, which sells in different parts of her community and also she comments that approximately can produce 4,000 tamales monthly. She has one kid and her husband worked as a plumber but his salary is not enough to maintain his family and by the worse he had an accident and he can work again doing what he knew, for this reason, Yolanda had the necessity to do something to live and she as a good housewife and Mexican woman, she knew the art of how to make tamales that also are delicious, so she take advantage of her ability and knowledge and started her business.

Yolanda says that her sons and her husband help her to sell her tamales, and with the pass of the time her business has been growing little by little and her work helps her to maintain and support her family with help and cooperation of all her family, for that reason she is requesting for a loan of USD $ 750 to purchase raw material and big pots because all that she has are not enough to cover her increasing demand, and she appreciated your support and collaboration.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Yolanda tiene 8 años elaborando tamales los cuales los vende en repartiéndolos en diversas partes de su colonia y al mes ella puede hacer aproximadamente 4,000 tamales. Tiene un hijo y su esposo trabajaba de plomero pero con su salario no era suficiente para poder sacar adelante a su familia y luego tuvo un accidente por lo que quedo inhabilitado para trabajar, por ello, Yolanda tuvo la necesidad de hacer algo para subsistir y como buena ama de casa y mexicana, conocía el arte de hacer tamales, los que le salen muy ricos, por ello aprovecho este conocimiento para empezar su negocio de venta de tamales.

Yolanda nos cuenta que su hijo y su esposo le ayudan a vender, y con el paso del tiempo su negocio ha ido prosperando poco a poco y le ha ayudado a poder sacar adelante a su familia en cooperación de todos en el hogar, por ello esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 750 para comprar materia prima y vaporeras por que debido a su demanda con las que cuenta ya no son suficientes.

loans.use: Purchase raw material and big pots

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro started his business 20 years ago because he needed extra incomes due in his preview job where he was working as an employee, he received a very low salary and this income was not enough to support his family expenses, which is composed by two sons and his wife. Thinking the way to obtain extra incomes to support his family and give them a better quality of life, he saw that having your own business could be better that work for another person and he decided to start his own business and also he saw the opportunity in the sales clothes business.

In his business he has the support of his wife and one of his sons and little by little his business was growing so he has to hire a one more people to help him, he feels very happy for his success and he wants continue growing in his business for this reason he is requesting for a loan of USD $1,200 to purchase merchandise, like winter season clothes because he learned that selling season clothes his sales increases, Pedro offers to repay the loan in a term of 6 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Pedro inició su negocio hace 20 años ya que necesitaba un ingreso extra por que en su trabajo anterior en el que trabajaba como empleado, recibía un sueldo muy bajo y no le alcanzaba para darle sustento a su familia que esta conformada por dos hijos y su esposa. Pensando en la forma de cómo obtener los ingresos necesarios para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, se dio cuenta de que un negocio propio podría serle mas redituable y se decidió a abrir su propio negocio viendo en aquel entonces con perspectivas a futuro que el negocio de venta de ropa era muy bueno, decidió entrar en el.

En el negocio le ayuda su esposa y uno de sus hijos, y poco a poco con el tiempo su negocio fue creciendo y tuvo que contratar a una persona más para que le ayude y se siente muy contento de cómo ha podido crecer en el negocio y desea continuar mejorando en el mismo, por ello Pedro requiere de un préstamo de USD $.1,200 para comprar ropa de temporada de invierno ya que en este negocio las buenas ventas son cuando se vende por temporada, así mismo Pedro ofrece pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.en:
Blanca lives in Apodaca, Nuevo Leon with her daughters since many years ago; she has a morning’s tacos sales business outside of her house, which decided to opened because she did not employment nor other income input, so she had the necessity to support her family and her daughters are educated and also they work. Now her daughters will get married and Blanca has not a husband because he died many years ago and her daughters help her in the family expenses, but now with her business and her good sales she could support alone her expenses.

To continue grow, Blanca need a loan of USD $ 200 to purchase pots and other articles to offers more and better quality in her business, and offers to repay this loan in a term of 3 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Blanca vive en Apodaca, Nuevo León con sus hijas desde hace un buen tiempo atrás, tiene el negocio de venta de tacos mañaneros afuera de su domicilio, el cual decidió abrirlo al no tener empleo ni alguna otra fuente de ingreso y teniendo la necesidad de salir adelante con sus hijas, quienes ya son educadas y trabajan. Ahora sus hijas están a punto de casarse y como Blanca no tiene esposo por que quedo viuda años atrás, eran sus hijas las que la apoyaban con los gastos de la casa, pero ahora ella con su negocio y sus buenas ventas ha ido solventado sus gastos por ella misma.

Para poder continuar creciendo Blanca solicita un crédito por USD $200 para invertir en nuevos utensilios y vaporeras, para poder ofrecer mas y mejor calidad en sus comidas, ofreciendo pagar este crédito en 3 meses.

loans.use: Purchase pots and other articles

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana started selling clothes 5 years ago when her husband passed away. Ana used the savings from her husband’s wages as start-up capital for her operation. She sells door-to-door mostly to her friends and the people in her community. She also displays clothes from a window in her house and takes in clients when she is home.

When her husband passed away her three kids were already at mature age. She has two grandchildren who she helps take care of. She needs the loan in order to increase her inventory. Her goal is to fix up her home so she can establish her business there because it is too tiring for her travel door-to-door selling these products.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in clothing to sell during the upcoming holiday season

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a mother of three children. In order to contribute to her family income she sells men’s clothing in her neighborhood. She started in this line of work about 5 years ago with the help of her mother who provided the start up capital. Rosa feels that her work is very important because her husband does not have much job security. He is often hired as a skilled worker in factories but his jobs are never stable and he is always at risk of being unemployed.

Rosa will use this loan in order to buy a new line of products for the upcoming Christmas season. She is very enthusiastic about her sales for this time of year. She hopes that she can fix up her home so that eventually she can run her business from there instead of having to sell at the overly competitive markets.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota travels around her local community selling household products. She uses a tricycle cart where she displays her many products that range from juicers to buckets. Her husband is in a similar line of work only he travels to rural towns to do business because there is much less competition. They have been doing this for about 15 years and they remember starting their business with only $1 in capital (15 years ago a dollar went a long way).

Carlota is 32 years old and has 3 small children. Her and her husband work diligently in order to provide the basic necessities for their kids. Their goal is to have them all finish high school and go for a college degree since they themselves were never able to pursue this dream. Carlota will use the money to buy more goods and cheaper prices from wholesale distributors.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new products at better prices

loans.name: Yadira

texts.en:
Yadira is a decorator for social events such as birthday parties, weddings and baptisms. She makes most of decorations herself with the skills she learned at an institution that sells the supplies for decorations. She has been doing this for about 7 years and she is doing very well. She has no shortage of clients because her work is well liked. She works with her mother as an assistant.

Yadira will use the money from this loan to invest in supplies for her decorations. She is a a very hardworker and she is dedicated to providing a better living for her 2 kids. She also volunteers at the Mifex MERIT Centers as a teacher of our arts and crafts courses.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in supplies for her decorations

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix sells a variety of household products from his tricycle cart. He has been in this line of work for more than 20 years. He began as an assistant for his father in law and moved on to start his own operation with the help of his wife. She is an integral part of the business as she helps him purchase and distribute products. He sells to many of his clients on credit and she also helps him with the collection of payments.

Felix is seeking the loan in order to continue investing in products for the Christmas season such as lights and decorations. He and his wife have 3 kids together. They have been living in their home for over 12 years and they aspire to continue improving it. When they first moved in they lacked most basic services but things have been slowly getting better.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia has a small general store. She sells many different items including women’s clothing, jewelry and toys. She is seeking this loan because she wants to invest in new toys and clothes for the upcoming holiday season. Every year she experiences a boost in sales because of the holiday season and she wants to be prepared this time around. Although she cannot have children due to a medical condition, she helps her sister raise and support her nieces and nephews. She hopes she can continue to grow her business in order to continue to help her family members and make improvements to her store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve her inventory for the holiday season

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa runs a small store where she sells snacks and other groceries. She is asking for a loan in order to buy her products at wholesale quantities. Currently she cannot buy in large amounts and she sees her profits suffer. Her home is located in a very rough sector of Guayaquil. She lives up a dirt hill which makes it very difficult to transport groceries and merchandise, especially in the rainy season when the hill is muddy. Part of her business is made of cement but she aspires to make many more improvements to her home. She and her husband have three kids and their goal is to provide them with a good education.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy her merchandise at wholesale quantities

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
When Jenny was 14 she dropped out of school and started working with plants. She now has her own business that helps her provide for her only son. For more than ten years she has been raising flowers and other plants to sell. She is seeking this loan in order to buy flower pots, fertilizer and seeds. Her dream is to get her highschool degree and begin studying agricultural sciences at a college. She is 25 and is happily married. Her home is currently under construction but should be ready soon.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy flower pots, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica runs a store where she sells music. She started the store with the help of her husband who lost his job and saw the need to create a stable source of income. In Ecuador job security is very low, which is a reason why many families choose to run their own small businesses. Jessica and her husband set up the store in hopes of having some type of economic security. They have 3 children together and they live in a very humble home. With their savings they purchased a small amount of inventory and set up their house as a business. She hopes to buy products in bulk and increase her product line for the upcoming holiday season.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Increase and diversify her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start up a mini-grocery shop.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia has owned her  restaurant for two years. It is a great local shop, and Ms. C. is thankful to be managing the operation. Before opening her own business, Lucia worked with her husband, and they ran a successful shop in the middle of Guayquil. When her husband passed away, she lost not only her best friend but her business partner as well. Lucia got a job cleaning clothes with the hope that, one day, she would be able to open her restaurant once again. Through the encouragement of her niece, this hard-working entrepreneur saved enough money from washing clothes to realize her dream. Every day at 5 a.m. Comedor Lucia opens its doors and closes at 9 p.m.

Lucia is applying for this loan so that she can buy chairs and two tables, so that she can acommodate more customers. Also, she will be able to purchase her raw materials more cheaply, and this will allow her to continue offering great meals at low prices. Lucia is a 52 year-old born and raised in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She lives with her mother and her nephew whom she is raising. Her wish is to move the retaurant from the corner of her house to a new location where customers can come from miles around.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Lucia is applying for this loan so that she can buy chairs and two tables, so that she can acommodate more customers. Also, she will be able to purchase her raw materials more cheaply, and this will allow her to continue offering great meals at low prices.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel lives in San Nicolas de los Garza, Nuevo Leon, and have a unisex beauty salon business called “Divas”, in where she offers to her clients hair cuts, hair paint, etc., she started her business since 5 years ago, and she decided to start because her husband was paying the credit of the house and his incomes were not enough to cover his family expenses. One of her sons had to leave his college studies because Maribel and her husband had not money to pay his studies, for that reason, Maribel decided to support her husband in their family expenses started her business. Now two of her sons are studying at the university, she works alone in her business and also one of her daughters help her in the beauty salon.

Maribel is requesting for a loan of USD $375 USD to purchase hair paint and mirror to her business.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Maribel vive en San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León, tiene una estética unisex llamada “Divas”, en la cual hacen cortes, tintes, peinados, etc., ella inicio con este negocio hace 5 años, y decide ponerlo ya que su esposo estaba pagando la casa y los ingresos no eran suficientes para los gastos de comida y escuelas. Uno de sus hijos tuvo que truncar sus estudios de preparatoria por no poder solventarlos, por lo cual Maribel decide ayudar a los ingresos de la casa poniendo su negocio. Ahora dos de sus hijos ya están cursando la universidad, ella no tiene empleadas en el negocio, una de sus hijas le ayuda en la estética.

Maribel esta solicitando un crédito por USD $375 para poder comprar tintes y espejos para su estética.

loans.use: Purchase hair paint and mirror

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives with her husband and sons in Apodaca, Nuevo Leon. She has a gift and paper sales business called “Emanuel”. Nancy started her business two years ago, because her husband works as a driver but his salary is not enough to support the families expenses like food, dress, education and services from her wife and sons, for this reason she decided to help her husband in the family expenses because her more interesting thing is her sons education.

She do not have employees at the business, she is supporting by her husband and sons in her business, and she is requesting for a loan of $250 USD offering to repay the loan in 3 months, with this loan she will invest in merchandise to her business and need to grow working because her sons are growing and she will need to support them.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Nancy vive con su esposo y sus hijos en Apodaca, Nuevo León. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de papelería y regalos llamado “Emanuel”. Nancy inició con este negocio hace dos años, ya que su esposo trabaja de chofer pero su sueldo no es suficiente para mantener los gastos de comida, vestido, educación y servicios de ella y de sus hijos, es por eso que ella decide apoyar en los gastos ya que lo que más le interesa es la educación de sus hijos.

En el negocio no tiene empleados, la apoyan su esposo y sus hijos para atenderlo, y ella está solicitando un crédito por $250 USD con un plazo de 3 meses para pagar, y con el crédito poder invertir en más mercancía para su negocio, ya que sus hijos están creciendo y necesitará más ingresos para poder cubrir sus necesidades.

loans.name: Rosa Elva

texts.en:
Rosa Elva lives en Apodaca, Nuevo Leon; she has a general store and paper sales business called “Rosy”. She started her business since 4 years ago because she lost her husband and she did not have employment and also she had to maintain her 3 nietas, which two of they are studying at the university and the last one still study at the college. Even Rosa Elva is an old woman; she is very enthusiastic that her nietas finish their studies. She does not have any employee in her business just is helped by her nietas in turn when they have free time to attend the business, her business help her to cover all her expenses and family necessities. Her business are growing because she works very hard and she could obtain success little by little.

Rosa Elva is requesting for a loan of $ 1100 USD to purchase merchandise and grow her business,, and offers to repay this loan in 6 months.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Rosa Elva vive en Apodaca Nuevo León, tiene un negocio D. abarrotes y papelería llamado “Rosy”. ElL. inició este negocio hace más D. 4 años ya que es viuda y no tenia empleo ni alguna otra fuente D. ingresos además se hace cargo D. sus tres nietas, D. las cuales dos D. ellas están cursando sus carreras universitarias y L. otra esta todavía en L. preparatoria. A pesar D. ser una sra. mayor, Rosa Elva está muy entusiasmada en que sus nietas terminen sus estudios universitarios. No tiene empleados en el negocio, solo elL. y sus nietas que le apoyan y se turnan para atender el negocio, este negocio le ha dado soporte para salir adelante. Su negocio ha ido creciendo ya que el trabajo arduo D. elL. y sus nietas lo han logrado poco a poco.

Rosa Elva esta solicitando un préstamo por $ 1100 USD que ofrece pagar en 6 meses, y lo utilizará para invertir en mercancía para L. mercería y así poder incrementar mas sus ventas y crecer en el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Monterrey Nuevo Leon. She is married and has four children. Two years ago she decided to started a small business selling food and handmade products according to the season in order to support her husband and offer to her children a better quality of life. At that time, they had serious economic problems. After two years or continuous work, she now sells Christmas snacks and Christmas-themed gifts. Maria has been able to give her children what they need and with her oldest daughter working with her, the business will be a success.

The Christmas season is coming to a close, and her orders to his Christmas articles are increasing. Maria requires a loan of $925 USD to purchase a sewing machine and raw materials to cover her great demand for her handmade products, and to help her to maintain and grow up her business.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description

María vive en la localidad de Monterrey, Nuevo León, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, hace dos años ella decidió emprender un pequeño negocio vendiendo comidas y elaborando manualidades según la temporada, esto con el fin de apoyar a su esposo en la economía del hogar y brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, ya que se encontraban con algunos problemas en ese momento. Luego de dos años, Maria Victoria continúa con lo que hace tiempo emprendió, ahora tiene un snack y elabora artículos navideños, gracias a esto, Ma.ria ha logrado darles a sus hijos todo lo necesario, con la colaboración activa de su hija mayor en el negocio.

Dado que se acerca las fechas navideñas y los pedidos aumentan, María requiere un préstamo de $925 USD para comprar una maquina de coser y materias primas para hacer frente a la gran demanda de manualidades, ayúdala a mantener y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase a sew machine and raw materials

loans.name: Saliou

texts.en:
This group loan will be shared by the sixteen members of the Jalki Jeg Association, located in the seaside fishing village of Palmarin. Loan funds will be used to invest in better fishing equipment for the group members, including new fishing lines, nets, hooks, sinkers, and floaters, as well as transportation of their catch to market. The group, represented by Saliou S., described their business plan as follows:

“This project intervenes in a zone where fishing is the main way of earning a living. Paradoxically, the fisherman finds it very difficult to obtain the equipment needed to practice his trade. This project aims to find a solution to this state of affairs. The objectives of the loan are: 1) to provide local fishermen with appropriate fishing equipment; and 2) to provide the local population with quality seafood at a good price. Activities include: 1) investment in fishing equipment; 2) selling at the market and on order; and 3) a post-purchase quality guarantee.”

Original French:

\"Le projet intervient dans une zone où la pêche est l’activité principale. Paradoxalement, le pêcheur ne trouve sur place aucuns matériels à sa disposition. Le projet se propose de trouver un correctif à cet état de fait.

Objectifs du Prêt :

- mettre à la disposition des pêcheurs de la localité du matériel adapté et approprié

- fournir à la population locale du matériel de pêche de qualité et à bon prix

Activités :

- avitaillement en matériels de pêche

- vente sur mesure et sur commande

- service de garantie après vente\"

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Fishing equipment purchase

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
My name is Francisca, and I am a salesperson. I have a used clothes store located in the house where I live. I’ve been in this type of business for seven years. I sell my clothes door-to-door. I have a lot of clients in different neighborhoods and communities in this city, Danli. Thanks to this business, I’ve been able to get my family ahead, since I can cover my family’s and other expenses. I need to stock up my store, because with the money I have I can’t buy more and satisfy the current demand.

Loan Use: Purchase two bulks of mixed clothes, a dozen dishes, a dozen cups, etc.

Mi Nombre es Francisca, soy comerciante cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada,ubicado en mi casa de habitación, tengo 7 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, mi sistema de venta es ambulante, tengo mucha clientela en los diferentes barrios y colonias de esta ciudad de Danli, gracias a este negocio e sacado adelante a mi familia ya que puedo cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que con el capital que cuento no me es posible satisfacer la demanda existente.

loans.use: Compra de  2 fardos de ropa Mixta,  una Docena de platos, una docena de tasas y otros

loans.name: Iris Yolanda

texts.en:
My name is Iris and I run a small pulperia ( grocercies, cafe) called \"Pulperia Irias.\" It is loacted in my home and in one of the neighborhoods with the most traffic in the city. I have had my business for several years and the earnings allow me to cover family expenses and other bills. Thanks to this business I can make an income and support my family. I need to stock my store as the Holiday Christmas Season is approaching and the volume of my customers is beginning to increase.

Mi Nombre es Iris, cuento con un pequeño negocio de Pulperia, Operando Bajo el Nombre de Pulperia Irias, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, en una de las colonias mas transitables de la ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y cubrir otros compromisos con los proveedores, grancias a este negocio puedo atender generar ingresos y atender a mi familia, necesito surtir mas tomando en cuenta que se aproxima la Navidad y el Volumen de venta es mayor.

To purchase sugar, rice, salt, butter, soap, toilet paper, coffee, flour, instant soup, sodas

Compra de Azucar, Arroz, Sal, Manteca,Jabon, papel higienico,Cafe,Harina, Sopas instantaneas, refrescos.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena lives in Monterrey City. She is married and has a beautiful daughter. She was previously an employee of a tortilleria where she earned a very low salary; her husband was a mechanic. Everything was good in her house until her husband unfortunately lost his employment, so in this situation they have many economic problems. But Maria Elena, motivated by her love for her daughter and the desire to help her husband, decided to start her own tortilleria with her parent’s help. They have already two years with the small business and the economic adversity in her home is gone. The family incomes are better with her husband\'s help and three other employers that collaborate in the business.

Maria Elena has overcome many difficult obstacles to help her family, and now she needs a scale for her business. For that reason she requires a loan of $250 USD. She and her family will be thankful for you help.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

En la localidad de Monterrey vive Maria Elena, es casada y madre de una hija, ella anteriormente era empleada de una tortillería donde ganaba un sueldo muy bajo, su esposo era mecánico. Todo iba bien en su casa hasta que su esposo desafortunadamente perdió el empleo, ante esta situación se presentaron muchas dificultades económicas. Ma. Elena, motivada por las ganas de sacar adelante a su hija y ayudar a su marido decidió pedir un préstamo para emprender una tortillería con la ayuda de sus padres, quienes se dedican a este mismo oficio. Ya han pasado dos años y la adversidad en su hogar ha pasado, los ingresos familiares han mejorado mucho, con la ayuda de su esposo y otros tres empleadas que colaboran.

Ma. Elena supo como superar los obstáculos y sacar adelante a su familia, ahora necesita una báscula para su negocio, para ello requiere un préstamo de $250 USD, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: Purchase a tilts for her business

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 53 year old woman, she is considered to be a hardworking and responsible person. She started her business because she needs to take care of her children and cover all the home expenses, as her husband died some years ago. She decided to work in the tacos sales business. 4 years ago she started her business and with 6 children to care, Benita works very hard every day; some of them support her in the business necessities and for that reason it has become a family business.

She requires a loan of $925 USD to purchase a comal and inputs that will allow her to increase her production capacity. In this way Benita can increase her sales and revenues to offer her children an education and cover their basic necessities like meals, clothes and more. They thank you help and appreciate.

**(This text has been translated from the following original business description.)

Benita es una mujer de 53 años, se considera ella misma como una persona tenaz y responsable. Inicio su negocio ante la necesidad de tener que ser la única responsable de cubrir los gastos del hogar y su familia. Su esposo murió hace algunos años y esto la llevo a trabajar en la venta de tacos, hace 4 años empezó su negocio y con 6 hijos a su cargo Benita trabaja muy duro todos los días. Algunos de ellos apoyan a las necesidades del negocio, por lo que este se ha convertido en un negocio familiar.

Ella requiere de $925 USD para comprar un comal e insumos que le permitan aumentar su capacidad de producción, de esta manera Benita quiere aumentar las ventas e incrementar sus ingresos para ofrecer a sus hijos una educación y cubrir sus necesidades básicas.

loans.use: Purchase a comal and inputs

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.en:
ENGLISH TRANSALTION
Hello My name is Catherine cuento.   I run  a small business of sale of firewood and tortillas, located in my house for several years.  This activity generates income to me to cover my personal expenses and other commitments, I am unmarried mother and thanks this business I have been able to move ahead to help my children.  All my children are married and I am single.

ORIGINAL SPANISH
Hola Mi nombre es Catalina cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de leña y elaboracion de tortillas, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion desde hace varios años, actividad que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos personales  y otros compromisos, soy madre soltera y gracias este negocio  he podido sacar adelante a mis hijos, todos mis hijos  se casaron y yo he quedado sola.

loans.use: Compra de leña de roble,leña de ocote y maiz

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is an honest, hardworking and friendly person. She was born in Chiapas, Oaxaca but at the moment lives in Garcia, Nuevo Leon. Blanca is working in the food sales business. Her business is located near a refinery company very far from the city. Her clients are workers from this company, and they are accustomed to having their lunches in the company, which means that nobody go home to eat. For that reason Blanca receives every day more clients and her sales are increasing. She wants to offer a better service and a better quality of her meals.

Blanca needs a loan of $1,375 USD to increase the quantity of her products that she offers in her small business, like snacks and a bigger variety of foods. She hopes for your support and she plans to return the loan in a term of 6 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Blanca es una persona honesta, trabajadora y amigable, ella nació en Chiapas Oaxaca pero actualmente vive en G. Nuevo León. Blanca se dedica a comercio de comidas, particularmente su negocio se encuentra afuera de una empresa de refinería afuera de la cuidad y sus clientes son los trabajadores que pertenecen a esta empresa. Ellos están acostumbrados a comer en la misma empresa por lo que a Blanca cada día percibe mas clientes y sus ventas se están incrementando. Ella quiere brindar un mejor servicio y una mejor calidad de sus comidas.

Blanca necesita de un préstamo de $1375 USD para aumentar la cantidad de productos que ofrece en su pequeño negocio, como botanas y una mayor variedad de comidas. Ella espera tu apoyo y planea regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 meses.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of her products

loans.name: Maria Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is 28 years old living in Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon. She has 2 beautiful sons and for that reason she works hard every day and she tries to give them the best from herself. She considered is to be a very harmonious, friendly and hard-working person. Her husband is a mechanic but his salary is lower and not enough to cover all the family expenses, so Rebeca decided to start her own business. Now she is running shoes by catalogue sales business, from that way Rebeca receivesan extra income for her family and can assist and cover all the basic necessities from her family like food and studies.

She needs a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise and have an stock of her products, from that way Rebeca has the opportunity to have more product and has a bigger variety of shoes. She expects this Christmas season her sales will be better than other years, she hopes for your help and generosity.

** (This text has been translated from the following original business description.)

Rebeca tiene 8 años de vivir en Cadereyta, Nuevo León, tiene 2 hijo pequeñitos por los que todos los días tiene que trabajar y dar lo mejor de ella misma. Se caracteriza como una persona muy armoniosa, amigable y trabajadora, su esposo es un mecánico automotriz pero su sueldo es insuficiente para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Así que Rebeca decidió iniciar su propio negocio y se dedica a vender zapatos por catalogo, de este modo Rebeca percibe un ingreso extra para su familia con el que se pueden atender y cubrir las necesidades básicas de la familias como la comida y los estudios.

Ella necesita un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar mercancía y tenerla en existencia, de esta manera Rebeca tiene la oportunidad de tener más producto y vender una mayor cantidad de zapatos, ella espera que en esta temporada de Navidad su ventas se incrementen al doble y espera de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Van Tha

texts.en:
C. Van Tha is 37 years old and he works as a motor taxi driver in the city. He typically earns about $3.75 a day. His wife sells rice in the market and earns about $3 per day. C. Van Tha and his wife have two daughters and one son. Their oldest daughter works in a factory and earns about $60 per month. Their younger daughter attends school, and their young son stays at home. 

C. Van Tha is requesting a loan of $700. He would like to use $500 of the loan to change his motor bike into a motor bike that pulls a passenger cart, called a tuk tuk. The tuk tuk can hold more people, which allows for a potential increase in income. He would like to use the other $200 to make repairs on their home. 

After he is able to finish paying off this loan, C. Van Tha would like to borrow again to help his oldest daughter set up a stand in the market. She would like to have a stand where she can sell clothing, and would much rather do this than work in the factory. C. Van Tha is excited about the opportunities that this loan will provide to him and his family, and is happy to be able to increase his business and repair his home.

loans.use: Change motorbike into tuk tuk, and repair home

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Tharit

texts.en:
S. Tharit is a 27 year old husband and father of two. He works on home construction and earns about $5 per day. He also does work in home repairs and maintenance. His wife, Heng Mom, stays at home with their young son and daughter. 

S. Tharit is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike. This motorbike will provide his family with much needed transportation. It will also allow him to get to different job sites more easily. S. Tharit sees this loan as an opportunity to improve the standard of living of his whole family, and he is excited about being able to better provide for them in the future.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
V. Sina is a 26 year old stay at home mother. Her husband is a security guard at a local hotel and he earns a salary of $80 per month. He also earns a service fee of $10 per day, and earns an additional $10 each Sunday. V. Sina and her husband have two young children, a son and a daughter.

V. Sina\'s home is in very poor condition and she is requesting a loan for $900 to use to repair her home. She wants to provide her family with a safe and strong home, and she believes this loan will help her do that. In the future, when her children are older, V. Sina would like to get a job at the same hotel where her husband works.

loans.use: Repair home

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis Q. has been an auto repairman for 20 years. He learned the trade from a good friend of his, and after practicing for years, he decided to open his own shop. Although Luis had no experience running a business before, he had the insight to know that it would require savings. His first strategic purchase was a paint machine, and from there Luis was able to get more money to launch a fully-funtioning store out of his home. When business is slow, Mr. Q. is still able to turn a profit by contracting custom orders with clients, instead of just servicing the walk-in customers. 

Luis is applying for this credit so that he can revamp his tools and purchase raw materials like paints, scrap metal, airbrushes, tape, and a welding machine. His goal is to bring all of the tools in-house so that he does not have to go out and buy new ones every time a first-time customer comes in. 

He is a 41 year-old entrepreneur, father, and husband who is very dedicated to his work. Luis’ wife even helps out in the shop, selling seasonal goods that she makes. She also educates their young daughter, manages the household, and hopes that one day the body shop business blossoms into something larger.

loans.use: Luis is applying for this credit so that he can revamp his tools and purchase raw materials like paints, scrap metal, airbrushes, tape, and a welding machine.

loans.name: Sindy Yessenia

texts.en:
My name is Sindy and I am known in my neighborhood for the rich snacks I make. I have had my business for 5 years and I decided to run it from my home because I have a school not far away and most of my customers are school children. I also sell seasonal fruits and food to visitors of the school and to those who pass through the area. Now I would like to make nacatamales (specific type of tamale), which is a very traditional food of my country, usually eaten during the Christmas season. I already have several orders to complete and to do this I need to buy a lot of ingredients.

Me llamo Sindy y en mi colonia me conocen por las ricas golosinas que preparo, tengo mi negocio desde hace cinco años, decidi instalarlo en mi casa de habitacion ya que a la par tengo una escuela y mis mayores clientes son los niños de esta escuela, tambien vendo algunas frutas de temporada y comida a personas particulares que visitan la escuela o pasan por esta zona. Ahora quiero comenzar a preparar nacatamales que es la comida mas tradicional en mi pais para la navidad y ya tengo varios encargos que necesito cubrir, es por eso que necesito comprar bastante material para prepararlos.

loans.use:
To purchase tortillas, chicken, sodas, breads, beans, butter and other items

Compra de tortillas, pollo, refrescos, panes, frijoles, mantequilla y otros.

loans.name: Enma  Lili

texts.en:
My name is Enma Lili. I have a store where I sell vegetables, located in the City Market in this city. I’ve been in this type of business for several years. It gives me the income to cover my family’s expenses and my kids’ education. Thanks to this business, I can offer my kids an education. Currently, I need to stock up my business considering that Christmas is coming up, and sales go up during this time.

Loan Use: Purchase tomatoes, chili peppers, potatoes, yucca, carrots, cabbage, onions, bananas, etc.

Mi nombre el Enma Lili, cuento con un negocio de venta de veduras ubicado en el Mercado Municipal de esta ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y de estudio de mis hijos,gracias a este negocio puedo darles educacion a mis hijos, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio, tomando en cuenta que se aproxima la Navidad y el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: Compra de tomates,chiles,papas, yuca,sanahoria, repollo,cebollo,patastes, bananos y otros.

texts.en:

I have several years experience and the income I generate covers family expenses and other bills. I need to stock my store as the Christmas season is approaching and my sales will increase, and by stocking my store I will be able to offer a better service to my customers.

Hola Mi nombre es Victor Sindolfo, cuento con una pulperia de en el centro de mi comunidad,operando bajo el Nombre de Pulperia Norma, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares y demas compromisos con los proveedores, necesito surtir mi negocio ya que se aproxima la Navidad y las ventas aumentan y de esa forma brindar un mejor servicio a mis clientes.

loans.use:
To purchase rice, beans, sugar, butter, ham, pork, beef, chicken and other item.

Compra de Arroz, Frijoles, Azucar,Mantenca, jabon, Carnes de cerdo y Res, Pollo y otros

Mi Nombre es Saul, cuento con una pequeña sastreria en mi casa de habitacion, ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, actualmente necesito mas material ya se aproximan las clausuras y la Navidad para aprovechar al maximo estas epocas.

To buy khaki fabric, Sasimir, pins, needles, gloves, buttons, thread and other items

Now I need to buy a freezer to keep my products in as the one I have is in poor condition.

Mi Nombre es Alvaro, tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de helados (ice cream) el que distribuyo en una bicicleta de manera ambulante en toda mi comunidad y aldeas vecinas, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad y buena clientela la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y educacion de mis hijos, actualmente necesito comprar un frizer para guardar el producto ya que el que actualmente tengo esta en mal estado.

loans.use:
To purchase ice cream and a freezer

Compra de ice cream, y un Frizer

I am a sinlge mother and I have one son, who thanks to this business I have been able to put through his fourth year of medical school at the University. I now need to stock my business with the approaching Christmas holiday season in order to offer a wider variety of foods to my clientel.

Mi Nombre es Juana R., cuento con un negocio de Pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitacion, desde hace varios años, tengon buena clientela por la atención y la ubicación de mi negocio, soy madre soltera, tengo un hijo y gracias a este negocio he podido sacar adelante a mi hijo que actualmente cursa 4to año de medicina en la Universidas, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se aproxima la Navidad para poder ofrecer mayor variedad a mis cliente.

Hello, my name is Ada and I run a pulperia ( groceries/cafe),called \\\"Pulperia Angie,\\\" located in the center of my community. texts.en:
My name is Pastor S. and I am a businessman with a small business that sells over the counter medecins, which I sell in a manner of a traveling salesman on my bike. I have had my business for several years and my earnings help to cover family expenses and my children\'s education.

Mi Nombre es Pastor S., mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de medicinas populares, las que destribuyo en una bicicleta de manera ambulante,tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y de educación de mis hijos.

Compra de medicinas Populares tales como: Dolovitalgia, Neurobion, Dolo Medox, Animo Petil,Dalla Mineral, Calsi Fran, Cerebro Fox y otros

Hi, I’m Elda Lucia. I have a used clothes store located downtown in the city where I live. I’ve been working in this type of business for several years, and it gives me income to contribute to my family’s expenses. That way, I can offer better opportunities to my family. Currently, I need to stock up my store since sales go up during the Christmas season.

Loan Use: Purchase one bulk of children’s clothes, one bulk of mixed clothes, one bulk of linens, one bulk of children’s winter clothes

Hola soy Elda Lucia, cuento con un negocio de ropa usadada, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para comtribuir en los gastos familiares y de esa forma poder ofrecer mejores oportunidades a mi familia, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio ya que para epoca de Navidad el volumen de venta es mayor.

Hello, my name is Blanca Nieves and I am a business woman in the area of food sales, the name of the store is \"Comedor y Golosinas Vida,\" or \"Life Eatery and Snacks.\" It is loacted in the center of my city, and I have been running this business for several years. The store allows me to create an income that covers the family expenses and other bills, giving a much better standard of living to my family.

Hola mi Nombres el Blanca Nieves, soy comerciante cuento con un negocio de venta de comida, llamado Comedor y Golosinas Vida, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad,tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que permite generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, logrando asi un mejor nivel de vidad para mi familia.
