texts.en:
My name is Teresa de Jesus R.. I make and sell tortillas. I’ve had my business for four years. I have several clients, since I distribute my product all over my community. My kids help me distribute. My income allows me to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to produce more, so I can remodel my store (located in my home), and provide good education for my kids.

Loan Use: Purchase corn flour, lime, salt, wood, water.

Mi nombre es Teresa de Jesus R. me dedido a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años y mi clientela es muy buena ya que reparto mi producto en mi colonia, tengo la ayuda de mis hijos para repartir mi producto, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio (casa de habitacion) y darles un buen estudio a mis hijos.

My tortillas sales generate an income enough to support my family and my goal is to increase production so as to increase sales. With the added earnings I would remodel my home and give a better education to my children.

Mi nombre es Guadalupe H. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que tengo mi lugar de venta cerca de una empresa, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi produccion para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y darles un mejor estudio a mis hijos.

Mi nombre es Reyna A. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva como ser pantalones, camisas para caballero, blusas, vestidos, faldas para dama, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años y mis clientes son muy buenos porque yo personalmente los atiendo y mis precios de venta son muy comodos, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios para tener una mayor venta y asi obtener mayores ganancias y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa y darles un buen estudio a mis hijos.

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

texts.en:
My name is Jose Arnulfo. I have a passenger transportation vehicle in the area of El Paraiso/Las Manos, on the border with Nicaragua. I’ve been in this business for several years now. With the income, I support my family and my kids’ education. With the income I get from the bus I’ve been able to have my kids get their high school degree, and I’ve improved my home.

I currently need to invest in the transportation vehicle, since it has depreciated with time. In order to provide a better service, I need to repair it.

Loan Use: Repair and maintenance of the vehicle: floor change, seat covers, replace windshield, front and back repair and purchase of wheels.

Mi nombre el Jose Arnulfo, Cuento con una unidad de transporte de pasajeros con ruta de El Paraiso Las Manos Frontera con Nicaragua, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia incluyendo la educacion de mis hijos, con los ingresos que me genera este autobus he lagrado que mis hijos obtengan su titula de educacion Media, tambien he mejorado mi vivienda. Actualmente necesito invertir en la unidad de transporte ya que con el tiempo se depresian y para brindar un mejor servicio necesito realizar algunas reparaciones.

Mi nombre es Alba V. me dedico a la produccion y venta de golosinas como ser tortillas con quesillo, pan con frijoles, panqueques, baleadas, enchiladas, tacos, emparedados, tortas, platanos fritos, chilaquiles, tajaditas de platano, sopas, almuerzos y desayunos, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que estoy ubicada cerca de una estacion de buses, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios y asi tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio y darles un buen estudio a mis dos hijos.

loans.name: Santos Luisa

My name is Santos E., and I make and sell shoes for ladies, gentlemen and children. I’ve had my business for five years. I have several clients since I am the supplier for a store located downtown. My business’ income allows me to support my home and family. My goal is to increase my inventory, so I can make more shoes. I would then buy tools to make shoes, remodel my workshop, and give my two daughters a better education.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatríz is a very tenacious and hard-working woman. She lives in Garcia Nuevo Leon. She separated from her husband many years ago and she is living in a small house of Infonavit. This kind of house is acquired with the government’s help, however she needs to pay for the house every month. For that reason Bety began her own business to afford the monthly payments of her house. She works with the handworks, such as home decorations and other novelties made with artificial and natural flowers.

Beatríz needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase materials such as flowers, flowers vases and much more. This will allow her to make her decorations more attractive and have greater sales. Bety hopes this Christmas season her sales will increase and she wants to complete the monthly payments onher house. For that reason she requires your help and generosity. In a term of 5 months she plans to pay the loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description

Beatriz es una mujer muy tenaz y trabajadora, vive en García Nuevo León. Hace algún tiempo se separo de su esposo y se fue a vivir a una casa pequeña de Infonavit. Este tipo de casas se adquieren con ayuda del gobierno, sin embargo se van pagando a través de los años; por esta razón Bety inicio su propio negocio para pagar las mensualidades de su casa. Ella trabaja en las manualidades, tales como adornos del hogar o algunas otras novedades hechas con flores artificiales, naturales.

Beatriz necesita de $375 USD para la compra de materiales como flores, bases para flores y mucho más, esto le permite hacer mas atractivos su adornos y que tener mayores ventas. Bety espera que esta temporada navideña sus ventas se incrementen y desea terminar de pagar su casa, por lo que requiere de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase materials as flowers, flowers bases and much more.

Thanks to this business, I can help my daughter pay for her education, she’s in the third year of Psychology at the public University. I need to stock up my store, since Christmas is coming up and sales go up.

Loan Use: Purchase bulk of mixed categorized clothes, bulk of jackets, bulk of kids’ clothes.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.en:
Gonzalo has worked in shoe manufacturing since he was 17 years old. He is a modest, simple and very hard-working person. When he began his business, he had a small industrial sewing machine and few tools. However, over time, Gonzalo has had the opportunity to acquire more tools for his job. He has a 14 year-old daughter and he says that one of his satisfactions is how his daughter grows and studies. Gonzalo wants to grow his business in order to offer his daughter a university career and a better quality of life.

He needs a loan of $650 USD to purchase an industrial machine, which let make better quality shoes in greater quantities. Gonzalo requires your support to grow his business because at the moment his business has employees and, thus, several families that depend on the success of his business. These families thank your affection and generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Gonzalo se dedica a la fabricación de calzado desde que tenia 17 años, el es una persona humilde, sencilla y muy trabajadora. Cuando comenzó su negocio contaba con una pequeña maquina y pocas herramientas, sin embargo a través del tiempo, Gonzalo ha tenido la oportunidad de comprar un poco mas de herramienta para trabajar. Tiene una hija de 14 años de edad y dice que verla crecer y estudiar es una de sus principales satisfacciones. Gonzalo quiere hacer crecer su negocio para ofrecer a su hija una carrera universitaria y una mejor calidad de vida.

El necesita de $650 USD para comprar una maquina industrial, la cual agiliza la elaboración del calzado y le permite producir una mayor cantidad. Gonzalo requiere de tu apoyo para hacer crecer su negocio ya que actualmente cuenta con un empleado y existen más familias que dependen del éxito de su negocio. loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.en:
Maria Concepcion is a very hard-working woman, with 3 children to take care. She needs to work every day to help with the family expenses. She is married to Daniel who works as truck driver; he earns an unstable salary and this makes it more difficult to cover the education and expenses for their three children. She decided to start her own business 2 years ago, which is a homemade foods sales business. Her work place is in her own kitchen, where she cooks different Mexican foods and offers them among her neighbors and well-known people.

Maria Concepcion is recognized in her neighborhood by her excellent ability to cook and the next Christmas season she hopes to have a great demand for her Mexican foods. For that reason she requires a loan of $275 USD to purchase raw materials that allows her to increase her production capacity and sales. She hopes to be able to cover her Christmas demands. Maria Concepcion needs your support and your generosity.

Ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace 2 años, el cual consiste en vender comidas caseras. Concepción es reconocida en su barrio por su excelente habilidad para cocinar y esta próxima temporada navideña ya cuenta con una gran demanda que desea sus comidas, por lo que requiere de un préstamo de $275 USD para la compra de insumos que le permitan aumentar la capacidad de producción y venta, ella espera hacer frente a la alta demanda navideña. Elda G. Pescina has been working for 2 years in food sales, of tacos and burritos.

Her business is going very well, but the transporting the trailer has been hard, since she doesn't have a car to tow it and has to ask favors from friends and family. This has become a difficult situation, so she is requesting a loan of $15,000.00 to buy a van to be able to tow her food stand more easily. Mrs. Elda plans to pay for it in the timeframe of one year. loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel V. has 20 years of experience making and selling sandals. He inherited his shop from his father and still remembers being a young boy working in the shop. Over time he had a family of his own and separated himself somewhat from his father. During that time, Daniel started working in masonry with the help of his wife and children. Unfortunately, Daniel’s father passed away, and he is responsible for managing both businesses. Mr. V. reports that he has been able to earn enough to feed, clothe, and educate his family, but he has grander visions for growing his two businesses. This hard-working entrepreneur opens up shop every day a 8am and closes at 8pm. 

Daniel needs this loan so that he can purchase material for sandal-making like leather and thread. He is a 38-year old married man from Guayaquil, Ecuador, and he has three beautiful children. Daniel’s wife mainly takes care of the children and household duties like laundry and cleaning, but she does a fair share of the work at “Sandalias Daniel.” Daniel’s goal is to become a large distributor of sandals in Ecuador by consistently growing his venture and creating word of mouth about his great products.

loans.use: Daniel needs this loan so that he can purchase material for sandal-making like leather and thread

loans.name: Elena And Boris

texts.en: Elena Cimpoeis and her husband Boris are both 49 years old with a son and daughter. Elana is eager to show off the different animals and products which comprise her business. Their plot of land is approximately one hectare or 2.5 acres. This past year they planted corn to make into corn flour, sunflowers to press into oil, and their own orchard to produce their house wine. They have about 30 chickens, 2 pigs and have recently bought a new horse. Elena\'s passion is obvious in the four different pictures.  The first is of the corn which she grows. These seeds are high quality and she makes sure to save the best kernels for the following year to replant. The second picture is of her new horse. Last year their horse had an accident while tied up to the same tree. Also shown are the leftover corn from a 500 kilo harvest and the milled flour. They milled half and are saving the other half for the spring time when the price of cornmeal will be higher. She would like to take out a loan for working capitol and to diversify her business - to purchase and begin growing rabbits, for which she already has cages and many ideas.

loans.use: To purchase rabbits to grow for re-sale.

payments.comment: This was Elana's and Boris's 2nd loan which they have payed back in full.  Business is going great for the two! Since they saved their corn to sell at the peak of the winter time, which gave them the most profit for the entire year. They have earned enough to repay their loan in full plus have additonal money for their family. They have decided to keep the rabbits for their own use instead of trying to sell them at the market, for now.  They have decided to wait a while to see if they want to take out credit again but if they decide to borrow money again Microinvest/Kiva will be ready to offer them another loan.

loans.name: Luísa

texts.en:
Luisa Augusto L., age 30, native of Matola, has two children and is currently a second wife. She did not have the chance to study because she lost her father at an early age, when she was just nine years old. As her mother\'s main work was with basic agriculture, her circumstances did not allow her to continue to support her daughter\'s education expenses, since she depended only on the sale of the products she produced in the fields.

She had to marry very early, and soon started to sell goods in the informal market. She had many problems in her first marriage, she was a victim of domestic violence, and decided to go back to her mother\'s house. She later met her current husband there, and helped him to open another business where she sells basic goods and soft drinks.

Through a friend, she found out about HLUVUKU and requested a loan to increase the volume of her business, in order to meet the demand of the market, since her store was the only one in the community.

With the income, she supports the education and health expenses for herself and her two children, and she provides the nearly five hundred families in her community with products.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localizaçao: Bairro2 Boane

Cliente: Luisa Augusto L.

Sector: Comercio

Montante: 15.000.00mtn ( 580 US$)

Aplicaçao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade

Inicio : 27/11/2006

Periodo: 14 meses

Luisa Augusto L. de 30 anos de idade, natual da Matola, tem dois filhos e actualmente segunda mulher, nao teve oportunidade de estudar porque perdeu o seu pai muito cedo quando tinha apenas nove anos e como a sua mae dedicava-se a gricultura rudimentar como actividade principal nao teve condicoes suficientes para continuar a suportar as despesas de educacao da filha, pois dependia apenas da venda dos produtos que produzia na machamba.

Foi obrigada a casar muito cedo, logo comecou a vender num mercado informal, teve muitos problemas no seu primeiro casamanto, era vitima de vilencia domestica, decidiu voltar a casa da sua mae, onde tempos depois conhaceu o actual marido que o ajudou a abrir um outro negocio onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade e refrigerantes.

Atraves da amiga soube da existencia da HLUVUKU e solicitou um emprestimo para aumentar o seu volume de negocio de modo a responder a demanda do mercado uma vez que a sua loja e unica na comunidade.

Com os rendimentos suporta as despesas de educacao e saude dela propria e dos filhos e abastece com produtos aos cerca de quinhentas familias da sua comunidade.

loans.use: To buy food and soft drink

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Andrei And Angela

texts.en: Andrei C. is the village of Pruteni\'s veterinarian. The village of Pruteni is a farming community, spread out over a vast area. With a population of 1,000 people, almost all with family farms, Andrei has a great deal of animals to care for. While Andrei is working he relies on Angela, his wife, to take care of their 2 children and their animals. They have many animals and look to raising and selling animals to supplement the family income.  Around their house they have 1 horse, 3 cows, 3 sheep, 4 pigs and 50 chickens and ducks. They would like a loan to repair their barn to shelter the animals for the coming wintertime.

loans.use: To repair a barn to shelter their animals from the wintertime.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel M., age 38, was born in Maputo, daughter of an unknown father, and of a mother with 5 children. She grew up with her mother, didn't have an opportunity to study, and later married as her husband's second wife.

She has a stand for selling basic goods and soft drinks, and found out through other women about the existence of HLUVUKU, which provides financial services to low income people. She went to them to request a loan to reinforce the stock of the business under her management.

With this loan request, she plans to reinforce the stock of her basic goods and soft drinks to meet the demand during the Christmas and new year holiday season, in order to better serve the clientele in her community of around 160 families. With this business, in addition to providing a high quality service in her community, she supports the expenses of her family with five (5) members, including herself, and she employs one (1) other woman who is a widowed mother of 4 children.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localizaçao: Bairro2 Boane

Cliente: Isabel M.

Sector: Comércio

Montante: 20.000,00MTN (769 US$)

Aplicaçao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade

Inicio : 30/11/2006

Periodo: 14 meses

Isabel M., 38 anos de idade nasceu em Maputo, filha de um pai incógnito, mãe de 5 filhos cresceu sob responsabilidade da mãe, não teve oportunidade de estudar, mais tarde casou com um homem polígamo e passou a ser a segunda mulher.

Possui uma barraca de venda de produtos de 1ª necessidade e refrigerantes, em conversa com outras senhoras tomou conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU que providencia serviços financeiros à pessoas de baixa renda, tendo se dirigido nela para solicitar em empréstimos para reforçar o stock do estabelecimento comercial sob sua gestão.

Com este pedido de empréstimo pretende reforçar o stock de produtos de 1ª necessidade e refrigerantes para responder a demanda da quadra festiva natal e fim do ano de modo a servir da melhor forma a clientela da sua comunidade com cerca de 160 famílias. Com este negocio, para além de providenciar um serviço de alta qualidade a sua comunidade, ela sustenta as despesas da família com cinco (5) membros incluindo ela própria e emprega uma (1) outra mulher viúva mãe de 4 filhos.

loans.use: To increase the food stock

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M., age 66, was born in Marracuene, one of the districts in Maputo Province. He did not have the opportunity to study because his parents required him to work in the fields at the beginning of the day. When he was young, he left the district where he was born and went in search of a job, and got his first one at a ceramics company by the name of Umpala, which coincidentally was also the name of the neighborhood. He worked at this company until reaching retirement and is now a successful businessman in the neighborhood.

He has a business that is very well accepted and successful, since it is the only commercial enterprise in the neighborhood of around 250 families.

With this loan request, he plans to reinforce the stock of basic products to meet the demand during the Christmas and new year holidays, in order to better serve the clientele in his community of around 250 families.

With this business, in addition to providing a high quality service in his community, he also supports the expenses of his family with five (5) members, including himself, his wife, a child infected with HIV/AIDS and two orphaned nephews, and he employs one (1) recently married young man.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localizaçao: Umpala, Boane Cliente: Samuel M. Sector: Comércio Montante: 15.000,00MTN (577 US$) Aplicaçao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade Inicio : 30/11/2006 Periodo: 13 meses

Samuel M., 66 anos de idade nasceu em Marracuene um dos distritos da Província do Maputo, não teve oportunidade de estudos porque os seus pais obrigavam-lhe a trabalhar na machamba quando iniciasse o dia. Quando jovem deixou o distrito que lhe viu nascer e foi a busca de emprego, tendo conseguido o seu primeiro numa empresa de cerâmica de nome Umpala que por coincidência é nome do bairro. Trabalhou nesta empresa ate atingir a reforma e hoje comerciante de sucesso no bairro.

Tem um negocio com muita aceitação e bem sucedido, por ser o único empreendimento comercial no bairro com cerca de 250 famílias.

Com este pedido de empréstimo pretende reforçar o stock de produtos de 1ª necessidade para responder a demanda da quadra festiva natal e fim do ano de modo a servir da melhor forma a clientela da sua comunidade com cerca de 250 famílias.

Com este negocio, para além de providenciar um serviço de alta qualidade a sua comunidade, ele sustenta as despesas da família com cinco (5) membros incluindo ele próprio, sua esposa, um filho infectado pelo HIV/AIDS e dois sobrinhos órfãos e emprega um (1) jovem recém casado.

loans.use: To buy products to respond the clients needs

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Tania K. from Vratza is 34 years old. She is married and has a daughter. Her sister Silvia Dimitrova is 36 years old. She is also married and has a son.

Together Tania and Silvia have an advertising agency. They started their business three years ago because of their mother who lent them some money. Both sisters used this money to rent an office and to buy some software and hardware.

Now both of the two sisters are strongly motivated to develop this business. Tania’s and Silvia’s husband also have own business. One of them is a mechanic and has an own garage and the other keeps an engineering store.

Both sisters need about $ 800 to buy some materials for their business

loans.use: To byu materials for the business

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina lives with her husband and her 15 years old son in Vratza. She graduated economics in university and has worked as an economist expert in a state company for 12 years.

After liquidation of this company Valentina and her husband tried some different businesses and now they keep a coffee shop in one of the city quarters.

Now their coffee shop needs some repairs and Valentina wants to change the furniture. She needa 12 tables, 60 chairs and a new bar plot. The loan amount is $ 1 800.

loans.use: To buy new furniture for the cafe

loans.name: Dimitar

texts.en:
Dimitar R. is 60 years old. His whole professional life was in the field of catering. After he retired two years ago he decided to start a little business. He rented a hall on Municipal Building of the city and found a coffee and refreshments bar.

Clients of his bar are all the municipal officials, official guests and many casual visitors. Dimitar R. needs a new professional coffee making machine and some kitchen equipment. He applies for a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: For a new coffee machine and kitchen equipment

loans.name: Stanimira

texts.en:
Stanimira J. is 32 years old and lives in Bourgas. She is a fashion designer by education and her interests have always been in the field of fashion. In 2001 she found a shop on the city trade center and started her business.

She is competitive because of the quality and the low prices of clothes she sells. Stanimira is married and has a two years old. Boy. Her husband is a professional driver and spends most of his worktime abroad.

Stanimira J. needs to supply winter clothes for her shop and she applyes for a $ 1 200 loan.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Gustavo is very committed to his family, especially to his wife because she could not have children due to health problems. However, Gustavo\'s optimism as great as his love for his wife. For this reason he works repairing household electronics and appliances and has his own business. Gustavo has 30 years of experience repairing this kind of products, but at the moment his job has become more difficult. For this reason he needs tools and spare parts from these kind of products.

Gustavo needs a loan of $475 USD to purchase tools and parts. It allows him to continue fixing the electronics products and from that way he can obtain an income to cover all his family necessities.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Don Gustavo es una persona muy entregada a su familia, especial mente a su esposa ya que no pudieron tener hijos debido a que ella tiene problemas de salud. Sin embargo, el optimismo de Don Gustavo es tan grande como el amor a su esposa. Por lo que trabaja en un taller de reparaciones de aparatos electrodomésticos. Don Gustavo tiene 30 años de experiencia en la reparación de este tipo de aparatos, pero en estos tiempos el trabajo se ha hecho más difícil, por lo que necesita de herramienta y chatarra de estos aparatos, porque de esta manera el extrae las piezas que aun puede utilizar para sus composturas.

Don Gustavo necesita un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar herramientas y chatarra. Esto le permite seguir arreglando los aparatos electrodomésticos y de esta manera seguir obteniendo un ingreso para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, en este caso el y las de su esposa.

loans.use: Purchase tools and scrap

loans.name: Catarino

texts.en:
Catarino lives in Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo Leon, he has 2 very young boys for which he works very hard every day. He is working in clothes sales and offers them in popular markets, his two boys help him in the business, and for this reason his business has become a way to be close with them. He wants to provide them a good education and he knows to get it, he needs to work every day.

Catarino requires a loan of $1825 USD to purchase merchandise because this Christmas season, he hopes increase his sales and also he can increase his incomes. He just wants to continue paying her boy’s studies and he and his family expect your support and generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Catarino vive en Sabinas Hidalgo Nuevo León, tiene 2 hijos muy jóvenes por los cuales trabaja muy duro todos los días. Se dedica a la venta de ropa en pulgas o mercados populares, sus dos hijos trabajan en el negocio, por lo que este se ha convertido en un medio mas para que Catarino tenga una relación más cercana con ellos. El desea proporcionarles una buena educación y sabe que para conseguirlo necesita trabajar todos los días.

Catarino requiere de un préstamo de $1825 USD para comprar mercancía debido que esta temporada navideña, el espera un aumento en sus ventas y de así incrementar sus ingresos, de esta forma seguirá pagando los estudios de sus hijos. El y su familia esperan tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor lives in Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo Leon; he has a small groceries store which started since 10 years ago with the purpose to have an income and cover all his family expenses like, foods, house and studies. He considered by himself an entrepreneur and very disciplined person. He has demonstrated the kind of person who he is for many years and at the moment his small groceries store is the unique way that provides him an income and a job; so his business has allowed him to cover all the basic necessities from his family as well.

Victor needs a loan of $475 USD to purchase merchandise and he could have a greater variety of products and have a bigger capacity of sales. Victor and his family require your support and generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Víctor vive en Sabinas Hidalgo Nuevo León; tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual inicio hace 10 años con el propósito de tener un ingreso y cubrir los gastos de su familia, principalmente la comida, una casa y estudios. Se considera así mismo como una persona emprendedora y muy disciplinada. Esto ha demostrado Víctor desde hace muchos años, ya que actualmente su pequeña tienda de abarrotes es el único medio de trabajo para el y este le ha permitido cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.

Víctor necesita de un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar mercancía y de esta forma el puede aumentar la variedad de productos en su tienda y tener una mayor capacidad de ventas. Víctor y su familia requieren de tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.en:
Eleuterio is a very hard-working person, day by day he gets up with many desires to continue supporting to his family, some years ago he lost one of his boys, who was working in the USA. An unexpected call warns him that his son had died due a cerebral spill; Eleuterio did many expenses to bring his son\\\'s body to Mexico. However, he never loses the hopes to continue supporting his family. He began his own business some years ago in front the necessity to cover all the family expenses and provide an education to his boys.

He requires a loan of $475 USD to purchase merchandise and from that way he could increase the capacity of sales from his business, with this loan Eleuterio hopes increase his incomes and continue supporting to his family like he is doing at the moment.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Eleuterio es una persona muy trabajadora, día con día se levanta con muchas ganas de seguir apoyando a su familia, hace algunos años perdió a uno de sus hijos, el cual estaba trabajando en los EUA. Una llamada inesperada le aviso que su hijo había muerto debido a un derrame cerebral, Don Eleuterio hizo muchos gastos para traer el cuerpo de su hijo hasta México. Sin embargo, no pierde las esperanzas de continuar apoyando a la familia. Inicio su propio negocio hace algunos años ante la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de su familia y proporcionar una educación a sus hijos.

El requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 USD para comprar mercancía y de esta forma aumentar la capacidad de ventas de su negoció, con este préstamo Eleuterio espera que se incrementen sus ingresos y así. seguirá apoyando a su familia como hasta el momento.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.en:
Mari is a dress maker. She decided to begin her business because her husband earns a minimal salary that does not allow him to cover all the home expenses. In that situation Mari has been worried. Then she stared to work and began doing seamstress work around her neighborhood. She is constantly gaining more customers because she always does a good job. Mari has very young children and need them an education, and for that reason she works very hard to cover all her necessities.

She needs a loan of $750 USD to purchase a sewing machine, which will allow her to have a bigger capacity to cover her orders from her clients. She plans to return the loan in 6 months and with your help she can grow and improve her business.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Doña Mari es una costurera, decidió iniciar su negocio a raíz de que su esposo gana un salario mínimo que no le permite cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar. Por lo que esta situación mantenía a Doña Mari preocupada, entonces empezó a trabaja, comenzó haciendo trabajos de costura alrededor de su barrio entre vecinos y conocidos, sin embargo cada vez mas personas la buscan por su buen trabajo. Doña Mari tiene hijos muy jóvenes que necesitan de una educación, por lo que ella trabaja muy duro todos los días para cubrir sus necesidades.

Ella necesita un préstamo de $750 USD para comprar una maquina de cocer, esto le permite tener una mayor capacidad de enfrentar sus pedidos de sus clientes. Planea regresar el préstamo en 6 meses y con tu ayuda ella puede crecer y mejorar en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena K. has a small agency for copying and printing services and office materials. She runs this little business for more than 10 years. The hall in which her office is belongs to her family.

Milena is a ventilation engineer by education and has worked in a ventilation construction company for 6 years. She says she always wanted to have an own business so she left her job together with her mother. Now she runs the business alone and sometimes her daughter who is a student in Varna helps her.

Milena Kazandvieva needs a new professional copy machine and a scanner for her agency and she applies for a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: a new professional copy machine and a scanner

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina Aleksova is 62 years old. She has worked as a movie operator in one of the movie theatres in Bourgas.

Three years ago she retired but it was boring to her to stay at home so she decided to start a small business. Two years ago she opened a small coffee and refreshments shop. Her shop is near the city center where there are many business offices and coffee is always in need.

Kristina has a son who works in Greece with his wife so she has to look after her granddaughter who is 13 years old.

Now Kristina Aleksova wants to make some repairs in her shop and needs some financial help. The loan amount is $ 2000.

loans.use: To make some repairs in her shop

loans.name: Juana María

texts.en:
Juanita is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. She has had her business for 14 years ago and it allows her to support to her family. For example she has 3 children who are studying. The older is studying the second semester of Chemical Engineer\'s program. Juanita wants to offer all to her children an education that allows them to continue their own life and to be an honest and hard-working people. She has a grocery store and a novelties store.

Juanita requires of $1000 USD to purchase merchandise that allows her to increase the capacity of her business. She hopes this next Christmas season her sales will increase. She just wants to continue supporting to her family and hopes to return the loan in a term of 6 months. She and her family thank your support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Juanita es una persona muy amable, amistosa y trabajadora; hace 14 años que tiene su negocio y este le ha permitido apoyar en todo momento a su familia. Por ejemplo tiene 3 hijos, los cuales se están estudiando y el mas grande de ellos se encuentra estudiando el 2 semestre de la carrera de Ingeniero Químico. Juanita quiere ofrecerles a todos sus hijos una educación que les permita continuar en la vida y ser personas honestas y trabajadoras. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes y otra tienda de novedades.

Juanita requiere de $ 1000 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita de esta manera aumentar la capacidad de su negocio, espera que esta próxima temporada navideña sus ventas se incrementen. Juanita solo quiere continuar apoyando a su familia por lo que espera regresar el préstamo en un término de 6 meses. Ella y su familia agraden tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ma. Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has for one year been running a small store that offers products like groceries, snacks, sodas and candies. She has 3 children to take care of, and she wants to provide them with a better quality of life. Her husband works in a private company, but earns a minimal salary that is not enough to cover all the home expenses. A long time ago, she had another store, but it was destroyed in a fire. Elizabeth had to start her business from the beginning again, but she could not have the same capacity of products and sales.

She requires a loan of $250 USD to purchase merchandise so that she can increase her inventory. She hopes with this loan her sales will increase and by consequence her incomes increase. Elizabeth and her children need your help and support.

This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Elizabeth tiene 1 año con su pequeña tienda, la cual ofrece productos como abarrotes, botanas, refrescos y dulces. Tiene 3 hijos que tiene que cuidar y por los que todos los días Elizabeth continúa trabajando para proporcionarles una mejor calidad de vida. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada, pero gana un salario mínimo que no le permite cubrir con todos los gastos del Hogar. Hace tiempo tenía otra tienda, sin embargo sufrió un accidente y terminó en un incendio, por lo que Elizabeth tuvo que iniciar desde el principio su negocio pero ha sido difícil para ella tener la misma capacidad de productos y ventas.

Ella requiere de $ 250 USD para comprar mercancía y de esta manera aumentar su existencia de productos, ella espera que con este préstamo sus ventas se incrementen y como consecuencia sus ingresos sean mayores. Elizabeth y sus hijos necesitan tu ayuda y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra lives in Villa de Garcia Nuevo Leon. She has 6 children to care for. Every day she works a lot to cover all the home necessities. A long time ago she separated from her husband, and for that reason she decided to begin her own business to support her family. She started selling cosmetics, and later she added groceries and personal hygiene products. Her two young children help in the business, and that lets Petra to spend more time with them and care them. To Petra, it is the unique job that she has and allows her earns an income to support her family.

Petra requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise, because she says that she has had a great success with the personal hygiene product sales. In this way she wants to increase her product inventory to cover her demand of products. Petra and her family thank your affection and support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Petra vive en Villa de García Nuevo León, tiene 6 hijos a su cuidado y todos los días trabaja mucho para cubrir las necesidades del hogar. Hace algunos años se separo de su esposo, por lo que decidió iniciar su propio negocio para atender a su familia, comenzó vendiendo cosméticos, tiempo después vendió abarrotes y productos de higiene personal. Sus dos jóvenes hijos ayudan en el negocio, por lo que esto ha permitido que Petra este más al pendiente de sus hijos y al cuidado de ellos. Para Petra es el único trabajo que tiene y que le permite ganar un ingreso para cuidar de su familia.

Petra requiere de $200 USD para comprar mercancía, porque dice que ha tenido un gran éxito con la venta de productos de higiene personal. De esta manera ella quiere aumentar la existencia de esos productos para enfrentar la alta demanda de sus productos. Petra y su familia agradecen tu cariño y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Julian Antonio

texts.en:
My name is Julian S. and I sell beef, pork, and chicken ( for reasonable prices) and I have had my business for 5 years. I also have the help of my son, and I have many customers because my product is fresh and of the best quality. My business generates earnings to support my family. My goal is to expand my inventory and with the additional earnings I will be able to open another butcher store at the other end of the capital city as well as be able to give my son, who is of University age, an education.

Mi nombre es Julian S. me dedico a la venta de carne de res, cerdo y pollo a precio de mayorista y al por menor, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la venta de mi producto, mis clientela es excelente ya que mi producto es fresco y de buena calidad, mi negocio me genera ingresos para mantener mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder abrir otra carniceria en otro punto de la ciudad capital tambien darle un buen estudio a mi hijo que esta en edad para ingresar a la universidad.

loans.use:
To purchase beef, pork, chicken, knives, sharpening files, wood, iron gloves.

Compra de carne de res, cerdo, pollo, cuchillos, limas para afilar, madera, ganchos de hierro.

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.en:
My name is Godofredo F. and I run a tailor store and uniform shop for work and school. I have had my business for 5 years and I have many customers as I have contracts with the local schools and the factories to sew their uniforms. My business generates earnings that support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to have a better production rate. With the additional earnings I will buy another sewing machine and hire someone to help me sew as well as continue supporting my family and my childrens\' education.

Mi nomobre es Godofredo F. me dedico a la confeccion y costura de Uniformes de trabajo y de escuelas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que tengo unos contratos con escuelas y empresas para la fabricacion de sus uniformes, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar otra maquina de costurar y contratar otra persona para que me ayude a la fabricacion de mis productos tambien mantener a mi familia y el estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use:
To purchase fabric, thread, needles, dye,cotton, pencils, irons and rulers

Compra de tela, hilo, agujas, tinta, algodon, lapices, planchas, reglas.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Since 1986 Juelieta has had her small business and it has allowed her to cover all the family expenses. However, she has had to deal with the sickness of her son, who is paralyzed. She is the only person that assists him and also she is a divorced woman. The life has been difficult to Julieta, but she always has a smile to offer to the people, especially to her clients. She sells groceries and it allows her have time to care her special son and her business.

She needs a loan of $475 to purchase merchandise. Julieta wants to grow the business capacity and hopes from this way, her sales will increase. She just wants to continue supporting her son and offer him a quality of life like any other person. They need your generosity and affection.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Desde 1986 Juelieta tiene un pequeño negocio y le ha permitido cubrir los gastos de la familia, sin embargo también ha tenido que luchar por su hijo quien tiene discapacidad, ella es la única persona que atiende a su hijo ya que también esta divorciada. La vida ha sido difícil para Julieta, pero siempre tiene una sonrisa que ofrecer a las personas, especialmente a sus clientes. Vende abarrotes y esto le permite estar al cuidado de su propio negocio y de su hijo.

Necesita un préstamo de $ 475 para comprar mercancía, ya que Julieta quiere aumentar la capacidad de su negocio y espera que de esta manera sus ventas aumenten. Ella solo quiere seguir apoyando a su hijo y ofrecerle una calidad de vida como cualquier otra persona. Ella y su hijo necesitan de tu generosidad y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Herlinda

texts.en:
Herlinda is a very hard-working woman and together with her partner has five children. She used to work in a company which produced clothes. Some time later she had to assist her children and needed to leave her employment, so she talked to her boss and he proposed that she could continue working from her house and produce clothes for the company. That is the way as she began her business more than one year ago. She bought two sewing machines and with them started her business.

Today she requires a loan of $250 USD to purchase merchandise and sewing straight line machine, which will help her to perform her job with better quality and efficient way. Herlinda requests a term to pay her loan of 3-6 months.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Herlinda es una mujer muy trabajadora y junto con su pareja han procreado cinco hijos, ella acostumbraba trabajar en una empresa en que se maquilaba ropa, pero debido a que tenía que atender a sus hijos fue que tuvo la necesidad de dejar su empleo y al comentárselo a su jefe, este le propuso que siguiera trabajando, pero ahora desde su casa y maquilándoles ropa a la empresa. Fue así como inició su negocio hace mas de un año, comprando dos maquinas para coser domesticas, con las cuales empezó el negocio de la maquila de ropa.

Hoy en día requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 USD para la compra de mercancía y una maquina de coser recta, la cual le ayudará a realizar su trabajo con mas calidad y de manera mas eficiente. Herlinda solicita un plazo para pagar su préstamo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and sewing straight line machine

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.en:
Olga Lidia is a 30 year-old, active and entrepreneurial woman. At the moment she is in a divorce process and for that reason she has to support her family alone. She decided to begin a small business of Tostada sales (It is a toasted tortilla with lemon and hot pepper, it is so popular in Mexico), snacks and sodas at her home. She reinvested her earnings so she could purchase groceries and dairy products to sell. She personally assists her business and her nephew also helps her in his free time.

Every day people prefer to go to her business to by her products and they have been requesting more variety in the products that she offers. She is requiring a loan of $250 USD to purchase hygienic and dairy products that her clients have been demanding lately. Her idea is pay it in a term of 3-6 months. Olga will thank you if you decide to support and contribute to her family well-being.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Olga Lidia es una mujer de 30 años, muy activa y emprendedora que actualmente se encuentra en proceso de divorcio y por lo mismo tiene que sacar adelante a su familia, es por eso que decidió iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de tostadas, duritos y refrescos en su hogar y al estar reinvirtiendo sus ganancias en el mismo pudo ir incorporando la venta de abarrotes y productos lácteos. Ella atiende su negocio personalmente y un sobrino le ayuda también por horas a atenderla.

Hoy en día mas gente la conoce y prefiere acudir a su negocio a hacer sus compras, es por eso que le han estado pidiendo mas variedad en las mercancías que ofrece, ahora esta requiriendo un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 USD para comprar productos higiénicos así como lácteos que sus clientes han estado demandándole últimamente, su idea es pagarlo en un término de 3-6 meses. Olga les agradecerá si ustedes deciden apoyarla y contribuir así al bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase hygienic and milky products

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.en:
Maria del Pilar is a woman who separated from her husband long time ago. For that reason she has had to work very hard to support her family. She has five children. More than two years ago she decided to start her small business to have a better income because she had to support alone the house expenses. She began to sell basic grocery products in her house. Little by little she gained preference among her neighbors and a place in the market.

At the moment, her business is facing greater demand from clients who are requesting her variety products. For that reason she needs a loan for $200 USD to purchase basic, hygienic and dairy products that lately her clients have been requesting. She wants to have a bigger merchandise supply and with her incomes, she wants to return the loan in a term of 3-6 months. Maria del Pilar is sure that with you support she will increase her small business capacity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Maria del Pilar es una mujer que esta separada de su esposo desde hace algún tiempo, es por eso que ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar a delante a su familia, ella tiene cinco hijos. Hace más de dos años que decidió establecer su pequeño negocio, para tener un mayor ingreso ya que como tenia que hacer frente sola a los gastos de su casa comenzó a vender los productos básicos de abarrotes en su casa, poco a poco se fue dando a conocer entre sus vecinos y alcanzando un lugar en la preferencia de sus clientes.

Hoy en día, su negocio esta enfrentando una mayor demanda por parte de sus clientes, quienes a su vez le han estado solicitando mas variados productos, es por eso que tiene la necesidad de un préstamo por $ 200 USD para comprar productos básicos y también higiénicos y lácteos, que últimamente le han estado solicitando sus clientes. Su idea es tener una mayor oferta de mercancías y con las utilidades que se generen pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 3-6 meses. Maria del Pilar esta segura que con su apoyo ella podrá hacer crecer su pequeño negocio.

loans.use: Prchase basic, hygienic and milky products

loans.name: Laura Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a young woman of 26 year-old; she is married and has two children of 7 and 4 years old respectively. Her husband\'s name is Carlos and he works as a bricklayer, for that reason his income are variable. She wants to be able to cover all the family necessities,and so she started a small business. One year ago her mother supported her to begin her stationery business. She gave her merchandise and Margarita started to sell at home to her neighbors. So she reinvested the incomes and her business started to grow.

The Christmas season is very close and she requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise like notebooks, pens, gifts and more. These articles are very demanded in these days, she thinks that with your support she will have the capacity to obtain better incomes, benefiting her business and her family, repaying the loan in a term of 3-6 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Margarita es una mujer joven de 26 años de edad, ella esta casada y tiene dos hijos, de 7 y 4 años respectivamente, su esposo se llama Carlos y trabaja como albañil en la construcción, es por eso que sus ingresos son variables, debido a ello se vio en la necesidad de iniciar un pequeño negocio. Hace un año que su madre la apoyo para que iniciara su negocio de papelería, le regalo mercancía para que comenzara a vender en su hogar a sus vecinos, fue así como con las ganancias de sus ventas fue reinvirtiendo en mas mercancías y su negocio empezó a crecer.

Ante la temporada navideña que se avecina, requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 USD para comprar algo de papelería y regalos, los cuales son muy demandados en estos días, piensa que con su apoyo ella podrá obtener mayores utilidades, beneficiando a su negocio y a su familia, pagando el préstamo en un plazo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise like notebooks, pens, gifts and more

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a 56 years old, active and hard-working woman. She is married with Victor who works as electrician, and they have 4 children that love them so much. With the goal to have better incomes, three years ago approximately, she began her small clothes sales business. At the beginning she only sold her used clothes and with the incomes that she was reinvesting. She bought used clothes packages, which has given her very good results.

She is requesting a loan for of $375 USD to purchase merchandise because she wants to proviD. her clients all the articles that they need. She will repay in a term of 4-8 months. Yolanda needs your help and support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Yolanda es una mujer D. 56 años, muy activa y trabajadora, ella esta casada con Don Víctor quien trabaja como electricista por su cuenta y tienen 4 hijos. Con el objetivo D. tener mayores ingresos hace aproximadamente tres años que inició su pequeño negocio D. venta D. ropa semi-nueva, al principio vendía solo ropa D. sus familiares y con las ganancias fue reinvirtiendo, comprando pacas D. ropa semi-nueva, lo cual le ha dado muy buenos resultados.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad D. $375 USD para poder comprar más mercancía y poder surtir a sus clientes, el plazo para pagar será D. 4-8 meses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Santiago

texts.en:
I have worked in the fabrication and sales of corn tortillas for five years. My customers are my neighbors who like to eat their meals with warm tortillas. My business has grown and my earnings have been sufficient to help pay for my childrens\' education and other family expenses. My idea is to start selling to other nearby communities, but I need to investment capital to hire others to help me in the production and distributing of the tortillas. Now, in the holiday season, people buy large quantities of tortillas and because of this I need to invest more capital.

Tengo cinco años de dedicarme a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas de maiz, mis vecinos son clientes ya que ellos prefieren comer sus alimentos con tortillas calientes. Mi negocio ha crecido y mis gancias han sido de bastante ayuda para pagar los estudios de mis hijos y los gastos de la familia. Mi idea es abarcar con ventas otras colonias cercanas a la mia, pero necesito capital para contratar otras personas que me ayuden a elaborar y entregar tortillas. Ahora en epoca navideña las personas compran tortillas en grandes cantidades es por eso que necesito invertir mas capital.

loans.use:
To purchase cornflour, water, firewood and other items

Harina de maiz, agua, leña y otros

texts.en:
My name is Gerardo and I construct home furniture, such as beds, chairs, dinner tables, stools, closets, doors as well as other items that clients may ask me for. I have several years experience of constructing furniture of the highest quality for reasonable prices, sometimes I do work on contract with some of the store that sell furniture. With my income I am able to help my children with their education and with the family expenses.

Me llamo Gerardo y me dedico a fabricar muebles para el hogar, como camas, sillones, comedores, sillas, closet, puertas y otros articulos que me piden mis clientes. Tengo varios años de dedicarme a fabricar muebles de calidad y a buenos precios, he podido comprar mi equipo y monte mi taller, algunas veces hago contratos con tiendas donde venden muebles. Con los ingresos que percibo he podido ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios y gastos familiares.

To purchase wood, glue, nails, sandpaper, fabric and other items

Mrs. Lydia requests a loan of $1500.00 to be able to buy more kinds of shoes. She plans to pay back the loan in one year.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: The medium sized enterprise is involved in wood processing,Carpentry and furniture cabins for the local population of about 350,000 inhabitants. BODSEC Enterprise has been in the carpentry and wood processing business for the past 25years. The business was a family owned one which was handed down to the present manager by his father. Mr N. the current manager infused into the business best business practices he learnt from the TEACH lending skills program of Kraban Support Foundation. After the training program the manager has now expanded his business based on a 5-year business and marketing plan the company has in place. He needs a KIVA loan of $1900 to enable him purchase an additional wood planer and bench saw machine to augment the enterprise operations.

loans.use: PURCHASE ADDITIONAL WOOD PLANER & BENCH-SAW

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Auntie Juliana B., has been a dedicated clientle of Kraban Support Foundation. She started her business as a retailer of local gin called \"akpeteshie\" for several years. She joined TEACH lending program and participated in the small business enterprise program conducted in the local language by Kraban staff. She religiously followed the lessons and practised them. She is yet to develop a business plan. However she is keeping basic book keeping and accounting records of her business. This has ensured a systematic approach of her employees in recording all the daily transactions her operates, she needs a KIVA loan of $800 to improve her working capital.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en: The Hair salon is located in the district capital called Abokobi in the Ga East of Greater Accra Region. Ivy indicate that she recieves over 200 customers within a week especially on friday, saturdays and sundays. During such peak periods thereare long queues due to the limited number of hair dryers in the salon. She would like to recieve a KIVA loan of $1000 to purchase 4 additional hair drying equipment on employe 4 more shop assistants to address the problem of high demand of services in her shop. Ivy is a new recruit to the Kraban Support Foundation TEACH lending program.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE 4 HAIRDRYERS

loans.name: Asana

texts.en: Asana has been in this business for about 8 years now, she cooks food and sell to school children in 4 schools located within the community. Currently she cooks about 2 maxi bags of rice weekly. However due to the ever increasing demand for her appetizing and delicious meals from the school children and the community at large, she would like to increase the weekly sales from 2 bags to 6 bags of rice. She intends employing 2 additional staffs to assist her. she has requested a KIVA loan amount of $650 and hopes to use it judiciously in order to plough back profits. she has also participated in the TEACH lending of Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

texts.en: Margrate is 40 years old, a single mother of three children .She is a strong member of women of faith group.Margret is determined to educate her children so as to future grounds. Her first born is in college, second in secondary and the third is in primary school.With school fees and the childrens upkeep on her shoulders  she works extra hard to meet their needs .She buys fruits from farmers in Muranga around Saba Saba and Maragua, rural areasand sells them to fruit vendors at Korokoco market .She has many custormers who are fruit  vendors which makes her business performance good at times.Currently her capital is USD 225.Though she has taken USD 43 from the groups revolving fund, she needs a further USD 75 to increase her purchases for supply and she belives with thatwill be able to deliver more fruits and reduce cost and save time.

texts.en: Jane is 39 years old, single with 2 children. She is a member of women of faith group and strongly empowers women to fight against poverty through small businesses.Janes has a business of selling blouses and shirts in Wangige, Gilgil, Ngong market. The days when she is in her home area, she sells them door to door.Jane has plan of changing her business due to the government determination to revive the textile industries, she sees a situation where the cloth materials will be affordable, since she was trained  tailor,She wants to take advantage of the new development and establish her own tailoring shop. She requires USD 75 to buy materials. She owns a machine that she will use to start her new business. Jane believes her new business will enable her feed her children and cater for other household expenses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a stand where she sells fresh fruit and juice. Maria used to sell vegetables from her stand, but because profits were not sufficient she and her husband decided to try something different. After being forced to move from their old location because they did not have government permits, they moved the stand to a location closer to their home. Maria and her husband prepare the juice and fruit salad in the mornings. While Maria stays at the stand, her husband travels around the community in his tricycle cart selling the fresh juice and fruit salad.

Maria is seeking a loan because she wants to make significant improvements to her business. Along with buying a new juicer, Maria wants to purchase a new tricycle cart for her brother to use. This way, her business will have three points of sale and they can increase their production and revenue.

Maria is 35 years old, she is married, and she has 3 children. They live in her husband’s family house where they pay rent. Maria’s goal is to save up enough money to buy herself and her children a home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Maria wants to buy a new cart for her brother to use to sell fruit. She also wants to purchase a juicer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria runs a small food stand where she sells all types of typical Ecuadorian dishes. Her daughter helped her start this business 2 years ago by buying Maria the small barbecue in the picture. Maria started off by selling just empanadas and shish kabobs, two of Ecuador’s more popular foods. She now has a large of variety of foods and dishes that she makes.

Her dream is to one day have a restaurant. She wants to make reparations to her home in order to be able to offer seating for her clients. The first step is to add pavement to her home and make a section for her customers.

Maria is 40 years old and has 4 children who are already grown up. One of her daughters still lives with her and helps her in the business. Her husband also contributes to the business when he is not working.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Make reparations to her home so it may become a restaurant

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson started selling fruit as an assistant for his father-in-law. He and his wife have been working in this type of business for over 15 years. They currently have a tricycle cart that they use in order to sell their fresh produce to the local community. They are seeking a loan in order to purchase a new tricycle cart. This will allow Wilson and his wife to work independently and cover more ground selling.

Wilson and his family of 5 children live with his mother and his sister. While he and his wife are at work, Wilson’s sister looks after the younger children. The house this family lives in is made out of wood and is in poor conditions. Wilson hopes that with the increased revenue from having a second cart he can fix up his family’s home. This business is in the only source of income in this household.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a cart for his wife to use

loans.name: Elana

texts.en:
No one likes cold feet, in Balti there is a simple solution, visit Elana Frcaution’s clothing stand outside the central market. She greets customers with a warm smile and asks them what they need; a warm pair of socks, long-underwear or a thermal shirt, gloves, hats?  Last year was an extremely cold winter in Moldova reaching as low as -30 degrees Celsius and Elena saw higher sales than expected. Elana would like to be prepared for this winter.  Most people don’t like the cold, but when its cold outside it means money for Elana.

In order to save money Elana purchases her clothing in bulk twice a year, once for winter and again for summer from the Ukraine.  Within the last year it has been more difficult to buy cloths from Ukraine due to the importers having to travel further distances around an area of Moldova called Transnistria.  Transnistria is a breakaway state from Moldova, it was unofficially formed after a civil war within Moldova in 1992 after the Soviet Union collapsed. This area is not recognized by the United Nations or the United States and last year, Ukraine and Moldova’s Governments induced a blockade on this region requiring heavy restrictions for goods leaving this area. Elana would like a loan to make a larger purchase this year to have a larger inventory for this reason and to meet demand and help keep her customers warm!

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing in bulk.
