loans.name: Gladis Gricelda

texts.en:
Hello, my small factory is called \"las G\" or \"the G\" after the first letter of my name, but everyone knows me as Griselda. I sell packaged corn tortillas, I make the tortillas with industrial machines and also by hand to bag them and sell in the pulperias(grocery store)and businesses. I have had my business for 5 years, but 2 in which I have bought a machine for the fabrication and packaging. With the help of my family, I have been able to see my business grow and I have also been able to support my children in their studies.

Hola mi pequeña fabrica se llama las G, por la letra en comun de mi nombre, pero todos me conocen como Griselda. Yo vendo tortillas de maiz empaquetadas, yo hago tortillas con maquinas industrial, y tambien a mano las embolso para vender en pulperias y negocios, tengo 5 años de dedicarme a este negocio, pero dos de haber comprado 1 maquinaria de elaboracion y empaque. Con la ayuda de mi familia he podido hacer que mi negocio crezca y he podido tambien apoyar a mis hijos con sus estudios.

loans.use:
To purchase cornflour, plastic, firewood, gas and other items

Compra de harina de maiz, plastico, leña, gas y otros

loans.name: Veronica Concepcion

texts.en:
My name is Concepcion and I sell clothes, make-up, tablecloths, ornaments and other household items. My clients are people who work for companies and neighbors from my community. Sales go up in December, because everyone wants to buy clothes or other items to give as gifts. With what I make from sales, I help my family.

Loan Use: Purchase Christmas tablecloths; women’s, men’s and kids’ underwear; lotions; make-up; etc.

Me llamo Concepcion y me dedico a la venta de ropa, maquillaje, manteles, adornos y otros articulos para el hogar, mis clientes son personas que trabajan en empresas y vecinos de mi colonia. Este mes de diciembre es de bastantes ventas porque toda las personas buscan comprar ropa u otros articulos para regalar. Con los ingresos que percibo de las ventas ayudo a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de manteles navideños, ropa interior de dama, caballero y niño, lociones, maquillaje y otros

loans.name: Selma Argentina

texts.en:
I’ve been making and selling tortillas for the last five years. With my income, I’ve been able to support my kids’ education. I also sell cell phone calling cards, which provides me with an additional income to help me with my family’s expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase corn, lime, water, and others.

Desde hace 5 años me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de torillas, con los ingresos que percibo de las ventas he podido apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios. Tambien vendo tarjetas para telefonos celulares este es un ingreso adicional que nos ayuda con los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Compra de maiz, cal, agua y otros

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 25 years old. She is living in Monterrey NL and married. Her husband works as a butcher and together they have two children, Brandon and Escalet are 8 and 4 years old respectively. At the moment Ana Maria is pregnant. Two years ago she felt the need to help her husband with the home expenses and pay an education to her children. Her older son started school and this added to their family expenses. She decided start to sell beauty products with her family and friends, so that she could care for her children and take care of her house.

She requests a loan of $275 USD to purchase additional merchandise, because her customers are increasing with the Christmas season. Ana Maria also wants to be supplied from merchandise with prices that are cheaper than the normal market.

This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Ana Maria tiene 25 años, es originaria de Monterrey NL y esta casada; su esposo trabaja como carnicero y tiene dos hijos, Brandon y Escalet tienen 8 y 4 años respectivamente. Actualmente Ana Maria esta embarazada y hace dos años se vio en la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que su hijo mayor entro a la primaria y esto incremento más los gastos familiares. Fue así como decidió comenzar a vender productos de belleza con sus familiares y amigas, al mismo tiempo ella podía cuidar a sus hijos y atender su casa.

Solicita un crédito de $275 USD para compra mercancía adicional, debido a que sus clientes se están incrementando con la temporada navideña y además Ana Maria quiere abastecerse de mercancía a precios de mayoreo para que le sea más barato.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is from Zacatecas in the center of Mexico. She is 32 years old and she has been living in Monterrey for more than 10 years. She is the mother of 5 children. Her husband is an employee in a factory and earns a minimum salary, which does not allow him to cover all his family expenses. She has been working in an ornamental products sale for home for two years. She began her own business with the purpose of supporting her husband with the home expenses and also so she could continue to care her children.

She requests a loan of $275 USD in order to purchase merchandise because the Christmas season is very close. Josefina hopes this will be a good investment opportunity that allows her to increase her income considerably. She has many children to care for and wants give a good education to every one.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Originaria del estado de Zacatecas en el centro de México; Josefina tiene 32 años lleva mas de 10 años de vivir en Monterrey, es madre de cinco hijos, su esposo es un empleado de una fábrica y recibe un salario mínimo, el cual no le permite cubrir con todos los gastos de la familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos decorativos para el hogar desde hace dos años e inicio su propio negocio con la finalidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y así continuar al cuidado de sus hijos.

Solicita el un crédito de $275 USD con la finalidad de comprar mercancía, ya que la temporada navideña esta muy cerca, por lo que Josefina espera una buena oportunidad de inversión que le permita incrementara considerablemente sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.en:
Bertha was born in Tamaulipas state and she has been living for more than ten years in Monterrey. She came to the city with her family, looking for better work opportunities. She is married and has a daughter of 10 years old. Her husband Pedro is employee in a factory and earns a salary that is not enough to cover all the home necessities. At the moment she works as employee in a manufacturing factory and at the same time she has the opportunity to sell beauty products to her fellow workers and her neighbors. This activity does not require her too much time investment, and she can care for her daughter who always goes with her when she visits to her clients. To Bertha her small daughter is the most important thing in life, for that reason she wants to give her a good education and a better quality of life.

She is requesting for a loan of $375 USD to purchase wholesale merchandise, because she has the opportunity to increase her sales in this Christmas season. Bertha and her family thank your generosity and your affection.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Bertha nació en el estado de Tamaulipas pero tiene más de diez años de vivir en Monterrey, ella vino a esta ciudad, junto con su familia, en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Es casada y tiene una niña de 10 años de nombre Perla, su esposo Pedro es empleado de una fábrica y gana un salario que no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades del hogar. Actualmente ella trabaja como empleada en una fabrica y al mismo tiempo se da la oportunidad de vender productos de belleza con su compañeras de trabajo y sus vecinos, ella comenta que esta actividad no le implica ninguna inversión de tiempo, de esta manera puede atender su casa y no descuidar a su hija que siempre la acompaña cuando realiza las visitas a sus clientes. Para Bertha su pequeña hija es lo más importante en la vida, por lo que desea darle una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Solicita un crédito de $375 USD para compra mercancía de mayoreo y así incrementar sus ventas en esta temporada navideña. Bertha y su familia agradecen tu generosidad y tu cariño.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia was born in Victoria, Tamaulipas. She has been living in Monterrey for 20 years. She is divorced and she lives with one of her children that helps her to assist her store. Her small business is 15 years old and she has gone growing little by little since she began. She started with small quantities of merchandise until her business became a store that can cover all the necessities from her clients. She began her business for the necessity to support her children after getting divorced, and for that reason she wants to offer them an education and a better quality of life. On weekends Julia sells in her house tacos and hamburgers and people characterize her as a very responsible and hard-working woman.

Julia requests a loan of $475 USD to purchase merchandise and hopes this next winter season will increase her sales and her incomes will be better than the last year. She hopes you support her.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Doña Julia nació en Ciudad Victoria Tamaulipas, pero tiene 20 años viviendo en Monterrey, es divorciada y vive con uno de sus hijos que le ayuda a atender su tienda, Su pequeño negocio tiene 15 años y ha ido creciendo poco a poco; comenzó con pequeñas cantidades de mercancía hasta convertirse en una tienda que puede cubrir las necesidades de todo el barrio; inicio esto por la necesidad de sostener a sus hijos después de divorciarse y por que quiere ofrecerles una educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Doña Julia los fines de semana vende en su casa tortas, tacos, hamburguesas, por lo que se caracteriza como una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora

Doña Julia solicita un crédito de $475 USD para comprar mercancía, ella espera que esta próxima temporada de invierno se incrementen sus ventas y sus ingresos mejoren.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 32 years old and lives in Monterrey. She was born in San Luis Potosi, which is in the center of Mexico. Teresa is married and her husband constantly works away from the city due to his job. She has five children. Two of them live in United States and the other ones live in Monterrey. Her smaller son Abraham is 19 years old, works with her assisting the clients but he would like to continue studying to find a good employment. She began her business with her bigger son\'s help, who gave her the initial capital and little by little Teresa has gone growing. She has a internet cafe and every day her business has been growing.

She requests a loan of $475 USD to the maintenance and remodeling of her internet cafe, Teresa hopes with this loan her business will be bigger and better, because she will have a better image and more attraction of her clients. In a term of 5 months she plans to return the loan.

This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Doña Teresa tiene 32 años de vivir en Monterrey, nació en San Luis Potosí la cual se encuentra en el centro de México. Doña Teresa es casada, su esposo constantemente esta fuera de la ciudad debido a su trabajo y es madre de cinco hijos. Dos de ellos viven en Estados Unidos y los otros tres en Monterrey. Su hijo menor Abraham de 19 años, trabaja con ella atendiendo a los clientes pero le gustaría seguir estudiando para encontrar un buen empleo. Ella comenzó su negocio con la ayuda de su hijo mayor, quien puso el capital inicial y poco a poco Teresa ha ido creciendo.

Solicita un crédito de $475 USD para el mantenimiento y remodelación de su local, Doña Teresa espera que con este préstamo su negocio se beneficiara porque tendrá una mejor imagen y de esta forma atraerá más clientes. En un término de 5 meses ella planea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: Maintenance and remodeling of her cyber coffee

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena sells sodas and other products from her small store. Because her parents ran similar stores, Lorena learned the ins and outs of the business from a young age. She saved $100 in order to start up her operation about 2 years ago. She sells these products from her home to the local community and she is also a distributor for some nearby stores. She is seeking this loan in order to increase her inventory. She wants to begin selling dairy products and eggs from her store as well.

Lorena is 32 years old, she is married and she has 2 school aged children. She is very proud to have a business of her own that allows her to provide an education and food for her children. She hopes that she can continue to improve her store and use the profits for the well being of her family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Increase her inventory by buying wholesale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is 55 years old and has been living for 38 years in Monterrey. She was born in Doctor Arroyo, Nuevo Leon but she changed her residence looking for better opportunity. She has been working in foods sales with the purpose of generating additional income to maintenance of her home and support to her husband. Ten years ago she began her business selling tamales (this is a popular and delicious Mexican food). At the moment she sells them to her neighbors, however one of her daughters helps her to sell them in the factory where she works. Her husband is a blacksmith, he has an income that is not enough to cover all the home expenses and he works at home.

She requests a loan of $275 USD to purchase raw materials, with which she produces her delicious tamales. She hopes this Christmas season her sales will be increase considerably. But right now she does not have the capacity to purchase all the raw materials and attend the orders from her clients. Silvia and her son thank your support and affection.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Doña Silvia tiene 55 años y 38 de estar viviendo en Monterrey; nació en Doctor Arroyo Nuevo León pero cambio su residencia en busca de mejores oportunidades desde muy joven. Siempre ha trabajado vendido comidas, con la finalidad de generar ingresos adicionales para el mantenimiento de su hogar y apoyo a su esposo; pero hace 10 años inicio su negocio vendiendo tamales por docenas. Actualmente los vende con sus vecinas y conocidos, sin embargo una de sus hijas le ayuda a venderlos en la fábrica donde trabaja. Su esposo es herrero, tiene un ingreso que no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos del hogar y trabaja en su mismo domicilio.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de $275 USD para comprar materia prima con la que produce sus ricos tamales. Ella espera que esta temporada navideña la venta de sus tamales aumente considerablemente por lo que aun no cuenta con la capacidad de tener todo el material para producirlos. Doña Silvia y su hijo agradecen tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Magaly

texts.en:
Magaly sells clothes in her local community. This type of activity allows her the flexibility to bring in a stable source of income while also giving her time to spend with her children. While she is out selling, her mother takes care of her youngest one while the others are at school. She began in this line of work with only $15 in investment capital.

Magaly needs a loan in order to make investments in her business. She wants to buy a larger amount of clothing at cheaper prices so she may be able to keep more profits. She works very hard, often traveling to downtown Guayaquil in search of potential customers for her goods.

Magaly is 29 years old and has 4 small children. She feels proud to be able to help her family with the extra money she makes. She is very grateful of the help her mother provides, without her she would not be able to run this business and care for her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria Eufemia

texts.en:
In 1993 Eufemia began her own business with the purpose to help her husband and give to her children an education; she started to selling Tostadas and candy (the Tostada is popular snack among Mexicans. It is like a tortilla toasted with hot pepper and lemon). Little by little she has gone growing in her business with her few earnings. Now Eufemia has a groceries store and every day is increasing her sales. She is a married woman and her husband works as machinist. They have three children to take care and their names are: Aleyda, Rafael and Carlos with 19, 17 and 13 years respectively. The children help with the necessities of the family business.

She requires a loan of $650 USD to purchase merchandise that will allow her to have a greater variety of productsin her store. Eufemia hopes to have a good opportunity to make to grow her business and offer to her children an education and a better quality of life. She and her family thank your affection and your support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

En 1993 Eufemia inicio su negocio con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo y dar a sus hijos una educación; empezó vendiendo tostadas y dulces, y poco a poco ha ido creciendo con las pocas ganancias, actualmente y con el transcurso de los años Eufemia tiene una tienda de abarrotes que día con día esta aumentando sus ventas. Ella es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como maquinista, tienen tres hijos por cuidar y sus nombres son: Aleyda, Rafael y Carlos de 19, 17 y 13 años respectivamente, los cuales ayudan con las necesidades del negocio familiar.

Ella requiere un préstamo de $650 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita tener un mayor surtido de productos en su tienda. Eufemia espera tener una buena oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio y ofrecer a sus hijos una educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Ella y su familia agradecen tu cariño y tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lidys

texts.en:
Lidys runs a hair salon where she styles and cuts hair. She has been in this line of work for over 15 years. After working in the beauty salon of a family member, Lidy’s decided to start her own operation with $50 of capital. She opens her salon at 9 in the morning and works until about 8 p.m. She needs the loan in order to buy better equipment for her operation. She needs new scissors, a blow dryer and a hair iron.

Lidys is a 34 year old mother of 5 children. All of her kids are in school thanks to the income she generates from her own salon. She hopes to continue to improve her services and attract a larger amount of clients.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs new scissors, a blow dryer and a hair iron.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells all types of plastic home products ranging from buckets to plastic dishes. She has been in this line of work for about three years. She was working as an assistant for her sister in law before this and then decided to start her own operation. Her husband has been very supportive throughout the process.

She needs the loan in order to introduce new products to her line. She sees potential for sales in a variety of new items but does not have the money to invest in them. This business plays a major role in her household. It has allowed her to provide her 4 children with an education and humble home. She hopes that with these investments she can continue to improve the quality of life for her family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Introduce new products to her sales

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge has owned his general store for about 3 years. He started the business when he found himself out of work and without a way to support himself and his wife. At his store he sells a wide variety of products including posters, officer supplies, cosmetics and bottled water. He currently rents at the location where he sells from and he is very happy with his business.

He is seeking a loan in order to invest in more products and take advantage of his great location. He works with his wife and they are both very happy with the results of the venture. Their dream is to save enough money in order to buy a location of their own for the business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Increase and diversify the inventory at his store

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina was born in San Juan Guadalupe, Durango. She and her family arrived to Monterrey in 1984 looking for better opportunities and to improve her quality of life. 18 years ago she began to sell meat, but her customers are very far from she was living. She decided to sell other kinds of foods that is what she is currently doing. She is a very hard-working woman also she worked as house employee. In order to care for her children she began her own business at home. She cooks the meals and her husband every morning goes to the streets to sell them on a tricycle.

He requests a loan of $925 USD to purchase another tricycle for her husband to continue distributing her delicious meals to his clients. She also wants to buy an industrial stove that will allow her to increase his production. Maria and her husband need your help and generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Doña Marina nació en San Juan Guadalupe, Durango, en 1984 acompañada de su familia llego a Monterrey en busca de nuevas oportunidades de trabajo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Hace 18 años comenzó a vender carne cruda, pero como los rastros le quedaban muy lejos decidió vender comidas y es a lo que se dedica actualmente. Es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que también ha trabajado como empleada de casas, pero con el fin de no descuidar a sus hijos inicio su propio negocio en su hogar. Ella prepara las comidas y su esposo todas las mañanas sale a venderlas de manera ambulante en un triciclo.

Solicita un préstamo de $925 USD para comprar otro triciclo para que su esposo siga repartiendo las comidas a sus clientes, además quiere comprar una estufa industrial que le permita incrementar sus comidas. Doña María y su esposo necesitan de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase another tricycle

loans.name: Liner

texts.en:
Liner runs a small store where she sells hardware supplies. She started the business out of her home when her husband found himself without a job. With $200 in start up capital she started selling basic supplies such as light bulbs and nails. The business is about the 3 years old and now includes a wider range of products.

Liner is requesting the loan because she wants to purchase her merchandise at wholesale prices and quantities. Currently she does not have this benefit and she sees that her profits are very minimal. She is 35 years old and has two children that are still in school. Her husband now has a job and supports the business in any way he can.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy products for her store at wholesale quantities

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 52 year old widow. She has 3 children and is a refugee who fled from Nagorno Karabakh in 1993. She is homeless and temporarily rents her relative\'s flat.

Jamila is the only person to earn income for her family. For this purpose, she opened her fruit counter in 2001. Having insufficient working capital, she started her business with limited volume.

In 2004, she borrowed $300 from Normicro and expanded her business slightly. After this Jamila could not only cover the food consumption needs of her family but also deal with other health and clothing expenses for her family.

Now, Jamila wants to borrow to expand her business further in volume and variety to be able to increase her family income and deal with the education expenses of children and other consumption needs.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and digital scales

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Niyazi

texts.en:
Niyazi is a refugee from Shusha city of Nagorno Karabakh. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He is homeless and staying in a worker\\\'s hostel in the Tagiyev settlement around Sumgayit city.

Niyazi opened his business in 1998. He started selling a small variety of fruits in Sumgayit\\\'s collective farm market. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family\\\'s food and important consumption needs.

In 2003-2004, Niyazi borrowed $300 and $500 from Normicro and expanded his business considerably reaching $1200 in income.

Now he wants to borrow $800 loan to open a vegetable section of his counter and, though this, improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: Niyazi will use this loan for opening a vegetable section of his business.

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.
The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Guleysha

texts.en:
Guleysha is a refugee from the occupied Fizuli region of Azerbaijan since 1993. She began her business with $200 in 2001. At first, she was selling children\\\'s clothing and earning little money. This money was enough for only some of her family\'s basic needs. She had difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school etc.

In 2004, after borrowing $500 from Normicro, Guleysha was able to expand her business and increase the income of her business and improve her family\'s livelihood.

With this loan, Guleysha plans to expand her business and possibly pay for school expenses for her children properly.

loans.use: She will use this loan for opening a materials section in her business.

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
Nabi is a refugee from the Armenian-occupied city of Nagorno Karabakh Shusha. He is single and has parents who live with him. He is the only income earner of his family.

Nabi started his business with a Normicro loan amounting at $300 in 2005. Through this loan, he opened his fruit counter in the Sumgayit market. He paid back all loan installments timely.

Now, Nabi has applied for a second Normicro loan amounting to $500 to expand his business\\\'s fixed and working capital.

Nabi will use the additional income of his planned business to deal with the treatment of his ill father and meet other needs of the family.

loans.use: Nabi plans to use this money for buying a $200 digital scale and buying additional varieties of fruits.

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Latif

texts.en:
Latif is a refugee from the Aghdam region of Azerbaijan. He has three children and is the only person earning a living in the family. He started his business of selling food stuff in 2004 getting first loan in the amount of $400 from Normicro. His second loan was in the amount of $800.

Now Latif is applying for a $1200 loan. He has a good repayment history. He plans to open a counter for selling fruit along his shop, thus developing his business and improving his living condition.

loans.use: Purchasing digital scales, opening new fruit counter

loans.name: Shargiyya

texts.en:
Shargiyya is a widow with 3 children from Sumgayit, Azerbaijan. When her husband died in 2003, she realized that they had to start their life without the family bread-winner. It was really hard times for Shargiyya who, as the majority of real Azerbaijani women do, dedicated herself to family and had never worked before. So, the burden of supporting her three children fell on her delicate female shoulders.

Since 2003 she runs a tea-house business. Tea-houses are very popular in her motherland. They are the places where common people often meet with their friends and relatives, relax and have rest over a traditional cup of refreshing Azerbaijani tea.

Now, Shargiyya needs to buy wares for her tea house as the number of her customers constantly increases. She plans to buy tea-pots, cups, glasses and saucers and therefore she has applied for a loan of 500 USD. She is sure that her good business skills will be very helpful to her in repaying the loan back.

loans.use: To buy wares for tea-house

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.en:
Fizuli is a refugee from the war-affected region of Azerbaijan Gubadli. In 1993, as the result of the Armenian-Azerbaijani conflict, he and 3 of his children found refuge in Sumgayit city and settled in a one-room dormitory. As he describes it “at that time I underwent all hardships of poverty and absence of hope”.

After trying his hand in a number of businesses in 2004, he decided to apply to Norwegian Microcredit (Normicro) – non-banking credit organization disbursing small loans to vulnerable and disadvantaged strata of population - and start up a cattle trade business. Since then he has been involved in selling cows, sheep, goats and other cattle. The first loan amount borrowed was 650 USD, followed up by the 2nd loan of 1000 USD. Within the period of his collaboration with Normicro, no late payments were available.

Now he’s planning to buy 3 cows to start up milk and cheese sales. Thus he’ll be able to increase his income and meet his and his family’s needs better. Fizuli looks ahead with hope and thinks he’s in good capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Madam Diana A. is a textiles dealer. she lives within the community of 21,000 inhabitants. Sixty percent of these inhabitants are women and children who patronise the shop of Madam A. to buy their school uniforms and church and other social dresses. The Yehowa Nti shop is the local shopping avenue where prices are moderately cheap. Because of the moderate prices the shop owner enjoys alot more patronage. The shop owner Madam A. is an aluminus of Kraban\'s TEACH lending programs. She has prepared a business in marketing plan. She also keeps basic accounting and book keeping records. She needs a loan amount of $800 from KIVA funds.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora has participated in the TEACH lending programs of Kraban Support Foundation since 2003. Dora has developed a simple marketing plan. In the plan, she has outlined various strategies that enables her to sell her beverage to prospective buyers as quickly as possible daily. Dora needs a KIVA loan of $650 to purchase more eggs, cooking oil, tins of milo and construct dining tables and chairs for her clients.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Despite Elizabeth\'s level of literacy she regularly participates in the weekly meetings organised by the field staff of Kraban Support Foundation. She has received a meritorious award from a joint workshop organised by Kraban and Freedom from Hunger Ghana for being the best behaved client during TEACH sessions. Auntie Elizabeth needs a KIVA loan amount of $750 to assist her build a new kiosk for her expanding business. she has prepared a business and marketing plan based on the guidelines she received from the staff of Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: Build a new kiosk

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Salahim is a versatile trader. She sells assorted cooked foods. These includes boiled rice and beans popularly called \"wakye\" for members of the community she stays. Though she is a Muslim by religion she does not allow this to serve as a hindrance in her trading activity. She sells her cooked food to Muslims and other members of different religious sect without discrimination. She enjoys a lot of patronage from all persons living within her community due to her humourous nature. She needs a KIVA loan amount of $800 to plough into her business operations. She has participated in the TEACH lending programs.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sagrario Norela

texts.en:
For the last years, I’ve been a peddler who sells beauty products. I visit offices, neighbors and markets in order to sell lotions and clothes. I work from Monday to Saturday, and my sales have gone up in the last few months. During the Christmas season, people buy gifts and accessories for personal use, and that helps me with my sales. I’m a single mother, so I have to look for ways to help my kid financially. This is a good month for sales, so I need to invest money in order to increase my inventory, and my income.

Loan Use: Purchase lotions, shampoo, everyday lotions, etc.

Desde hace dos años me dedico a la venta de productos de belleza ambulante, visito oficinas, vecinas y mercados para vender cremas, lociones y ropa. Trabajo de lunes a sabado y mis ventas han incrementado en estos ultimos meses. Ahora en temporada navideña las personas buscan comprar regalos o accesorios de uso personal lo que me ayuda a mi producto se venda. Soy madre soltera por lo que tengo que buscar la manera de ayudar economicamente a mi hijo. Este mes es bueno para ventas por lo que necesito invertir capital para incrementar mi inventario y obtener mejores ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de lociones, Shampoo, Cremas de uso diario y otros.

loans.name: Selma Fabiola

texts.en:
For the last four years, I’ve been selling magazines by order and lotions. I am currently pregnant, and I have to look for ways to feed my kids, and help support the house. I need to buy products to sell during the Christmas season. My main clients are my neighbors and people that work at offices.

Loan Use: Purchase lotions, shampoo, body powder, cosmetics, underwear.

Desde hace 4 años me dedico a vender productos de revistas por encargo y lociones. En este momento me encuentro embarazada y tengo que buscar la manera de ayudar a mis hijos con el alimento y el sostenimiento de la casa. Ahora necesito comprar producto para vender en temporada navideña, mis mayores clientes son mis vecinos y personas de oficinas que visito.

loans.use: Compra de cremas, shapoo, lociones, talcos, cosmeticos, ropa interior.

loans.name: Mayra Victoria

texts.en:
My name is Marya and I own a grocery store located in my own home, I have had it for 4 years and it has grown considerable. At this time, I need to invest fresh capital in order to stock the products I sell and many more. With my earnings I am able to help my children in their studies and my family with their daily expenses.

Mi nombre es Mayra y tengo una pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitacion, tengo 4 años de tenerla y ha crecido considerablemente, en este momento necesito invertir capital fresco para poder surtir los productos y vender mucho mas. Con los ingresos que percibo he podido ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios y a mi familia con los gastos de toda la familia.

loans.use:
To purchase sodas, bread, milk, beans, sugar, chicken, milk products and other items.

Compra de refrescos, pan, leche, frijoles, azucar, pollo, lacteos y otros.

payments.comment: Gracias por el prestamo que me otorgaron, ahora necesito capital fresco para poder mejorar mis ventas mucho mas.

loans.name: Marbyn Raul

texts.en:
I have a business located in the bus terminal of my neighborhood. It is a family business, attended by my wife in the mornings and myself in the afternoon, we are open from Monday to Saturday. This business generates what is necessary to cover family expenses and the education of my children. At this time we need to invest more to buy apples, grapes, and sweet christmas pears as people are buying more and the fruits are seasonal.

Mi negocio lo tengo ubicado en la terminal de buses de mi colonia, este negocio es familiar lo atiende mi esposa por las mañanas y por las tardes lo atiendo yo, lo atendemos de lunes a sabado. Este negocio nos genera lo necesario para los gastos de mi familia y los estudios de mis tres hijos. En esta epoca necesito invertir en comprar manzanas, uvas, peras dulces navideños ya que las personas compran mas, ya que son frutas de temporada.

loans.use:
To purchase chewing gum, sweets, churros and fruits.

Compra de chiclets, confites, churros, frutas.

payments.comment: Mis ventas mejoraros increiblemente por lo ahora necesito invertir capital nuevo para mover mis ventas.

loans.name: Iris Yamileth

texts.en:
My name is Iris, and for the last five years I’ve been selling products for men, women, and kids. I order the products from catalogs or buy them at bigger stores, and then resell them to neighbors, family, and friends. I keep the products in my house, and then I distribute them according to the orders I receive.

Loan Use: Purchase shampoo, body and face lotions, deodorants, and nail polish.

Me llamo Iris y me dedico a vender productos a hombres, mujeres, niños, desde hace cinco años. Estas ventas las hago por pedidos de catalogos o compra en tiendas para revender a personas particulares vecinos, familia, amigos. Mi producto los tengo en mi casa y luego los distribuyo por pedidos que las personas me hacen.

loans.use: Compra de shampoo, cremas de cuerpo y cara, desodorantes y esmalte de uñas.

payments.comment: Mi negocio ha mejorado bastante por lo que ahora necesito surtir mi inventario para ofrecer nuevo producto.

loans.name: Maira Azucena

texts.en:
I produce and sell tortillas as well as beauty products such as creams, lotions,and make-up through catalogs. I customers who buy my tortillas are my neighbors. Thanks to my sales I have been able to help with family expenses and my childrens\' education.

Me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, adicional a esto vendo productos de belleza como cremas, lociones, maquillaje por catalogos. Mis clientes son las personas que compran tortillas y vecinos. Gracias a las ventas varias he podido ayudar a mi familia con los gastos y los estudios de mis hijos.

loans.use:
To purchase cornflour, firewood and other items.

Compra de harina de maiz, leña y otros

payments.comment: Su ayudo hizo que mis ventas mejoraran, ahora necesito invertir algo de capital nuevo para renovar mi inventario, gracias.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is involved in the recycling of used clothing into new local fabric designs known as Tye and Dye. She has been in this business for the past 12 years. She has trained many apprentices who have acquired skills in batik, tye and dye making. She has been an example for many out-of-school children who have learned this trade and are employing the skills learned to make incomes and also professionals come to learn from her as alternative income generating activity. 
Joyce has been trained by the staff of Kraban Support Foundation in basic records keeping and accounting skills. She has designed her business plan. She needs $925 from KIVA funds to expand her business activities.

loans.use: Purchase Raw Materials

loans.name: Fausto

texts.en:
My name is Fausto and I sell sweet snacks, very similar to ice cream. It is a street vending business, six days a week and my earnings allow me to help my children. My plans are to buy another cart and to hire a young person to sell from it, and in this way increasing my earnings.

Mi nombre es Fausto y me dedico a vender granizados de sabores, que es muy parecido al ice cream, mi negocio es ambulante salgo a las calles a vender 6 dias a la semana y mis ganancias me ayudan ayudar a mis hijos. Mis planes es comprar otra carreta y contratar algun joven para que vendo y de esta manera mejorar mis ingresos.

loans.use:
To purchase sugar, fruit, honey, ice, glasses, condensed milk, vanilla and other items

Compra de azucar, frutas, miel, hielo, vasos, pajillas, leche condensada, vainilla y otros.

payments.comment: Gracias por su ayuda, ahora necesito surtir con producto nuevo para mis clientes.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia has studied as a trainee apprentice with Joyce Kudehah of Joy Tye and Dye Works. She has also completed her pre-disbursement training with Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a KIVA loan to strengthen the shop that she has established named Sophie\'s Beauty Creations. She plans to use the loan to roof the shop where she operates and also recruit an apprentice to assist her in her operations.

loans.use: Startup Working Capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys owns a stand at a local market where she sells a wide variety of products. When she started selling she did not have a stand and she had to sell from a cart in downtown Guayaquil. With a $200 loan from a friend, she was able to set up a stand in a local market. She now sells clothing, make up products and many other items.

Through hard work and perseverance Gladys has been able to make her business a success. She needs this loan in order to continue investing in products to sell from her store. Specifically, she plans to buy new toys and clothing. Eventually Gladys wants to run the store from a part of her a home. She has children but they are no longer dependent on her.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in toys and clothing for her store

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix raises and sells chickens. He and his wife started this business with only 10 chickens about 6 years ago. At first, they only sold to their neighbors and to people in the immediate community, but now they are suppliers for many stores and stands in the local markets. They wake up at 5 in morning to begin working and distribute until about 4 pm.

Felix needs the loan in order to invest in more chickens. He will buy chicks and also grown chickens because business is doing real well. His goal is to eventually become a wholesale distributor of chickens.

Felix is 41 years old, is married and has 3 daughters. Two of his daughters are in school and the other is still a baby. When his daughters come home from school they help him with the chickens. Felix relies on this business to feed his family and send his daughters to school.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy chickens to sell as a distributor

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita started selling fruit about 5 years ago. She only had $10 worth of products and a table outside of her home when she started. Slowly but surely her business grew, today she runs a small market from a section she prepared in her house.

She needs the loan because she is seeking to buy in bulk at better prices. She wants to invest a larger variety of the fruits she sells as well. Margarita is 41 years old and has 2 children. Her oldest son who is 18 years old helps her with the business. Thanks to this business Margarita has been able to provide her children with an education, food on the table and a roof over their heads.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in fruits

loans.name: Dimitar

texts.en:
Dimitar (Mitko) was 7 years old when he started to play the saxophone. He played throughout childhood, studied music at Burgas University for four years and was subsequently in the Bulgarian military band for two years (1972-1974) during the cold war. After completing his military service he was a part of the Bulgarian National Orchestra, a small group that was allowed to travel around the Eastern Block highlighting Bulgarian culture. During this period, Mitko had to work hard to get copies of the music of his favorite Western musician, Louis Armstrong, as no Western music or books were allowed in Bulgaria.

After the state orchestra was dismantled, Mitko returned to his Roma neighborhood in Sliven. (The Roma, often referred to as gypsies in the West, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of Southeastern Europe.) Now in his early 60s, he works Roma weddings and banquets from fall to the spring and Black Sea beach resorts in the summer.

This loan will enable Dimitar to purchase a new saxophone; the one he uses in this video is held together in parts by hair bands and paper clips. His repayment schedule has smaller payments in the winter while business is slow, and larger payments next summer to pay down debt more quickly as his income increases. Mitko has 2 kids – 29 and 27 – and 2 grandchildren as seen in the video.

A short video of Mitko can be seen here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OwdFzrFg9_4

loans.use: New saxophone

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Dinko

texts.en:
Dinko is an enterprising young Roma man from Sliven, Bulgaria. (The Roma, often referred to as gypsies in the West, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of Southeastern Europe). At 25, Dinko is the proprietor of a small convenience store in the local Roma ghetto, selling candy, cigarettes and small consumables. He started this store one year ago, after returning from Spain with the savings he accumulated after working there in construction for two years. With his wife pregnant with their first child, Dinko is thinking BIG and this loan will be a key part of it.

Dinko’s plan is to purchase a small refrigerator with this loan so that he can begin to sell cold drinks, milk and meat from his location. Once he has this loan paid back, he is already planning on his second loan to open a second location across the neighborhood. (The Roma ghetto in Sliven is 20,000 people large).

loans.use: Capital equipment

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en:
44 year-old Alasgar is a refugee who fled from the occupied Azerbaijani territory Gubadli after the break out of the Armenian-Azerbaijani conflict.

So, his new life started in the city of Sumgayit where he settled with his family. To make end meet he got involved in cattle trading. Now he is applying for a loan of 500 USD. He plans to increase the number of cattle he has and launch milk and cheese sales. It is his belief that this will improve his welfare and meet the increasing needs of his family in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Madat

texts.en:
51 year-old Madat is a refugee from war-affected territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli who is the only bread-winner for his family of 6.

“Sure, the initial stage of my refugee life was not sweet at all. I had two choices – either to live up and adapt to new circumstances or give up and lead my family to famine. So, my passion for sewing I’m involved in since 1982 helped me to go through all hardships and to support my family”-says Madat. His start in the clothing business began with applying in 2004 to Norwegian Microcredit, local microfinance organization, for aloan of 600 USD and sewing the first trousers for his client.

Now he plans to change his outdated ironer to a new one and diversify the variety of fabrics he uses. A new ironer will speed up and simplify his work. Thus he will be able to increase his incomes and afford delivering himself such little joys, maybe ordinary for others but not for him, as buying brand new TV set, video facilities and other household wares. He is confident in himself as well as his capacity to repay the loan and justify the trust of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new ironer and new fabrics

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Najaf

texts.en:
Najaf is refugee from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. His refugee life, full of challenges and uncertainties, began in the city of Sumgayit, where he is involved in cattle trade since 1998. The organization that really gave a push to his business was Norwegian Microcredit (Normicro). Loans of 700 and 900 USD in 2003-2004 were followed by the loan of 1000 USD in 2005. Within the period of his partnership with Normicro, no late payments were available.

Today, this refugee-turned-entrepreneur is a rather successful businessman. He applies for the loan of 1,800 USD to buy 3 cows and 5 sheep. Among his plans is inception of milk and cheese production. He believes in himself and his repayment capacity.

loans.use: To buy 3 cows and 5 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary woul like to buy antibiotics and pain killers

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en: Many places in Moldova are booming with construction, both residential and commercial. The city of Cahul is no exception. People here spend much of their free time renovating and improving their homes or working on a new one. Cinder-block and wood structures can be seen everywhere and power tools are a common sound. Vasile understands the pride Moldovans feel for their homes and knows that proper construction requires good material inputs, so when he was thinking of going into business it was an easy choice to open a construction materials store. He located in the central market, where his goods catch the attention of many shoppers, and began by selling a number of products for construction and for the home in general. He has noticed that his construction related products sell best and that many clients ask for specific and high quality items, so Vasile has decided to specialize in things such as dry cement, tiles, plastering tools, etc. and to discontinue his stock of household detergents and other goods. To purchase a shipment of all the construction supplies he wants to carry, he needs a loan. This will allow him to purchase from a vendor in the capital city of Chisinau and receive the exact products he thinks will be popular.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Elisaveta

texts.en: Elisaveta has a colorful table at the outdoor market in the center of her hometown of Cahul. In nice weather people wander the isles between booths and browse each vendor’s selection. Many of those looking for good clothing, however, often don’t bother searching around but rather head straight to Elisaveta. They know she will have a great variety of children’s clothes, hats, scarves, etc. For three years now she has been at this place, working together with one employee to fill in for her when she has to run errands and buy goods to re-stock the inventory. Elisaveta would like a loan to cover the costs of the next several shipments of clothing she hopes to purchase for the winter season.

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment:
Afacerea doamnei Elisaveta merge foarte bine, avînd în vedere acest lucru dumneaei a achitat integral împrumutul. În această perioadă mari schimbări nu a avut în activitate, a marit un pic asortimentul produselor realizate. Dificultăţi în desfăşurarea activităţii sale întîmpină mereu, dar ca orice antreprenor le rezolvă şi merge mai departe.

Elisaveta's business is going very well and thus she repaid the entire sum of her loan ahead of schedule. In the past months she had no major change of activity, save an expansion of product variety. As any small entrepreneur, she is always dealing with small problems but resolving them and moving on to grow her business.

loans.name: Ion

texts.en: Driving up the hill towards the village of Brinza, the most noticeable thing is a large gas station. Like most everywhere in the world, gas stations in Moldova are neat and modern looking, so it makes a good landmark and a convenient stop for motorists. All the activity is great for business at Ion’s auto repair station, located in a small building adjacent to the gas station’s entrance. Here he and his one employee offer wheel balancing and tire repair, as well as regular maintenance services. He has been a mechanic for seven years and easily assesses the needs of the vehicles that stop by. He needs a loan to purchase some newer equipment that will allow him to both work more efficiently and also to offer more services, including wheel alignments.

loans.use: Equipment purchases

loans.name: Balabeyim Baylar Giz

texts.en:
Balabeyim is an old internally displaced person (IDP) who is the mother of one child. Her family\'s living condition is not very good. The family income is rather limited.

Since 2000, Balabeyim has supported her family by working as a cook in her small business. Actually, she is very communicative person who loves people and accepts them as they are. In her view, cooking is some kind of art which reflects the feelings and mood of a cook. She likes international cousine but national dishes such as dolma, plov, khingal are her favourite ones.

Now, she needs a loan of $600 to further develop her business, to buy new kitchen appliances, to increse her incomes via diversifying the menu and attracting more clients.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a busy lady, caring for her six children and also managing the family farmstead, which includes raising ducks, chickens, and production of various crops. She is also a very active community member and won a grant for female entrepreneurs last year. Two years ago she decided it would be profitable to construct two greenhouses in which to grow produce for sale and for her family’s consumption. With the metal frames erected and covered in heavy-duty plastic, her summer crop of tomatoes and winter crop of radishes both flourished and sold well at the local and regional farmers’ markets. Ana and her family use a tractor and a tank trailer to fetch water from the village fountain to irrigate their crops, just one step in a labor-intensive production system. This year, however, the poly-plastic greenhouse covering reached the end of its life expectancy and began to deteriorate. Ana now needs a loan to buy and install new covering over her greenhouse frames and also to make small repairs to the farm’s tractor.

loans.use: Greenhouse materials, tractor repair

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina and her husband have two sons, now in their late teens, and have always been involved with youth in their village. When her husband recently retired from being the village’s dentist, a position he had filled for ten years, Nina decided it was a good time to fulfill her dream of opening a place for young people to socialize. To make a viable business she came to the idea of opening a pizzeria that would attract youngsters from the area. She wants it to be a positive and safe place for youth, with current music and inexpensive food. The latter goal will be met by purchasing frozen pizzas from a Moldovan company and preparing them as they are ordered. She is also planning to have ice cream and of course various drinks. The whole family has been helping with preparing everything necessary, including renovating the building, and will continue to be involved. With a location near a lake that’s popular in the summer, Nina hopes to also add an outdoor terrace. She now needs a loan to purchase a large refrigerator / freezer and to cover the costs of initial inventory of food and supplies. Her sons’ friends and youth from the whole village are eagerly anticipating the opening of the pizzeria and Nina is looking forward to creating a welcoming atmosphere for them!

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator and inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. buys fresh fish from the local fisherman and processes them by smoking and then selling them at the market centers in the nearby towns and villages. She has two fish processing equipments and wants to purchase a third one due to the rapid expansion of her business activities. She is a regular participant on the Kraban Support Foundation 's skills training program known as TEACH. She has a simple business plan. She needs a loan of $725 from KIVA to erect a third 'chorkor smoker', a locally manufactured fish processing equipment.

loans.use: A Fish Processing Machine called Chorkor Smoker

loans.name: Efrosinia

texts.en: Efrosinia is originally from the village of Slobozia Mare in the south of Moldova. As a single mother, she has been working in the capital city for the past years to earn money and support her two children who are now in high school. She recently returned to her hometown and opened a small store on the property where she was born. Housed in a movable building, her store is the only one on that side of the village and offers drinks, snacks and necessities to nearby residents. She hopes eventually to expand her business to include a sauna and also to construct a home for her family on the same property. Her philosophy, however, is that careful planning is required and that her business will only grow in a stable fashion with gradual steps. The first of these is to offer more goods to her customers and to provide them a place to relax and consume the drinks and snacks she sells. To this end she would like to construct a small terrace in front of the store and acquire a greater and more varied inventory.

loans.use: Improvement of store and purchase of new inventory

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia retails charcoal in her area. Her activity serves as an important source of energy for the community in which she resides. She is regular participant and a positive contributor to the the TEACH lending program. She has developed a business and marketing plan with the aim of diversifying her activity into sales of domestic gas and promoting tree planting within her community. She needs to start the gas sales project. She is soliciting for KIVA loan assistance to enable her start the Community Gas Sales project.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Julie owns a big store in her village. She deals in General Merchandising. Her service in the community is helpful as it helps community members to acquire their needs at local self-service shop operated by Julie. She was among the first 10 participants who benefited from the TEACH lending skills training organized by KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION 1997. She has followed her marketing plan and that has carried her to this far. An $800 Kiva loan would strengthen her entrepreneurial abilities in salesmanship in her community.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine A. is a colleague participant of Julie of Sibebe Enterprise. Mama Josephine, as she is popularly called, sells variety of products to members of the community called Christian Village with a population of of about 25,000 inhabitants. She has prepared a business plan and she keeps simple basic accounting records of her activities. She requires a loan of $700 to improve her business transactions.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: She has set up a community information bureau and a secretarial service to render invaluable srvice to the town she lives. Her shop provides secretarial services such as telephone, fascimile, printing, photocopying and other services to the  community. It is also a point for community information services as people with information on suspicious characters reports them to the Bureau and such information is transmitted to the appropriates national security agencies being fire, theft, floods or any other emergency or disaster. The owner of the Bureau is a retired policewoman. She has participated in the TEACH strategic lending seminars and believes that the lessons learnt would enhance her skills in providing community with vital information. She therefore needs a Kiva loan of $1100 to enable her purchase more commputers to supplement what she use to run the Secretarial and Business Bureau for the community.

loans.use: 5 Computers and Accesories

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy makes cleaning products like disinfectant, soap, detergent, shampoo, etc. She has been working in this business for about 2 months. She took a course at the Mifex MERIT Centers that taught her basic chemistry and gave her the skills to make her own cleaning products. This type of business is very lucrative in this sector because the manufactured versions of these products are usually too expensive for most to afford. Therefore, Nancy can make her own products at home and sell them to other businesses.

Nancy needs the loan in order to invest in the chemicals necessary to maker her products. She wants to give potential customers samples of her products in order to bring in new business. Her daughter is currently a marketing student and she wants to patent a brand for her mother to be able to market her product. The loan will also serve to cover these expenses.

Nancy and her husband have two children who are college students. During the week, her husband must leave home because he works at a banana plantation in rural Ecuador. Nancy started the business because she could not find a job and she felt the need to help her children through college.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Nancy needs the loan in order to invest in the chemicals necessary to maker her products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
2 years ago Maria decided to start her own store out of her home. She started off with just $100 in capital and slowly was able to increase her product line and her customer base. She now sells basic foods and snacks for kids. She opens her business every morning and closes late at night. With profits above her expectations, Maria has been continuously investing in her business.

Maria needs the loan in order to continue investing in her business. She wants to begin selling meats such as beef and chicken. She also wants to make some physical improvements to her shop.

Maria moved to Guayaquil from Esmeraldas, a predominantly Afro community, about ten years ago. She attained her land in a popular invasion of a territory now named Nigeria. She still does not have the paperwork for her home, which is built out of a bamboo like wood. Currently there is no pavement where she lives because the tide brings in the water. She has 5 small children and a husband who is works for the local water company.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She wants to begin selling meats such as beef and chicken.

loans.name: Kennys

texts.en:
Kennys owns a general store where she sells almost anything her clients will buy. The business was launched with $20 in capital. She now sells items including bed sheets, sodas and drinks, household items, and medicines. Kennys also holds a job as a worker for a local pharmaceutical company. This job not only provides a secondary source of income, it allows her to purchase medicine in bulk at wholesale prices.

Kennys is seeking the loan because she wants to continue to invest in new products. She sees the Christmas as a golden opportunity to make a good amount of sales. She will buy sheets, toys and more drinks.

Kennys is the 37 years old and has 8 children. She moved to Guayaquil from Esmeraldas, a city with a predominantly Afro community. She has always worked as a maid in households, but this new business venture has allowed her to quit those jobs. Due to the strenuous financial circumstances, none of her older children graduated from high school. They do help her run the business when she is at work.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Kennys is seeking the loan because she wants to continue to invest in new products

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
For about 8 months Johanna has been selling clothing from a catalogue. She mainly markets to her family, friends and neighbors. Once her customers decide what clothes they want, Johanna goes to the wholesale distributor and purchases the merchandise. She asks her clients for 50% of costs upfront and she must provide the other 50%.

Although Johanna does sell well, her lack of capital is a major restraint to her business. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase samples for her clients to see while she is selling. It would also help to have some liquidity for those clients who are not willing to pay the 50% up front costs.

Johanna is raising her two daughters on her own. Her husband left to Spain about a year ago because he could not find work in Ecuador. She lives with her mother who helps her take care of the children when she is out working. Before her husband left he bought them a large refrigerator so they would be able to sell sodas and other soft drinks out of their home. Johanna’s mom is the one that mostly tends to this business. Johanna’s dream is to have her husband come back to help her raise their two daughters.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase samples for her clients to see while she is selling.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy sells perfumes and cosmetics door-to-door in her neighborhood. Because Mercy was raised in a very poor household, she was forced to be a saleswoman from a very young age. She has been selling cosmetics and perfume for about 11 years. Thanks to her business she has been able to provide an important source of income for her household, especially at times when her husband was out of work.

She needs this loan in order to invest in products. Because Christmas is coming soon she will have a significant increase in demand. She wants to take advantage of this situation for the holiday season.

Mercy and her two children live with her husband at his parent’s home. He worked for a large company for 8 years until he was fired a year ago. He just found a new job as a salesman, but he is not sure if it will last long. Mercy’s goal is to set up a sector of her in-laws home as a point of sale for her business. She plans to continue to invest in merchandise before making any changes in construction.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products prior to the holiday season

loans.use: asdf
