Balabeyim is an old internally displaced person (IDP) who is the mother of one child. Her family\'s living condition is not very good. The family income is rather limited.

Since 2000, Balabeyim has supported her family by working as a cook in her small business. Actually, she is a very communicative person who loves people and accepts them as they are. In her view, cooking is some kind of art which reflects the feelings and mood of a cook. She likes international cousine but national dishes such as dolma, plov, khingal are her favorite ones.

Now, she needs a loan of $600 to further develop her business, to buy new kitchen appliances, to increse her incomes via diversifying the menu and attracting more clients.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances

loans.name: Sarvan Tiflis Oglu

texts.en:
Sarvan is 35-year old IDP and father of three children. The family income is rather limited. Since 2000 he has been engaged in rendering consulting and training services. He makes up business plans and finds his work very interesting.

Now he needs better office facilities and computer equipment and therefore applies for the loan of 1000$. His previous credit history includes three loans borrowed from Komak Credit Union in 2003-2005 and amounted at 600$, 800$, 1000$. The loans paid back timely.

He believes in the success of his business and his ability to pay the whole loan amount back.

loans.use: To buy computer equipment

loans.name: Alikram Muhammad Ogl

texts.en:
This 54-year old internally displaced person (IDP) is a father of four children. His family\'s living condition is not good enough.The family income is rather limited. Alikram has been engaged in carpentry to improve his family\'s living condition since 1991. He started his business with $400. Having not enough financialy resources, he couldn\'t develop his business well enough in the beginning. He applies for a loan amount of 1000$ for the first time.

Alikram needs $1000 loan in order to further develop his business, to buy new carpentry equipment, to increase his incomes, to improve his family\'s living condition with this additional income, and to obtain some funds for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy carpentry equipment

loans.name: Gabil Bahman Oglu

texts.en:
23-year-old Gabil lives his family life with 2 children. His family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. He is an internally displaced person (IDP). Since 2004 Gabil has been engaged in butchery to improve his family’s living condition. As he didn\'t have enough funds, he couldn\'t develop his business well enough in the beginning. He applies for a loan amount of $1000 for the first first time. 

Gabil needs $1000 loan in order to further develop his business, to buy new cows and sheeps (rams), to increase his income, and to improve his family\'s education needs for good.

loans.use: To buy new cows and sheeps (rams)

loans.name: Anasim Adan Oglu

texts.en:
54-year-old Anasim lives his family life with 3 children. His family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and second group disabled veteran. Since 2004 Anasim has been engaged in taxi driving to improve his family’s living condition. Due to an inability raise financial resources, he couldn\'t develop his business well enough.

Having borrowed 3 loans of $400-$600-$600 from Komak Credit Union in 2002-2004 Anasim significantly expanded his business. The loans were paid back timely.

He needs $800 loan, in order to further develop his business, to buy new spare parts, to increase his incomes, to improve his family\'s living condition with these additional incomes, and to obtain some funds for the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila is 51 years old. She is a widow with 2 children. She is the only supporter of her family. The permanent income of her family is low. Since 2001, Nazila has run her business for the maintenance of her family. She sells patties and, through this, makes her living.

In 2004 she borrowed her first loan in the amount of $200 from Norwegian Microcredit.

Now she needs the sum of $300 to expand her business. She would like to buy a new electric griddle plate. This will enable her to fry more patties and serve more clients in shorter time and thus to improve her family budget.

loans.use: To buy the new electric griddle plate.

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Khanim Yusif Gizi

texts.en:
50-year-old Khanim lives her family life with 5 children. Her family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. She is an internally displaced person (IDP). Since 2003, Khanim has been engaged in cattle breeding to improve her family’s living condition. She started her business with a cow and a calf. As she didn\'t have enough financial resources to begin with, she couldn\'t develop her business well enough.

Having borrowed 3 loans of $400-$600-$600 from Komak Credit Union in 2003-2005, Khanim significantly expanded her business, bought a lot of cows and calfs, achieved progress in her business, and increased her family income. The loans were paid back timely. Khanim is requesting this loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: To buy new cows and calfs

loans.name: Dayanat Sahraman Ogl

texts.en:
This 21-year old IDP is single. His family\'s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. Dayanat has been working as a hairdresser to improve his family\'s living condition since 1991. He is borrowing a loan for the first time.

He needs $400 in order to expand and develop his business, to buy equipment.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Ilhama Tevon Gizi

texts.en:
37-year old Ilhama lives her family with three children. Her family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. She is IDP.  Since 2001 Ilhama has been engaged in selling building materials to improve her family’s living condition. As she didn't have enough financial resources, she couldn't develop her business well enough in the beginning. 

She applies for a loan amount of 1000$ in first time to further develop her business, to increase her incomes, to improve her family's living condition with these additional incomes, to obtain some funds for the education of her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Keyyar

texts.en:
Keyyar is 33 years old. He lives with his parents. The family doesn\\\'t have a permanent income source. He is the only bread-winner of his family. Since 1998 Keyyar runs a clothing business. The start of his business began with children\\\'s clothing sales.

In 2005 Keyyar borrowed the loan amount of $400 from Norwegian Microcredit. Keyyar managed to expand his business and improve his family\\\'s living conditions.

Now, Keyyar needs $600 to buy varieties of fabrics and make a better living.

loans.use: To begin  fabrics sale

payments.comment: The repayment were paid back timely. No delinquency.

loans.name: Sarvat Hatam Oglu

texts.en:
38-year-old Sarvat lives his family life with 3 children. His family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. He is an internall displaced person (IDP). Since 2002 Sarvat has been engaged in selling home apliances .

He applies for a loan amount of $1000 for the first time to further develop his business, to buy new home apliances, to increase his incomes, to improve his family\'s living condition with this additional income, and to obtain some funds for the education of his children.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Sima Tiflis Gizi

texts.en:
She is 38. Her family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. She is an internally displaced person (IDP). Since 2003 Sima has been engaged in cattle breeding to improve her family’s living condition. She started her business with a cow. As she didn\'t have enough financial resources, she couldn\'t develop her business well enough in the beginning.

Having borrowed 3 loans of $400-$600-$600 from Komak Credit Union in 2003-2005 Sima significantly expanded her business, bought a lot of cows and calves, achieved progress in her business and increased her family income. The loans were paid back timely. Sima is requesting this loan to buy new cows and calves.

loans.use: To buy new cows and calves

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very young woman, with 24 years old she leads her own business; She lives with Ramon who works in a private company, he earns a minimum salary that does not allow him to cover all the home expenses. For that reason Elizabeth began her business with the purpose of supporting the family expenses. She started with few materials as valleys and pans; however through the time she has had the opportunity to purchase more materials. Her pleasure to cooking has let her to have more and more success, her exquisite meals has granted her to be 2 years selling her foods. She wants to grow in her business and she wants to plan a family to give them all the necessary.

She needs a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise that allows her to increase her production to support the demand that every day is increasing. Elizabeth requires your support and she requests your help.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Elizabeth es una mujer muy jovén, con 24 años de edad dirige su propio negocio; vive con Ramon quien trabaja en una empresa privada, sin embargo gana un salario mínimo que no le permite cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar. Por lo que Elizabeth empezó su negocio con la finalidad de apoyar con los gastos de la familia. Ella comenzó con poco materiales como hoyas y sartenes, sin embargo a través del tiempo ella ha tenido la oportunidad de comprar más materiales. Su gusto por la cocina la ha llevado a tener cada vez más éxito, sus exquisitos platillos le han concedido estar 2 años vendiendo sus comidas y esto le ha permitido aumentar sus ventas. Ella desea crecer en su negocio y planear una familia.

Necesita de $200 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita aumentar la producción y poder enfrentar la demanda que día con día se incrementa. Elizabeth requiere de tu apoyo y solicita tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a very young woman, she is 22 years old; she has two beautiful children with 3 and 1 year old respectively. Her concern is that they have a house, meals and an opportunity to study and to get ready for the future life. For this reason Maribel began her own business since 5 years ago. It consists in the food sales; she wants to give to her children a home where they can be developed because at the present time her family live in the husband’s mother house.

Maribel requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase inputs to the elaboration of her delicious meals. She hopes the next Christmas season her sales will increased, for that reason she needs to be prepared to assist the increase of her clients. She and her family need your help and support. In a term of 3 months Maribel wants to return the loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Maribel es una mujer muy joven, tiene 22 años de edad y tiene dos hermosos hijos de 3 y 1 año respectivamente. Su preocupación es que sus pequeños no les falte casa, comida y una oportunidad para estudiar y prepararse. Por esta razón Maribel inicio su negocio desde hace 5 años y consiste en la venta de comidas. Ella desea dar a sus hijos un hogar donde puedan desarrollarse porque en la actualidad su familia viven en la casa de la mama de su esposo.

Maribel requiere de un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus deliciosas comidas. Ella espera que esta próxima temporada navideña sus ventas se incrementen, por lo que necesita estar preparada para atender el aumento de sus clientes. Ella y su familia necesitan tu ayuda y apoyo. En un término de 3 meses Maribel desea retornar el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase inputs to the elaboration of her delicious meals

loans.name: Eva Marlen

texts.en:
Eva is 22 years old, she is a young, responsible and very hard-working woman, she has a beautiful son, for whom every day, she works very hard to cover all the home basic necessities. She wants to offer him a good education, so that, in the future he will be an honest and working person: For that reason she began her own business, it consist in lady clothes sales. She has 1 year in her business and it has allowed her to have an additional income to cover all the baby expenses; however her sales are limited because she doesn\\\'t have the monetary capital to purchase merchandise and support her bigger demand.

She requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise; this will allow her to have more clothes to sell. Eva says that these last months her sales have been increased due to the Christmas season that approaches, for that reason she doesn\\\'t want to lose the opportunity to increase the capacity of her business. She and her small son thank your support and affection.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Eva tiene 22 años edad, es una mujer joven, responsable y muy trabajadora, tiene un hermoso hijo por quien todos los días trabaja muy duro para cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar. Ella desea ofrecer a su hijo una buena educación para que en el futuro sea una persona honesta y trabajadora: Por esta razón empezó su propio negocio con la venta de ropa para dama. Tiene 1 años en su negocio y esto le ha permitido tener un ingreso adicional para cubrir los gastos de su bebe, sin embargo sus ventas son limitadas porque no cuenta con el capital monetario para comprar mas mercancía y poderla vender.

Ella requiere de un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar mercancía; esto le permitirá tener más ropa para vender. Eva dice que estos últimos meses sus ventas se han incrementado debido a la temporada navideña que se avecina, por lo que no quiere perder la oportunidad de incrementar la capacidad de su negocio. Ella y su pequeño hijo agradecen tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a seamstress who makes childrens clothing. She learned how to sew at a training school. For several years she worked with her sister in law who provided her with the sewing machine. Slowly she started to build her own customer base and she was able to save up to buy her own machine. Today she runs her own operation, although it is very limited. She works in production during the week and then sells her final products during the weekend.

Martha needs the loan in order to purchase cloth and other materials. This is a very busy time of year for her and she wants to take advantage of the increase in demand.

Martha is 56 years old and has 6 children who are all grown up. When she was young, she became a widow and had to take charge of her family on her own. Because of the economic situation, her children had to work from a very young age. Her home is now made out of wood and her dream is to have it built out of cement.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Martha needs the loan in order to purchase cloth and other materials

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison has a workshop where he makes beds and bedroom furniture. He has been in this type of business for about ten years. He learned the ins and outs of the trade when he was an assistant for his uncle. While he was an assistant, he saved up enough money to buy second hand machinery. His business now consists of making the beds and frames for most furniture. He sends his product to a furniture retailer who adds the color and finishing touches to his product. He makes about 12 complete bedroom sets a month with the help of his 3 employees.

Edison needs the loan because he wants to invest in wood before the rainy season. During the next couple of months wood will become much more expensive and it will be an added expense to his business. He wants to prepare buy purchasing enough wood to keep in stock until the prices fall again.

Edison is 28 years old and he is single. He lives right next to his mother in a home made out of bamboo like wood. His goal is to improve his mother’s home and to continue improving his business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Edison needs the loan because he wants to invest in wood before the rainy season.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.en:
Juanita is 39 years old, she lives in Escobedo Nuevo Leon; she is single mother and has 2 beautiful children, alone Juanita wants to offer them an education and a better quality of life, for that reason she began her business since 6 years ago. It consists on the quilts and clothes sales: Her sales are usually among her relatives and well-known people, however, her clients are increasing lately, but Juanita doesn\\\'t have the articles variety to her requesting clients, for that reason she needs to increase her capacity of sales products.

Juanita requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise that allows her increase the products variety; she hopes this next Christmas season, her sales will increase and her incomes will be bigger. In a term of 3-6 months Juanita plans to return the loan, she requires your help and support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Juanita tiene 39 años de edad, vive en Escobedo Nuevo León; ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hermosos hijos. Juanita solo quiere ofrecerles una educación y una mejor calidad, por lo que inició su negocio hace 6 años. Este consiste en la venta de sobre camas, colchas y ropa, normalmente sus ventas son entre sus familiares y conocidos, sin embargo, últimamente sus clientes están aumentando, pero Juanita no tiene la variedad de artículos que sus clientes necesitan, por lo que ella necesita aumentar su capacidad de productos para vender.

Juanita requiere de un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita aumentar la variedad de productos que tiene para vender; ella espera que esta próxima temporada navideña sus ventas se incrementen y sus ingresos sean mayores. En un término de 3-6 meses Juanita planea regresar el préstamo, ella requiere de tu ayuda y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda sells poultry in a local market. She remembers when she was young she used to help her parents sell vegetables in a similar type of market. She moved on to selling lunches and breakfasts at a stand of her own while she was raising her children. She has been selling chicken for the last 6 years at her stand in Guayaquil. Her entrepreneurial ventures have always allowed her to raise and support her kids.

She is seeking this loan because she wants to invest in chicken and pork, which sells extremely well in the month of December. She wants to see her business grow because it makes her feel alive. She loves the fact that she, at the age of 72, can still depend on herself for income.

Amanda also helps her family quite a bit. She had 12 children, 3 of which have gone to Spain in search of work and a better life. She helps raise 5 of her grandchildren whose parents are away. Although she says she has not been able to rest despite her 72 years of age, she seems intent on staying busy.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is seeking this loan because she wants to invest in chicken and pork, which sells extremely well in the month of December

loans.name: Devora

texts.en:
Devora lives in Escobedo Nuevo Leon, her family is integrate by 3 small boys of 18, 16 and 13 years. To Devora her biggest satisfaction is the opportunity to see how her boys are growing and offer them an education because she hopes from them in the future, they will be honest and working people as she is right now. Her husband’s name is Carlos and is a stationery employer, his salary is little and it does not allow him to cover all the family expenses. For that reason Devora began her own business since 2000; her business consists in order shoes sales and her job allows her to pay the children\\\'s studies, for that reason she wants to continue working and increase her sales capacity.

She requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise, because she can increase her products capacity and also she can increase the variety of them. In a term of 3-6 months Devora plans to return the loan; she thanks your support and affection.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Devora vive en Escobedo Nuevo León, su familia esta compuesta por 3 jóvenes chicos de 18, 16 y 13 años. Para Devora su mayor satisfacción es ver crecer a sus niños y poderles brindar una educación para que en el futuro sean personas honestas y trabajadoras como lo es ella. Su esposo se llama Carlos y es empleado de una papelería desde hace 26 años, sin embargo su salario es poco y no le permite cubrir con todos los gastos de la familia. Por lo que Devora inicio su propio negocio desde 2000, este consiste en la venta de zapatos por pedido y este trabajo le permite pagar a Eva los estudios de sus 3 hijos, por esta razón ella quiere continuar trabajando y aumentar su capacidad de ventas.

Ella requiere de un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar mercancía, porque de esta manera ella puede incrementar su capacidad de productos, además aumentar la variedad de estos. En un término de 3-6 meses Devora planea regresar el préstamo, por lo que ella agradece tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Genaro

texts.en:
Genaro owns a workshop where he makes bedroom and living room furniture. He moved to Guayaquil more than 20 years ago after growing up in rural Ecuador. When he moved to the city he found a job as an assistant for furniture maker. As time went on he learned the trade well and saved up enough money to start his own operation. He made a his backyard and part of his home into a workshop where he and his 3 sons now work.

Genaro needs the loan to invest in wood before the rainy season. For the next couple of months the price of wood will increase drastically due to shortage in supply. He wants to prepare buy purchasing enough wood to keep in stock until the prices fall again.

Genaro is 44 years old and has 7 kids who all live with him. 3 of him are part of his workforce and help him with the sole source of income in the household. The family is close knit and hard working.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Genaro needs the loan to invest in wood before the rainy season

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro sells one of the most popular foods in Ecuador, crab (cangrejo in Spanish). The crabs he sells, which are in the picture, are found in mangroves along the coast of Guayaquil. His father taught him how to catch these animals when he was 9 years old and he has been doing so ever since. Due to the unfortunate and strenuous economic situation his parents faced, Pedro did not go to school past the third grade. He cannot read and write, but out of the necessities of his job he has become good at math. Pedro no longer catches the animals himself to sell, instead he purchases them from wholesale distributors.

He needs the loan in order to purchase larger quantities of crab. The holiday season is a great time to sell because people have dinners known as “cangrejadas” where family and friends sit around a large table and break open crabs while talking and listening to music.

This business plays a major role in the life of Pedro. He has 5 children, although two of them are already independent. His two grown children work with Pedro and also lack a formal education. Pedro hopes that with the extra profits from this business he will be able to fix up his home. Currently it is made out of a bamboo like wood and is situated near the coast where the tide often brings in water to his house.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He needs the loan in order to purchase larger quantities of crab

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo owns a repair workshop with his brother. At their shop they fix all types of domestic electronics such as: microwaves, irons, ovens etc. He has been working in this type of activity for over 18 years and has had this business open with his brother for about 2. Their shop is located near a very busy market that allows them to bring in a stable amount of clients.

Pablo needs this loan in order to purchase scrap metal and other materials necessary for his work. He also wants to purchase new tools and materials that can help him in his business.

Pablo is 51 years old and has 5 children who are all grown up. He is separated from his wife and lives alone in his house. Currently he wants to make improvements to his home and help support his kids in ventures of their own.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Pablo needs this loan in order to purchase scrap metal and other materials necessary for his work.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.en:
Segundo has a shop where he sells animal feed, medicines and live poultry. He sells products for all types of animals ranging from pigs to ducks. Many people in his community raise these types of animals in their own backyards in order to resell them later for profits. He learned this business while being an assistant for his uncle for ten years. His uncle motivated him to start his own shop about 4 years ago and now he has a spot in his home where he makes his sales.

Segundo needs this loan in order to invest in products at wholesale prices and quantities. He also wants to help his wife set up a part of their business as a small food market. They have been experimenting with the idea with some sales and they see potential for increased profits.

Segundo and his wife are a young couple with one child. They have a humble home made out of cement and they want to continue making improvements to it.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Segundo needs this loan in order to invest in products at wholesale prices and quantities.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty owns a carpentry and furniture making business. While she was living with her husband at his mother’s house, she learned the business from her brother in law. When her brother in law left to start his own business on the other side of the city, Letty bought all the equipment off of him in order to run the business herself. She hired two workers and brought her husband into the business to help her as well. She knows the trade well, although most of her job entails purchasing the materials and finding buyers for the finished product.

Letty needs this loan in order to buy a tool that will allow her to give her products a more professional finish. She hopes that with this investment she can improve the quality of her work and increase sales.

Letty and her husband have one child together. He now works at a shipyard in Guayaquil and helps out in the household and in the business. Her dream is to have her own home one day and run her shop out of theire.

loans.use: Letty needs this loan in order to buy a tool that will allow her to give her products a more professional finish.

loans.name: Ma. Concepción

texts.en:
Concepcion is 42 years old, she began her business in 1988; she has been working in food sales like meat and champurrado (the champurrado is a especial Mexican chocolate) in a table out side her house; with the time she bought a tacos cart and her job place is in a very trafficked street of Monterrey city. She has 7 children and they were her inspiration to start her business. At the moment she plans to make it grow. Concepción is a very lovely to her family, for that reason she wants to offer her children a good education and a better quality of life. One of her daughters is the person who helps her in the business so the business has become a family project.

Concepcion needs a loan of $925 USD to purchase utensils and special frying pans to cook, these allows her to increase the capacity of her production because her orders and her clients have been increased. At the moment she is not yet with the capacity to assist the increment of her demand, for that reason, she and her family need your help and generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Concepción tiene 42 años de edad, inicio su negocio en 1988 y se dedicaba a vender barbacoa y champurrado en una mesita que tenía afuera de su casa; con el tiempo compro un puesto de tacos y su lugar de trabajo es en una calle muy transitada de la ciudad de Monterrey. Tiene 7 hijos y ellos fueron su inspiración para iniciar su negocio, actualmente planea hacerlo crecer. Concepción es una persona muy entregada a su familia por lo que desea ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Una de sus hijas es la persona quien le ayuda en el negocio por lo que esto se ha convertido en un proyecto familiar.

Concepción necesita de $925 USD para comprar utensilios y vaporeras que le permitan aumentar la capacidad de producción de su negocio ya que se han incrementado sus pedidos y sus clientes, pero aun no cuenta con la capacidad de atender el incremento de su demanda. Ella y su familia necesitan de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase utensils and special frying pans to cook

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes owns a small diner where she makes breakfast and lunch. She started the business in light of the struggling financial situation she found her husband in. With a small amount of capital, she was able to rent a location for her business and invest in rice, eggs and other ingredients for her meals.

Lourdes needs the loan in order to make improvements to her business. With her previous loan she was able to buy many more ingredients and offer a more diverse menu. She is now looking to also invest in a new freezer for her business.

Lourdes is 46 years old and has 5 children. Only her daughter who is 11 lives with her because she goes to school. Her husband now works and helps support the household. Her dream is to allow her daughter to finish high school and possibly attend college.

loans.use: Lourdes needs the loan in order to make improvements to her business.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar sells chickens in his local community. He mainly targets family and friends but he is sure that he can reach new markets. He sells about 20 to 30 chickens a day and is looking to continue improving his sales. Previously he owned a barbecue stand where he sold roasted chickens. He sold the stand in order to invest in a truck that he believed would allow him to purchase and distribute wholesale goods. Unfortunately he bought a lemon and his truck has not provided the business opportunities he hoped for.

Cesar is seeking the loan in order to increase his investments. He wants to begin purchasing poultry at wholesale quantities in order to resell to market vendors and shop owners. He also needs to fix up the spot in his backyard where he raises the live chickens he buys.

Cesar is 55 years old and has 3 children. His wife is a seamstress who helps bring in a complimentary source of income. Unfortunatley, both of Cesar’s older children (age 28 and 30) have mental disabilities. His kids rely on their mother and father for financial and emotional support. The couple works hard to provide their children with a decent living.

loans.use: He wants to begin purchasing poultry at wholesale quantities in order to resell to market vendors and shop owners

loans.name: Yrma

texts.en:
Yrma has been selling clothing for about 3 years. She first stared working in this type of activity about 10 years ago but had to quit when she had her children and her husband no longer allowed to her work. She now sells to the immediate community, friends and family. She buys the clothing in bulk from her husbands boss who is a wholesale disritbutor.

Yrma is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in sheets and table cloths. She currently cannot afford to make many investments in her business because of a lack of capital. She hopes that with the extra profits she will have sufficient capital to increase her inventory.

Yrma is 39 years and has 3 children. Her husband works as a security guard for a large company. Her goal is to be able to put her kids through high school and provide them with a better living.

loans.use: Yrma is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in sheets and table cloths.

loans.name: Geoconda

texts.en:
Geoconda is a seamstress who makes sheets and clothing. She has 8 years of experience in this type of activity. She started off as an assistant for someone else and moved on to take a course where she significantly improved her skills. Today she dedicates most of the day to her sewing and also helps her mom at night at her small restaurant. She needs the loan in order to invest in a new sewing machine now that hers is beginning to falter.

Geoconda is 25 years old and has 3 children. One of her kids has already started school and the others are still at young ages. Her husband drives Geoconda’s mother’s car as a taxi in order to bring in some income. Their dream is to purchase their own car and make improvements to their home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan in order to invest in a new sewing machine now that hers is beginning to falter.

loans.name: Eloy Tomas

texts.en:
Eloy is working in the production and sale of Donuts, he learned how to cook them since 20 years ago in a bakery where he worked, however he lost his job, for that reason he decided to start his own business. At the moment he distributes his Donuts on the streets and he works alone. Eloy has 3 young children in his family; his wife is a housewife, so Eloy has a commitment to offer his children an education and a better quality of life. He is a very responsible, honest and working person, and every day Eloy puts all his effort to continue working and cover all the necessities from his beautiful family.

Eloy needs a loan of $200 USD to purchase raw material to the production of his delicious Donuts, he comments that this season is the beast to sale his products, so he wants to have a bigger production capacity. The form that he is going to use the loan is buying oil, flour, sugar, etc. In a term of 3-6 months Eloy plans to return this loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Eloy se dedica a la producción y venta de donas, aprendió a cocinarlas hace 20 años en una panadería donde el trabajaba, sin embargo se quedo sin empleo, por lo que decidió emprender su propio negocio. Actualmente distribuye sus donas por las calles y trabaja solo. Tiene 3 jóvenes niños en su familia, su esposa es ama de casa, por lo que para Eloy es un compromiso ofrecer a sus hijos una educación y una mejor calidad de vida. El es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora por lo que todos los días Eloy pone todo su esfuerzo para seguir trabajando y cubrir las necesidades de su hermosa familia.

Eloy necesita de $200 USD para comprar materia prima para la producción de sus ricas donas, comenta que estas temporadas son las más fuertes de todo el año en venta de su producto, por lo que desea tener una mayor capacidad de producción. La forma como utilizara el préstamo será comprando aceite, harina, azúcar, etc. En un término de 3-6 meses Eloy planea regresar el préstamo

loans.use: Purchase raw materia

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe works with a Chilean artist who reproduces and enlarges photographs. She finds the clients for him, picks up the pictures and makes the deliveries. She must pay the artist in advance for many of the jobs, which gives her problems due to her lack of liquidity. She is seeking the loan in order to be able to ask for more jobs from the artist. She also wants to invest in a completely separate business. She once raised and sold chickens, and she is hoping to pick up this business again as a complimentary source of income.

Lupe is 45 years old and is married. She has 4 children, 2 of which have jobs but still live with her. Her husband has a part time job and is trying to finish his studies in agricultural engineering.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Pay in advance for picture reproductions

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen sells cosmetics, clothes and jewelry. She has been in this line of work for about 8 years. Prior to this, she had a small stand where she sold fruits and vegetables, but she had to close down after she became ill. After she got better, she decided to start a business that was more flexible. She sells all types of women’s items to her friends and neighbors. Carmen needs the loan in order to make a last round of investments before the year closes.

Carmen has three children, two of which are already working. Her youngest child, a nine year old boy, has a mental disability. It is very rough for her to raise him because she has limited access to psychological and medical services, but her son receives all the love and care her family can offer.

loans.use: Carmen needs the loan in order to make a last round of investments before the year closes.

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Raymunda is working in the French fries sales, these are consumed as snack, this occupation she was learn it since more than 20 years ago, however her business began 15 years ago. When she had to support the home expenses, which are many, because Raymunda has 5 children and they are 20, 16,14,11 and 5 years old; she needs to work very hard every day to help her husband with the family expenses. She wants to offer her children an education that allows them in the future, to be honest and working person.

Raymunda requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase raw material, that allows her to produce a bigger quantity of French fries, because her clients have increased and the demand for her product is bigger than before; but she still does not have the capacity to cover her new demand. Raymunda just wants to work and support her family; she needs your help and generosity.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Doña Raymunda se dedica a la venta de papas fritas consumidas como botana, este oficio lo aprendió desde hace más de 20 años, sin embargo su negocio lo inicio hace 15 años. Al tener que enfrentarse con los gastos del hogar, los cuales son muchos debido a que Doña Raymunda es madre de 5 hijos y sus edades son 20, 16 14 11 y 5 años; ella necesita trabajar muy duro todos los días para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia. Ella desea ofrecerles una educación que les permita en el futuro, ser persona honesta y trabajadora.

Doña Raymunda requiere de $200 USD para comprar materia prima que le permita producir una mayor cantidad de papas fritas, debido a que sus clientes han aumentado y la demanda por su producto es mayor; pero aún no tiene la capacidad para enfrentar esta nueva demanda. Doña Raymunda solo quiere trabajar y ayudar a su familia, ella necesita de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Juana Lorenza

texts.en:
Juanita has a groceries store, which she began some years ago; she began her business because she had the necessity to help her partner with the home expenses, her husband works as bricklayer and his income does not allow him to cover all the family expenses. With 2 children to care, she looks the way to offer to her children studies and a better quality of life. When she began, she sold sodas and snack products, and then she included video games and some groceries.

At the moment her business continues growing and her clients require another kind of products, these are demanded in great quantity, but Juanita does not have the capacity to increase her merchandise. She needs of $200 USD to purchase these kinds of products and she can increase the products capacity from her business and increase her sales as well.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Doña Juanita tiene un negocio de abarrotes, el cual inicio algunos años atrás. Lo inició con la necesidad de ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que su pareja trabaja como albañil y su ingreso no le permite cubrir con todos gastos de la familia. Con 2 hijos a su cuidado, ella busco la manera para poder ofrecerles estudios y una mejor calidad de vida. Cuando empezó, vendía refrescos y productos para botana, después incluyo juegos de video y algunos abarrotes.

Actualmente su negocio sigue creciendo hasta el modo que sus clientes requieren de otro tipo de productos, estos demandados son demandados en gran cantidad, pero Doña Juanita no tiene la capacidad de incrementar su mercancía. Ella necesita de $200 USD para comprar estos productos y de esta forma puede aumentar la capacidad de productos en su negocio y aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is a responsible, friendly and very hard-working person; the most important satisfaction in his life is to see his children smiles, because these fill him of force and an inspiration that let him to continue working. He has 5 children, which are studying and others help in the family business, his wife Maria is a housewife, but sometimes also helps in the business. Pedro wants to offer to his children an education and a better quality of life, however he knows that the only way to make it, is working hard every day. He has a groceries store since 2 years ago and every day his sales go improving.

Pedro requires a loan of $250 USD to increase his inventory of merchandise from his business, he comments that his clients are increasing, but he does not have the capacity to cover his demand, for that reason he needs your support and generosity.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Pedro es una persona responsable, amigable y muy trabajadora; la satisfacción más importante en su vida es mirar las sonrisas de sus hijos porque lo llenan de fuerza y de inspiración para seguir trabajando. Tiene 5 hijos, los cuales algunos se encuentran estudiando y otros ayudan en el negocio de la familia, su esposa Maria es una ama de casa, pero algunas veces también ayuda en el negocio. Pedro desea ofrecer a sus hijos una educación y una mejor calidad de vida, sin embargo sabe que la única manera de hacerlo, es trabajando todos los días. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace ya 2 años y cada día sus ventas van mejorando.

Pedro requiere un préstamo de $250 USD para aumentar la existencia de mercancía de su negocio, comenta que sus clientes se están incrementando y no cuenta con la capacidad para enfrentar esta demanda, por lo que necesita de tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a very young woman; she began her business because she had the necessity to help her husband with the family expenses, and mainly to offer her children an education. Her business consists in a groceries store, however Alicia wants to make it grow; her husband is a trucks operator but his salary is not enough to cover all the home expenses. Their 3 young children have 19, 9 and 3 years old, for that reason Alicia works hard every day to cover their necessities and pay their studies.

She requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise like milky, beans, hygienic products and other articles that will allow her to increase her sales capacity. Alicia wants with this investment, her incomes will increase, for that reason her family needs your help and they thank your affection.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Alicia es una mujer muy joven, inició su negocio ante la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia y principalmente ofrecer a sus hijos una educación. Su negocio consiste en una tienda de abarrotes, sin embargo Alicia desea hacerla crecer; su esposo es operador de maquinaria pesada y su salario no es suficiente para cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Sus 3 jóvenes hijos tienen 19, 9 y 3 años de edad, por lo que Alicia trabaja muy duro todos los días para cubrir sus necesidades y pagar sus estudios.

Ella requiere de $200 USD para comprar mercancía como lácteos, fríjol, higiénicos y otros productos que le permitirán aumentar su capacidad de ventas. Alicia desea que con está inversión sus ingresos vayan a aumentar, por lo que su familia necesitan tu ayuda y agradecen tu cariño.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise like milky, beans, hygienic products and other articles.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.en:
Mrs. Demetrio is a very friendly and hard-working person; he has 3 children who every day fills him of love and inspiration to work and continue to covering all the expenses family. He has 2 years with his business and it began with the snack sales like potatoes, shells (another kin-d of snack in Mexico), pop corns and sodas. HIs business is near of a school, so that every day he has more clients. His family helps in the business, so that also it has become another way to be close to the family. This business has allowed to Don Demetrio to cover all the home expenses, for that reason he wants to grow his business buying video games in his snack to have bigger incomes.

He needs a loan of $250 USD to purchase merchandise and put video games in his snack, because this next Christmas season Don Demetrio has his bigger incomes from all the year, for that he wants to increase the capacity of his products to sell and a term of 3 to 6 months, he plans to return the loan

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Don Demetrio es una persona muy amigable y trabajadora, tiene 3 hijos quienes todos los días lo llenan de amor e inspiración para continuar trabajando y seguir cubriendo los gastos de su familia. Tiene 2 años con su negocio e inició con la venta de botanas como papitas, conchitas, burritos y refrescos; su negocio se encuentra cerca de una escuela, por lo que cada día tiene mas clientes. Su familia ayuda en el negocio, por lo que también este se ha convertido en otro modo para convivir. Este negocio le ha permitido a Don Demetrio cubrir con los gastos de su hogar, por lo que quiere impulsar su negocio comprendo video juegos en su “Snack” para tener mayores ingresos.

El necesita un préstamo de $ 250 USD para comprar mercancía y para poner video juegos en su negocio, debido a que esta próxima temporada navideña Don Demetrio tiene sus mayores ingresos de todo el año, por lo que desea aumentar la capacidad de sus productos para vender y en un término de 3 a 6 meses, el planea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and put video games

loans.name: Alekov

texts.en:
Alekov is a 31-year-old Roma from Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly known as Gypsies in the West, is a severely marginalized group in the Balkan Peninsula of Southeast Europe. Alekov is married with two kids.

Alekov is an independent contractor focused on home repairs. He’s been doing this for 15 years, first as an apprentice and then on his own for the last 10 years. Most of the work he does in within the Roma ghetto of Sliven, where his business comes almost exclusively through referrals. The proceeds of this loan will be used for two things: 1) to purchase metalworking tools, some of which Alekov is buying for the first time and some of which are replacements and 2) working capital, which predominately will be used to fund the hiring of an employee.

Alekov is excited about the opportunities this loan will open up to him. He’s clearly thinking about a big business several years down the line.

loans.use: Capital equipment and working capital

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en:
Aneta is a Roma from Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly known as Gypsies in the West, is a severely marginalized group in the Balkan Peninsula of Southeast Europe. Aneta is married with one child.

Aneta’s business is importing and selling clothing from Turkey. Every Sunday evening around 8pm, Aneta and several other Roma hop on a chartered microbus (closer to a minivan than a bus) and travel down to Istanbul. Among the group is “Baba Zeira”, (Grandmother Zeira), who has also received a loan from Kiva:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=392

This group, predominately comprised of women, arrive in Istanbul between 6 and 7am Monday morning, passing through the border crossing at Svelingrad in the middle of the night. They split up and spend the entire day shopping in the garment district (near the main bazaar) for the types of clothes they each sell in Sliven. They get back on their minibus with bags of merchandise for the next week that evening, and are back in Sliven Tuesday morning.

Aneta focuses on dresses, which are predominately worn at Roma weddings and other major events. Her gross margin is good – 45% - but the constant travel back and forth to Istanbul is taxing, both financially and mentally. This loan will give her the working capital to purchase more inventory on individual trips and make that trip less often. In addition, she’ll be able to expand the breadth of her offerings and offer her clients more selection.

A short video clip taken inside Aneta’s house / warehouse can be found here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3rJ_iuSpi5Q

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: N. Fashions is a well known Fabric Designer based in Accra. She designs local fabrics for second cycle institutions, private and government organizations. Her unique designs attracts a lot of customers to her shop. She has several customers within and outside Accra. She operates her business from home and wish to set up her own business premise. She therefore requires KIVA loan assistance of $800 to enable her erect a shed where she will operate her Batik Tye & Dye business from with her 12 apprentices. She has participated in the TEACH lending programs of Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rejoyce

texts.en: Rejoice prepares cooked rice for school children in her vicinity. The children enjoys her food very well. Though the school children who patronise Real\'s meals she is of the view that she needs to provide a cover over the food she sells as required by the Sanitary Act of the local Government Law. Coupled with the training received from Kraban Support Foundation\'s TEACH lessons she believes that it is time she provides a simple cover over the food she sells to the children. To this end, she requires a credit facility of a $750 KIVA loan.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela opened this beauty shop shortly after separating from her ex-husband. She not only provides beauty services she also sells a variety of products to her clients. Included in her beauty services are facial treatments and massages, which are not very common in the area she works in. Her clients are loyal and are very satisfied with her work.

This business is the main source of income for her and her two children. She plans to use the loan to invest in beauty supplies and tools for her salon. She needs to buy massage creams and also hair dye for these upcoming months that are always busier.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs to buy massage creams and also hair dye for these upcoming months that are always busier.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy goes to the rural communities and buys agricultural produce from farmers and sells them to urban workers in a market near Accra. Mercy does not have a market stall of her own. She would like to rent one since she sells in an open space near a major road which poses some danger and risk to her income generating activity. After participating in Kraban Support Foundation\'s TEACH lending programs she has plans to have a stall with KIVA loan to enable her keep her business records in her own apartment devoid of any hazard. She wants a  credit  facility of $875

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is starting a new business based on the skills she learned at the Mifex MERIT Centers. At our training facilities she participated in a course where she learned arts and crafts. Specifically she will be making party and house decorations. She is already selling the products she makes but she her growth is restrained because she cannot afford materials. She is seeking this small loan in order to buy: scissors, glue, a glue gun and other decorative items. Her husband motivated to take the course and supports her in her business venture. She hopes that she can begin to contribute to her family income in order to provide for her 3 children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is seeking this small loan in order to buy: scissors, glue, a glue gun and other decorative items.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Ampara and her husband have a workshop where they make and sell gates, fences and other metalwork. Ampara is in charge of commercializing the products that her husband makes and running the administrative part of the business. Her and her husband have had this business for 4 years now and are looking to make it grow. They need the loan because they have had a boost in orders, but they do not have the raw materials to complete them.

Amara and her husband have 6 children together. Life has not been easy for them because of the tough financial situation. They see hope in their business as it has steadily grown and built a strong customer base. They hope that with the extra profits they make they will be able to provide their children with better food and education.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: They need the loan because they have had a boost in orders, but they do not have the raw materials to complete them.

loans.name: Ángel

texts.en:
Angel has a small store where he sells snacks and foods. He also makes lunches and delivers them to construction sites to make sales. He has had this business for about five years after he lost his job selling supplies. He is seeking to use his money to purchase his food supply from wholesalers. He is a very hard worker who runs his business from early in the morning until 10 PM.

Angel is 31 years old and does not have a family. Currently he is studying at a local university on the weekends in order to get his degree. He is very optimistic about the future of his business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He is seeking to use his money to purchase his food supply from wholesalers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosita sells pots and other kitchenware. She has been working in this line of business for 2 years after being taught the ins and outs of the trade by her brothers. With $50 in capital she bought some merchandise and began selling door-to-door. Rosita is in need of financing in order to increase her product line. She has always had a scarcity of capital and this has restrained her business from growing. She plans to purchase a variety of products from wholesalers in order to increase profits.

Rosita is 30 years old, is married, and has three children. Her husband is very supportive of her activities and helps her buy and transport the goods. They work very hard to provide an education for their children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Rosita is in need of financing in order to increase her product line.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmita has been selling cosmetics for more than 8 years. She began doing this when a neighbor became a distributor and provided goods for the local community to sell. Her husband gave her $100 in capital in order to get her started. Her business is doing quite well as she already has over 50 clients that purchase regularly. She needs the loan so she may be able to invest in a larger quantity of cosmetics at wholesale prices.

Carmita is 29 years old and has 5 children. It has been difficult for her and her husband to provide the basic necessities for the kids. Thanks to this business, she has been able to make it through some very hard times. Her goal is to make a section of her home into shop for her products.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan so she may be able to invest in a larger quantity of cosmetics at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos has owned his bakery for 4 years. He delivers his goods door-to-door to his neighbors and community members. He specializes in pastries and other sweets, but also makes different types of breads. Thanks to his recent success, he has hired three part time employees to help him deliver the goods. He is seeking the loan because he wants to move into a larger space. He also wants to invest in display cases.

Carlos is 44 years old and has 2 daughters. Currently, he rents his home but he aspires to buy a house of his own in the future. He also wants to provide the best education possible to his children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He is seeking the loan because he wants to move into a larger space. He also wants to invest in display cases.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela owns a shoe store in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She has owned her business for about 9 years. She started the business with her late husband who passed away several years ago. It was very difficult for her to continue on without her business and life partner, but she has endured through the hard times. She feels very proud to know that she has been able to succeed with the help of her daughter. She is requesting this loan because she wants to set up a new point of sale managed by her daughter. She will use the money to rent some space and invest in products.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Open a new point of sale run by her daughter

payments.comment: paga su credito en su totalidad.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has a store where she sells a variety of products. She started off by selling home made popsicles and tortillas. She continuously reinvested her profits into the business and now she sells perfumes and other cosmetic products as well. She needs the loan because she wants to invest in a new line of products for her business. She sees great business potential for the future but insists that the lack of capital is holding her business back from growing. She uses most of the profits for her business for her home and the education of her 13 year old daughter.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invests in products by purchasing from wholesalers

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia sells automotive products such as the engine seals pictured. She has this business because her husband works for a factory that makes many of these products. Therefore, he has access to purchase these goods at wholesale prices and quantities while his wife is in charge of the store that sells them. They do much of their business with mechanics around the area.

Lucia is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in a wider variety of products. She does not to rely only on her husbands factory and she wants to have diversity in her product offerings. This couple has two children together. This business and her husband’s job are the main sources of income in this household.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Lucia is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in a wider variety of products

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angelita currently sells clothes and perfume in her local community. She must travel door-to-door marketing her products and trying to make sales to her friends and family. It is very tough for her to sell in this manner because of the extremely hot weather. She is also very limited in the amount of clothes she can walk around with to display. Therefore, she is requesting this loan in order to make a part of her home into a clothing store. She has already designated the area but needs the capital in order to make some adjustments to the space and fix up the store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Make a part of her home into a clothing store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia runs a small restaurant with her mother. She began her entrepreneurial ventures as a clothes saleswoman. She decided to open up a restaurant with her mother in downtown Guayaquil. Unfortunately, the rent was to expensive there and she had to move the business to her home. She makes most of her money from the lunches she delivers to companies and at construction sites.

Sonia needs the loan in order to buy tables and chairs for her business. She wants to do more than just deliver, her goal is to offer clients a place to stay and eat.

She is a single mother with two children who are in school. Her and her children live with Sonia’s mother who has always lent them a helping hand. Her dream is to own a home of her own.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Sonia needs the loan in order to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva sells one of Ecuador’s most popular seafoods, crab or cangrejo in Spanish. She and her husband have been in this line of work for about 15 years. She learned from her grandfather who was an expert in catching these animals in the muddy waters along the Ecuador coast. In the picture, you can see Eva and her husband in their canoe along the waters surrounding La Isla Trinitaria, a very poor sector of on the outskirsts of Guayaquil.

The loan will be used in order to invest in a motor for the canoe that Eva uses to catch the crab. She will also invest in other seafood products to sell.

Eva and her husband have 4 children, 3 of which are still in school. The oldest son is already in college and works on his own in order to pay for the costs. She lives with her sister in a house she inherited from her mother.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: The loan will be used in order to invest in a motor for the canoe that Eva uses to catch the crab. She will also invest in other seafood products to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda makes lunches and dinners for the employees of a large company. Her son came to her with this opportunity when he found out his company was looking to contract someone. Another one of her son’s who lives abroad helped her with the seed capital in order to get the business going. Prior to this she was a maid for a family and she also had to cook. She is now seeking this loan because she has been offered new contracts but cannot afford to buy the raw foods and ingredients to fulfill the orders.

Hilda is 57 years old and has 7 sons and daughters. 2 of them still live at home and help her in her business. Her husband works as a security guard at a large company.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is now seeking this loan because she has been offered new contracts but cannot afford to buy the raw foods and ingredients to fulfill the orders.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita makes cleaning products like disinfectant, soap, detergent, shampoo, etc. She has been working in this business for about 20 years. This type of business is very lucrative in this sector because the manufactured versions of these products are usually too expensive for most to afford. Therefore, Angelita can make her own products at home and sell them to other businesses.

Angelita started off as a clothes saleswoman in a business venture with a family member. Due to her lack of capital she could not make the business succeed. She does not want the same thing to happen to her in this operation. She is seeking a loan in order to buy the chemicals necessary to make her products. She is married and has two kids, one who is still in school and the other who works but still lives at home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is seeking a loan in order to buy the chemicals necessary to make her products

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by five entrepreneurs from the Khelcom 2 Association, led by Ousmane N.. The group describes their business:

“Context of the project: Located in the tourist zone of Cap Skirring, the village of Boucotte Ouolof is a village of farmers who dedicate themselves to producing fresh fruits and vegetables. In fact, this village is the source of vegetables for the hotels in Cap Skirring. The dissatisfaction of the hotels and the fact that the demand exceeds the supply drives hotels, for example the Club Med, to purchase their fresh produce in Dakar [Senegal’s capital, a two day’s journey from Boucotte Ouolof]. In response to this situation, the Khelcom 2 Association proposes to launch this project in order to meet this demand.

Purpose of the loan: To combat migration from rural areas, improve the living conditions of our members, and satisfy the hotels’ demand for produce.

Activities: Plant 7 hectares of garden with: onions, okra, eggplants, peppers, wild eggplants, cabbage, potatoes, etc. These varieties will be sold to the hotels of Cap Skirring and other tourist-hosting facilities in the area.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Situer dans la zone touristique du Cap Skirring, Le village de Boucotte Ouolof est un village d’agriculteurs qui se donne au maraîchage. En effet ce village est la source de ravitaillement des hôtels du Cap Skirring en légume La non satisfaction des hôtels et la supériorité de la demande par rapport à l’offre pousse les hôtelier par exemple le club med à aller se ravitailler à Dakar. Pour faire face à cette situation, le groupement Khelcom 2 se propose d’initier ce projet pour répondre à cette demande.

Objectifs du Prêt : Lutter contre l’exode, améliorer les conditions de vie des membres du groupement, satisfaire la demande auprès des hôtels.

Activités : Exploiter 7 hectares de jardinage en culture de : oignons, gombo, Obergine, Piment, Obergine sauvage, choux, pommes de terre, etc. Ces variétés seront vendues dans les hôtels du cap Skirring et autres structures hôtelières de la zone. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of gardening equipment and seeds; installation of drip irrigation system; transportation to market

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.en:
This loan will be shared by three women from the island village of Cachouane in the Casamance region of southern Senegal. The group describes their business plan as follows:

“We are a group of women from the village of Cachouane. We live on an island where adequate supplies of fruits and vegetables are very hard to come by, especially during the winter. The tourist hostels in our village also have trouble maintaining their stock of fruits and vegetables. Our purpose is to be in a position to satisfy all the demand for fresh produce both within and outside the village; and also to earn some extra money which will help us to improve our living conditions and take proper care of our children. Our enterprise consists of traveling to Dakar [the capital of Senegal – two days’ journey from Cachouane!] to purchase cosmetic products; and also we will go to buy vegetables and fruits in the mainland towns of Mlomp, Oussouye and Ziguinchor, which we will sell again at home.”

Original French :

« Contexte du Projet: Notre groupement est un groupe de femmes du village de Cachouane. Nous habitons dans une île ou l’approvisionnement en fruits et légumes est très difficile, surtout en période hivernal et aussi les auberges du village ont des difficultés à s’approvisionner.

Objectifs du Prêt : Notre objectif est de pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes à l’intérieur et à l’extérieur du village ; afin aussi de pouvoir gagner un peut de sous qui nous aidera à améliorer nos conditions de vie et pouvoir s’occuper de nos enfants

Activités : Notre activité consiste à aller acheter des produits cosmétiques à Dakar que nous allons exposer et vendre à Cachouane ; en outre nous irons acheter des légumes et des fruits en terre ferme vers Mlomlp, Oussouye, et Ziguinchor que nous vendrons chez nous. »

Background

Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of garden produce and cosmetics; transportation of goods to market

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by four women from the island village of Carabane, located at the mouth of the Casamance River in southern Senegal. Represented by Binta S., the group describes their enterprise as follows:

“We live in a place that used to receive a lot of tourists and travelers who came from nearby islands in order to board the ship that links Dakar [the capital of Senegal] with Ziguinchor [the capital of the southern region of Casamance]. However, since the sinking of the Joola [note: the Joola was the original ship that used to make a stop at Carabane on its way between Dakar and Ziguinchor, however after a tragic accident which resulted in the sinking of the Joola, the stops at Carabane were discontinued] we established our business at the port, where we market local products that we purchase in the villages.

Our objective is to sell the greatest possible quantity of the seafood and forest products of the local villages, in order to earn enough money to fulfill our needs, and to improve our sources of income in order to pay for our children’s schooling. Our business will consist of purchasing and reselling a large quantity of seafood and forest products, as well as small-scale retail trade of various merchandise. It is for this purpose that we are requesting a loan of 600,000 francs in order to launch this enterprise on a large scale.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet : Nous habitons une zone enclavée qui reçoit beaucoup de touristes et de passagers venants des îles voisines pour prendre le bateau qui fait la liaison Dakar Ziguinchor. Mais, depuis le naufrage du bateau le Joola, nous sommes installées au port nous écoulons les produits que nous achetons dans les villages vers les villes du Sénégal.

Objectifs du Prêt : Notre objectif est d’écoulé la plus grande quantité possible de la production halieutique et forestière des éco villages afin de pouvoir subvenir à nos besoins.

Améliorer nos sources de revenus pour pouvoir faire face aux frais de la scolarité de nos enfants. Activités : Achat et vente de produits halieutique et forestier en grande quantité ; et fournir les petits commerces. C’set pour ses besoins que nous sollicitons un prêt de 600 000F pour pouvoir nous relancés dans cette activité qui consiste à aculter en gros. »

Background

Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. loans.use: Purchasing seafood and other village products; transportation to market

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by five women from the village of Effock in the southern region of Casamance. Represented by group leader Jacqueline D., the group describes their business activities as follows:

“Background: Effock is a village in reconstruction after having experienced more than ten years under the fire of war with the [separatist conflict] crisis in Casamance. Being in reconstruction, we need financial support which will help us manage our enterprises properly in order to better face this new phase that we are beginning.

Purpose of the loan: To combat migration from rural areas, reconstruct our village, and improve the living conditions of its inhabitants.

Business activities: Our principal activity is maraillage; that is, we purchase fish from the village fishermen which we sell in the town of Oussouye, to travelers on the national road that passes through our region, and also to hotels. We also conduct commercial activities, selling local products that we produce ourselves, such as palm oil, oysters, clams, etc.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Le village de Effock, est un village en reconstruction après avoir vécu plus de 10 années sous le feu de la guerre avec le problème en Casamance. Etant en reconstruction, les populations nous avons besoin d’un soutien financier qui va nous aider à bien mener nos activités pour mieux affrontée cette nouvelle phase que nous entamons.

Objectifs du Prêt : Lutter contre l’exode, dans le cadre de la reconstruction du village, améliorer les conditions de vie des populations.

Activités : Notre activité principale est : le maraillage c\\\'est-à-dire que nous achetons du poisson auprès des pêcheurs du village et que nous revendons à Oussouye, sur la route nationale aux passagers et aussi dans les structures hôtelier. Nous menons aussi des activités commerciales en vendant des produits locaux que nous produisons nous même tel que : huile de palme, huîtres, mollusques etc. »
