loans.use: Purchasing fish; purchasing containers for palm oil; renting canoe for collecting oysters and transportation of goods to market

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.en:
This is a group enterprise proposed by three men and four women from the village of Elinkine on the Casamance river in southern Senegal. Represented by their leader Moustapha M., the group describes their business plan as follows:

“Elinkine is a fishing village located 15 km from the departmental capital and 55 km from Ziguinchor [the capital of the southern Casamance region of Senegal]. Its geographic position makes it an incontrovertible hub because it is the only village that serves as a link between the mainland and the islands. Furthermore, Elinkine is one of the villages with the greatest number of fishermen in the entire country.

In order to take advantage of this niche, which has up until now been neglected simply because the majority of people in the fish market dedicate themselves exclusively to the production and sale of dried fish, the Couguélil group has taken the initiative to invest in this business. We plan to provision the market with fresh fish from our fishing village of Elinkine which is 15 km from the departmental capital and 55 km from Ziguinchor.

Our group hopes to have a loan which would allow it to purchase fish from the fishermen, purchase ice, and rent a car to transport the product to distant places. The enterprise will consist of marketing fresh fish, buying it from the fishermen and going to resell it in the city markets and all over the country.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Elinkine est un village de pêcheur distant de 15 Km de la capitale départementale et de 55Km de Ziguinchor. Sa position géographique lui confère de carrefour incontournable du fait qu’il est le seul village qui sert de relais entre la terre ferme et les îles. Il s y ajoute que Elinkine est l’un des village qui compte le plus grand nombre de pêcheurs dans l’ensemble du pays. Pour exploité ce créneau, qui est jusque là laissé en rade simplement parce que la plus part des exploitants des produits de la pêche se donnent à la transformation et à la vente de poisson sec, le groupement Couguélil à prix l’initiative de s’investir dans cette activité.

Objectifs du Prêt : Le groupement Couguélil à pour objectif : de pouvoir ravitailler le marché en poisson frais a partir de Elinkine village de pêcheur distant de 15 Km de la capitale départementale et de 55Km de Ziguinchor. Le groupement souhaite avoir un préfinancement lui permettant de pouvoir acheté le poisson auprès des pêcheurs, acheté de la glace et louer une voiture pour acheminé le produit vers d’autres horizon.

Activités : L’activité consiste à commercialiser le poisson frais c\'est-à-dire l’acheté auprès des pêcheurs et aller le revendre dans les marchés de la place et partout dans le pays. »

loans.use: Purchasing fresh fish and ice, renting car for transportation

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anta

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by twelve women from Elinkine, a fishing village at the mouth of the Casamance River. Represented by their leader Anta F., the group describes their enterprise as follows:

“The village of Elinkine is located in the south of Senegal 55 km from the regional capital of Oussouye, the capital of the department. Elinkine is today one of the most popular villages in the region, or even the country, on account of its geographic position which makes it a very important and strategic crossroads in various sectors, of which fishing is the most famous. This is especially true since 1997, when the fishermen of Diogué resettled in Elinkine.

The principal objective of the members of the Saxal Diam group is to improve their living conditions and contribute to the development of the village of Elinkine and its environs by producing and selling dried seafood. The commercial activities of the group are focused on small-scale trade; this consists of buying and reselling various beauty products as well as dried fish in our village and in the rest of the country, especially the dried fish which is in high demand throughout the country and in the countries bordering Senegal [i.e. Gambia and Guinea-Bissau]. The members of our group will need a loan equivalent to 600,000 francs CFA [about $1175] for the purchase of fresh fish, salt, and knives needed to make the dried fish. The working capital needed for the sale of beauty products will also be taken from this amount.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: le village de Elinkine est situer au Sud du Sénégal à 55 Km de la capitale régionale et à 18Km de Oussouye, capitale départemental. Elinkine est aujourd’hui l’un des villages les plus sollicités de la région voir du pays a cause de sa position géographique qui lui confère de carrefour très important et stratégique dans différents secteurs dont la pêche qui est le plus connu et ceci depuis les années 97 avec le déplacement du village des pêcheur de Diogué à Elinkine.

Objectifs du Prêt : l’objectif principal des membres du groupement Saxal Diam est : de part la transformation des produits halieutique et de leur vente parvenir à amélioré les conditions de vie de leur membre et de contribuer au développement du village d’Elinkine et de son entourage.

Activités : Les activités du groupement sont entre autre le petit commerce : il s’agi d’achat et de ventes de produit divers de beauté, de poisson séché dans le village et dans le pays ;en ce qui concerne le poisson sec qui est demandé partout dans le pays et dans les pays limitrophe Les membres du groupement auront besoin comme fond de roulement un montant égal à 600 000F CFA pour l’achat des poissons frais, du sel, des couteaux, des coupe-coupe, pour la transformation. Elles auront aussi pour besoin pour la vente des produits de beauté d’un fond de roulement qui sera tiré du même montant. »

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products and  fish-processing equipment; transportation of goods to market

loans.name: Madeleine Djipoya

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by fifteen members of the Mayomba women’s association, led by Madeleine Djipoya S.. The group describes their business as follows:

“This is a project of the women of Hassouka, in the rural community of Mlomp 9 km from the town of Oussouye. The women of our village have long been famous for their skill in agriculture. The women in this region have also benefited from technical training offered by various nonprofit organizations, the best known of these being AJAEDO (Association of Young Farmers and Ranchers of the Department of Oussouye).

Our group has the following objective: to improve the living conditions of our members, to increase the income of the women and to increase our production capacity. The main business activity of our group is gardening; we will use a two-hectare field to plant all kinds of vegetables which will be harvested and sold in the market and to hotels throughout the department of Oussouye.”

Original French :

« Contexte du Projet. : Ce projet est un projet des femmes de Hassouka dans la communauté rurale de Mlomp distant de 9 Km de Oussouye. Le village est un village dont les femmes sont réputées d’agriculture et cela depuis très longtemps. Les femmes de cette localité on bénéficier de formation avec différent ONG dont la plus connu reste L’A J A E D O Association de Jeunes Eleveurs et Agriculteurs du Département de Oussouye.

Objectifs du Prêt : Le groupement s’est fixé entre autre objectif :

- d’améliorer les conditions de vie des ses membres, d’augmenter le revenu des femmes et de pouvoir augmenter leur capacités de production.

Activités : l’activité principale du groupement est le jardinage ; il s’agit d’exploitation d’un périmètre de 2hectares au maximum planté des légumes de touts genre qui seront vendus après récolte dans le marché et dans les hôtels au niveau de tout le département d’Oussouye. »

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, gardening equipment, a scale; setting up a storeroom for the produce

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the six members of the Yakaar association, represented by Ibrahima F.. The Yakaar group describes their business plan as follows:

“Context: In earlier times this peanut-growing valley flourished. Plenty of rain fell during the wet seasons and harvests were abundant. The livestock here never knew feeding problems and lived peacefully.

Then rainfall became scarce, the soils became poor, and the fields no longer provided nourishment for the families. Poverty established itself definitively.

Faced with this situation, the Yakaar group plans to start a sheep-raising business. In the season before the holiday of Tabaski [a Muslim holiday known outside West Africa as Eid al-Kabir or Eid al-Adha, in which each family slaughters a sheep to commemorate the story of Abraham’s sacrifice], our region of Diourbel offers excellent opportunities for fattening sheep because it is located in a grazing area and peanut-growing valley. It is a very favorable context for fattening and marketing rams. The requested loan will allow us to purchase a number of purebred rams in very good health.

Overall objective: To increase the income of the group members with the profit earned from sheep-raising, and to reactivate the production and sale in the local market of quality meat.

Activities: Sheep-raising workshop

Activity 1: this will consist of purchasing thirteen rams in Djolof, which offers good prices on the rams as well as assuring their good health.

Activity 2: Purchasing sheep feed for proper feeding and phytosanitary maintenance, for a duration of two months in order to fatten them

Activity 3: Phytosanitary treatment.

Activity 4: A herdsman will be hired to guard and care for the sheep during the entire two-month period.

Activity 5: Commercialization: After two months of fattening (with special feed) and caring for the rams, we will proceed to market them exactly on the day before Tabaski for our first cycle – just at a time when the demand is very strong and the supply of good-quality rams is often quite limited. A quality product must be competitive on the basis of both quality and price.

A total of four cycles are planned for the coming year. Each cycle will generate a profit of 180,000 francs [about $350], so by the end of the year profits will total 720,000 francs [about $1400].

Strategy: Our strategy begins with the purchase of purebred rams; with a good diversified feeding regimen, at the end of two months the rams will be quite sleek and will be successfully during the preparations leading up to the holiday. We will set up a methodical process for providing the market and grilled meat stands with quality meat on a quarterly basis (four cycles per year).”

Original French:

“Contexte du projet : Autrefois le bassin arachidier était florissant. Les hivernages y étaient pluvieux et les récoltes abondantes. Le bétail méconnaissait les problèmes alimentaires et y vivait paisiblement

Les pluies sont devenues rares, les sols pauvres, les champs ne nourrissent plus les familles

La pauvreté s’est installée définitive. Face à ce contexte le groupe YAAKAAR propose de faire de l’embouche. A la veille de la célébration de la fête de tabasky, la région de DIOURBEL offre des opportunités d’embouche car située entre la zone sylvopastorale et le centre du bassin arachidier. C ‘ un contexte très favorable à l’activité de commercialisation de béliers. Le prêt sollicité servira à acheter un nombre de brebis de race et en très bonne santé

Objectif général : Augmenter les revenus des membres par le profit tiré de l’embouche et re dynamiser les activités de production et de ravitaillement du marché local en viande de qualité.

ACTIVITES : atelier d’embouche

Activité N° 01

Il s’agira d’acheté des béliers ( 13 ) dans le DJOLOF qui offre de bonnes dispositions autant sur le plan du prix des sujets que sur le plan de leur état de santé.

DESIGNATIONS NOMBRE PRIX UNIT MONTANT Achat des sujets 13 30.000 390.000 Transport Sous total……………………………………… ……………. Ff ……………. 65.000 455.000

Activité N° 02 : achat aliment de bétail ;

Par une bonne alimentation et un suivi phytosanitaire pour une durée de deux (02) mois pour parvenir à les engraisser ;

ELEMENTS CALCUL (coût-tête- opération) PRIX Paille d’arachide/ niébé 10.000 Son de mil/ 2500 Tourteaux d’arachide 5000 Eau 2500 Divers 2500 Total 25.500

Activité n° 03 : traitement phytosanitaire ;

ELEMENTS NOMBRE PRIX UNIT MONTANT Ivomec 15.000 Autres produits phytosanitaires 10.000 Prise en charge du vétérinaire 02 mois 40.000 Sous total 65.000

Activité n° 04 : sécurisation et entretien :

Un berger sera utilisé pour la sécurité (gardiennage) et l’entretien des animaux pendant toute la durée de la première opération deux (02) mois et sera reconduit pour chaque opération.

ELEMENTS PRIX UNIT MONTANT Motivations au berger ( deux 02 mois) 25.000 50.000 Sous total 50.000

Activité n° 05 : commercialisation.

Après deux (02) mois d’engraissement ( alimentation spéciale) et de traitements des béliers ; il sera procédé à la commercialisation sur pied juste à la veille de la célébration de la TABASKY pour la première opération. Au moment ou la demande est très forte alors que l’offre de qualité est souvent assez limiter. Un produit de qualité doit soutenir la concurrence avec des arguments ( qualité prix) à l’appui. Quatre opérations sont planifiées dans l’année.

Chaque opération générera un bénéfice de cent quatre vingt mille francs…..( 180.000 )

Soit au bout d’un an un bénéfice global de sept cent vingt mille francs (720.000 )

DESIGNATIONS NOMBRE PRIX UNIT MONTANT Vente des béliers 13 60.000 780.000 Total vente ………………………………………………………………………………… quatre opérations ………………………………………………… 780.000 ……………… 3.120.000

La stratégie :

La stratégie de mise en œuvre passera par l’achat de béliers saints et de race ; avec une bonne alimentation diversifiée au bout de deux (02) mois pour que les sujets présentent des images assez reluisantes afin d’être revendus avec succès durant les préparatifs de la fête. Avec méthode un plan de renouvellement des béliers ; avec les mêmes dispositifs sera reconduit pour un ravitaillement du marché et des dibiteries en viande de qualité pour une périodicité de trimestrielle. ( quatre 04 opérations l’an) »

loans.use: Purchase of purebred rams; feed and veterinary care; hiring of herdsman; transportation to market

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by fifteen entrepreneurs from the Dioulayel association of the village of Kolufifa in the southern Casamance region of Senegal. Represented by their leader Salimata Baldé, the group describes their business:

“Context of the project: Casamance is an enclosed region of Senegal. It has the potential to be rich, but is very poor. Its population is young with a majority of women, who are preponderant in the local economy and constitute the region’s engine of development.

Purpose of the loan: To give a boost to economic activities in the area and to allow the young women of the local area to stay on their land by creating income-generating activities.

Activities: A good area of land will be put to use cultivating sesame seeds, which will be turned into oil after harvest, and the women will make use of the seeds to make cookies which they will sell, and the seeds will also be consumed by the member’s families.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: La Casamance est une région enclavée du Sénégal. Elle est potentiellement riche mais très pauvre. Sa population est jeune avec une majorité des femmes qui sont prépondérantes dans l’économie locale et constituent le moteur du développement.

Objectifs du Prêt : Relance des activités économiques dans la localité, Fixer les jeunes femmes de la localité dans leurs territoires par la création d’activités génératrices de revenus.

Activités : Un bon périmètre de terre sera exploité en culture de sésame qui après récolte sera transformé en huile, et le céréale servira aux femmes de faire des gâteaux qu’elles vendrons et aussi au familles. »

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the sixteen members of the Kacoumpa women’s association in the village Loudia Ouoloff in the southern Casamance region of Senegal. Casamance is a post-conflict area, and many of its inhabitants who fled the separatist war there have only recently returned to rebuild their villages and their livelihoods. Represented by their leader Fatou Ba, this group describes their business activities as follows:

“The village of Loudia Ouoloff is located in the department of Oussouye and it is the capital of the district. It has more than 4,000 inhabitants who live around a village chief, in perfect harmony. The village of Loudia Ouoloff is about 9 km from the capital of the department; its inhabitants make a living from agriculture.

The purpose of the loan is to set up a rotating fund which will enable us to restart the business activities of the group. It will allow us to invest in projects that we villagers have created ourselves. Our group has engaged in commercial activities for a long time, with a focus on purchasing and retailing various types of merchandise. Our group also specialized in other areas such as weaving mats, making fruit and vegetable preserves, handmade brooms, etc. In order to restart these activities, the group requests a loan to enable us to allow fruits and vegetables to be made into preserves, and to pay palm-wine makers to provide us with the palm fronds we need to make the brooms and weave mats.”

Original French :

« Contexte du Projet: le village de Loudia Ouoloff est situer dans le département de Oussouye et il Est un chef lieu d\'arrondissement, i compte plus de 4000 habitants vivant autour d\'un chef de village Et en parfaite harmonie. Le village de Loudia Ouoloff est distant de 9 Km de la capitale départemental ; ces populations vivent de l’agriculture.

Objectifs du Prêt : L’objectif général consiste à avoir un fon de roulement afin de pouvoir relancé les activités du groupement. Il s’agit entre autre de pouvoir financé les projets que se sont créer les villageois eux même.

Activités : Le groupement mène depuis longtemps des activités commerciales dont la plus remarquée reste l’achat et la vente de marchandise divers. En outre le groupement s’est spécialisé dans d’autres domaines tel que le tissage des nattes, la transformation de fruits et légumes, la confection de balais, etc.…. Pour ce faire, le groupement sollicite un financement lui permettant de pouvoir acheté les fruits et légume pour la transformation, payé les récolteurs de vin de palme afin qu’il puissent mettre à leur disposition les rames de palmier pour la confection des balais et le tissage des natte. »

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables; transportation to market

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Fatou Kiné

texts.en:
This group loan will be shared by five women who plan to start a seamstress shop / beauty parlor specializing in the elaborate braided hairstyles that West Africa is famous for. Funds will be used to furnish the facility and purchase an electric hairdryer and miscellaneous equipment. The group, represented by Fatou Kiné N., described their proposal as follows:

“Meckhé is located in the region of Thiès in the Tivaouane department. Established as a commune in 1911, it now has 20,000 inhabitants. With a large population of women, female unemployment remains an urgent problem. This state of affairs exposes girls to such evils as prostitution, premature pregnancies, and a degradation of our values. The purpose of the loan is to combat the loss of education threatening young women by: 1) moving into and equipping a facility that already exists, and 2) providing training [in hairdressing and sewing] to young women. Business activities will include hairdressing and sewing.”

Original French :

« Contexte du Projet. : Meckhé est situé dans la région de Thiès, département de Tivaouane. Errigé en commune depuis 1911, elle compte à nos jours plus de 20 000 habitants. Avec une forte population de femmes, le chômage des filles reste un problème majeure. Cet état de fait expose ces filles aux maux tels que la prostitution, les grossesses précoces, bref une dégradation des mœurs.

Objectifs du Prêt : Lutter contre les méfaits de la déperdition scolaire des jeunes filles.

• -Aménagement et équipement d’un local qui existe déjà

• -Dispensions de formation au profit des filles

Activités : Les activités que se propose le projet sont :

- Coiffure

- Couture »

loans.use: Furnishing and purchasing equipment for a beauty parlor/seamstress shop

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Mamour

texts.en:
This group enterprise has been proposed by the thirteen members of the Taissirou Assir association, represented by Mamour Djité:

“In the context of the fight against unemployment and clandestine immigration, marked by the increasing desperation of young people in search of work, the Taissirou Assir association, which unites young people from the village of Meckhé with those from Diogo, a farming village located on the coast 18 km from Meckhé, has decided to invest in the farming sector in order to participate in the development of the region and of Senegal. The association has access to a 5-hectare field; a well; a motorized irrigation pump; and for travel and transport of our products to market, three carts and three horses. The purpose of the loan is to make use of these assets to grow cabbage, carrots, onions, eggplants, and peppers; this combination has a growing cycle of three months which will allow us to repay the loan by regular installments once the harvests begin. We will sell our harvests in the district of Meckhé and in the surrounding region.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Dans un contexte de lutte contre l’oisiveté et de l’immigration clandestine, marqué par un désespoir croissant des jeunes à la recherche de l’emplois, le G I E Taïssirou Assir qui regroupe des jeunes natifs de Meckhé en collaboration avec des natifs d’un village maraîcher situer sur la grande côte à 18 Km de Meckhé (Diogo), à décider d’investir le secteur maraîcher pour participer au développement de la localité et du Sénégal. Le G I E dispose d’un terrain de 5 ha, d’un puit, d’une moto pompe hydraulique et comme moyen de transport et de déplacement, 3 charrettes et 3 chevaux.

Objectifs du Prêt : l’objectif est d’exploiter ce périmètre en culture de choux, carotte, oignons, aubergines, et piment ; qui est une variété dont la cycle est de 3 mois qui pourra après récolte servir de base de remboursement.

Activités : Pour activité, nous vendrons nos récoltes dans la commune de Meckhé et dans les localités environnantes. »

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and gas for irrigation pump

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Fulomene

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the fifteen members of the women’s association Gninkando, located in the village of Mlomp in the Casamance region of southern Senegal. Represented by Fuloméne S., the group submitted the following business description:

“The Gninkando association is a group of women of the village of Djicomol in the ecovillage of Mlomp. The village has a population of over 10,000, which is why an agricultural enterprise is a good way to help the women take advantage of what their environment has to offer. The purpose of our group is to strengthen solidarity between our members, to promote emancipation and to work for the development of the land within the areas of their target business activities. The business activities proposed by the group are:

• Agriculture: This consists of gardening, where the investment needs are: inputs (seeds, fertilizer, phytosanitary products), and equipment (watering cans, rakes, hoes, wheelbarrows, pitchforks, etc.)

• Commerce: This is our group’s main business activity; using local produce grown by our group, the members market their products throughout the region, especially in the surrounding villages. Furthermore, the women use their fruits and vegetables to make jams, preserves and juices.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Le groupement Gninkando est un groupement de femmes du village de Djicomol dans l’éco village de Mlomp. Sa population compte plus de 10 000habitants et c’est pourquoi un projet d’agriculture viendra au point pour aider les femmes à exploiter les potentiels de leur milieu

Objectifs du Prêt : l’objectif visé par le groupement est :

- de tisser des viens de solidarité entre ses membres, de promouvoir l’émancipation et d’œuvrer pour le développement du terroir dans les domaines de leur activités cible.

Activités : Les activités que se propose le groupement sont :

- L’agriculture : elle est basée sur le maraîchage ou les besoins sont : les intrants (semences engrais, produits phytosanitaire), et le petit matériel (arrosoirs, râteaux, pèles, houes, brouettes fourches etc.…)

- Le commerce : Il est le principal activité du groupement ; de par les produits locaux produits par le groupement ; les membres du groupement assure la commercialisation de leurs produits au niveau régional, surtout dans les village environnants. En outre, les femmes se donnent à la transformation des fruits et légumes. »

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the seventeen women of the Ussumaydo association, located in the village of Haer near Mlomp. Represented by their leader Ida S., the Ussumaydo group proposes the following soap-making business:

“Context: The Haer women’s association has always mobilized itself to promote the development of the surrounding community. For a very long time, they have worked in the production of local soap in the heart of the village. A loan to support this activity would be welcome.

Objectives of the loan: To give a boost to economic activities in the local area and allow the women of the area to stay on their land by creating income-generating activities, and to improve the living conditions of the villagers.

Activities: Local soap-making; this consists of producing soap handmade by the women of the group, which will be sold in other areas of the department, the region, or even the country.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet : Le groupement des femmes de Haer s’est toujours mobiliser dans une dynamique de développement autour d’elle-même. Depuis fort longtemps, elles œuvrent dans la fabrique de savon local au saint du village. Un projet leurs soutenant serait le bien venu.

Objectifs du Prêt : Relance des activités économiques dans la localité

Fixer les femmes de la localité dans leurs territoires par la création d’activités génératrices de revenu Améliorer les conditions de vie des populations

Activités : Savonnerie locale

Il s’agit de fabriquer du savon local par le femmes du groupement qui se ra vendu dans les autre localités du département, de la région voir du pays. »

Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. loans.use: Purchase of equipment and materials for soapmaking business

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by ten members of the Gouye Ngalla association, represented by Mamadou T.. Nder is a tiny farming village on the southern edge of the Sahara desert, whose colorful history as the capital of the ancient Wolof kingdom of Walo is still celebrated in Senegalese folklore. In this arid region, profitable cultivation of Nder’s main crops of yams and peanuts relies on irrigation, but capital for investment in irrigation pumps has always been scarce. The Gouye Ngalla association therefore submitted the following application for a microfinance loan:

“The state having established a general support framework for community development associations since the 1960’s, our group quickly realized that grassroots community development will not be a reality unless our members are effectively mobilized and organized for this purpose. Taking into account the extremely difficult socioeconomic context characterized by: 1) migration out of rural areas due to the lack of promising local development alternatives, and 2) The absence in the Diéri zone of any hydro-agricultural system established by the state or managed by the local government, the group rolled up our sleeves and decided to rely on our own efforts and on those of our strategic partners in order to achieve our goals.

The purpose of this loan is to provide the members of the group with a motorized irrigation pump with a capacity of 300m3/hour, which can irrigate 10 hectares of fields and will be managed by a pump attendant who will ensure its maintenance and proper functioning.

The team responsible for this project will keep track of its progress and will begin to repay the loan without difficulty as soon as the first harvests begin.”

Original French :

«L’état ayant défini le cadre général d’intervention des associations de développement depuis les années 1960, à cet effet le groupement a vite compris que le développement à la base ne sera une réalité que si les membres ne seront fortement mobilisés en s’organisant en conséquence.

Compte tenu du contexte socio économique très difficile marqué essentiellement par :

• L’exode rural faute d’alternative de développement endogène prometteuse.

• Absence d’aménagement hydro agricole conçu par l’état et géré par les sociétés d’encadrement dans la zone du Diéri ; le groupement s’est retroussé les manches, pour compter sur ses efforts propres et sur ceux de ses partenaires stratégiques pour atteindre l’objectif qu’il s’est assigné.

Objectif du Prêt :

Il s’agit de mettre à la disposition des membres du groupement un groupe moto pompe d’une capacité de 300m3/heure pouvant irrigué 10 ha de culture et sera géré par un pompiste qui assurera l’entretien et le fonctionnement.

Pour le Remboursement :

L’équipe de suivi du projet fera des descentes dans tous les projets et dès la fin des premiers récolte commencera à faire le recouvrement des crédits sans difficulté.»

loans.use: Irrigation pump purchase

loans.name: Marie Noël

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by nine women from the village of Oussouye in the Casamance region of southern Senegal. Represented by their leader Marie Noël D., the women plan to purchase goods produced in their village, including brooms made from palm fronds, oysters, lemon juice, dried fish; and to sell them in distant markets where they fetch much higher prices. Loan funds will cover both the purchase of these goods and their transport to market. The group describes their business as follows:

“This enterprise consists of small-scale trade in seafood and forest products. These products are very numerous in our area, and will be sold in other regions of the country. The purpose of the loan is to help secure self-sufficiency in food, improve nutrition, reduce migration from rural areas, and create employment for young people. Our business activities will be conducted as follows:

• Purchase of the products locally

• Sale of the products in other areas where they are scarce”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet. : Ce projet est un projet de petit commerce de produits halieutique et forestier. Ces produits sont très nombreux dans notre localité et seront vendus dans les autres régions du pays.

Objectifs du Prêt : : L’objectif du projet est :

- Aider à assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire

- Améliore l’alimentation

- De ré réduire les problèmes de l’exode rural

- Créer de l’emploi pour les jeunes

Activités : Ces activités seront menées comme suite :

- Achats de produis au niveau local

- Vente des produits dans les autres localités ou il manque »

loans.use: Purchase of village products (palm brooms, oysters, lemon juice, dried fish) and transportation to market

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Younousse

texts.en:
This is a group loan which will be shared by the fifteen members of the Deggoo association in the village of Oussouye in the Casamance region of southern Senegal. The group describes their business plan as follows:

“The Deggoo group is an association of the youth of the Escale neighborhood of Oussouye, who have initiated this project in order to combat unemployment, migration from rural areas, the loss of security for young women and juvenile delinquency. The purpose of the loan is to provide all the traditional furniture craftsmen of the area with wood, as well as the producers of wooden pirogue boats for fishing on the high sea. We will go out and buy boards from the various sawmills of the region in order to meet the demand for wood, which far exceeds the supply in our area. We will set up a building to serve as a storeroom; in this way, therefore, we will start up and manage our wood-selling business.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Le groupement Deggoo est une association de jeunes du quartier Escale à Oussouye qui à initié ce projet pour lutter contre le chômage, l’exode rural, la déperdition des filles et la délinquance juvénile

Objectifs du Prêt : De pouvoir ravitailler tous les menuisiers du département en bois et lutter contre le chômage, l’exode rural, la déperdition des filles et la délinquance juvénile aussi les constructeurs de pirogues pour la pêche en haute mer.

Activités : Nous irons achetés des planche dans les différentes scieries de la région afin de pouvoir satisfaire la demande qui est très supérieur l’offre dans le département. Nous aménagerons un local qui nous servira de magasin de stock ; ainsi donc, nous mènerons nos activités commerciales de vente de planche. »

loans.use: Purchase of wood from sawmills; equipping a storage facility; transportation of the wood to furniture craftsmen and shipbuilders

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by five entrepreneurs from the Diama association in the village of Oussouye in southern Senegal. Represented by Alpha D., the group describes their business:

“The Diama association is a group of young people in Oussouye who have been working in the community development field for a long time, and are now launching a small store that sells cosmetic products and other miscellaneous goods. Our purpose is to combat migration from rural areas and create employment for the young members of our group. Our business activities include the purchase and retail sale of cosmetic products such as lotion, perfume, and other beauty products. These products will be purchased from wholesalers in Dakar, then sold in Oussouye in order to serve the rest of the county.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Le groupement Diama est un groupement de jeune de Escale à Oussouye qui travail depuis très longtemps dans le cadre de développement et créant une centrale d’achat de vente de produits cosmétique et divers.

Objectifs du Prêt : Lutter contre l’exode rural et créer de l’emploi pour les jeunes membres du groupement.

Activités : Achat et vente de produits Cosmétique tel que : lait de toilette, parfum, et autres matériel de beauté. Ces produits seront achetés à Dakar chez les commerçants grossistes puis vendus à Oussouye afin de pouvoir servir le reste du département. »

loans.use: Bulk purchase of lotion, perfume and cosmetic products; transportation to market for retail sale

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Atome

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the seven members of the Jittoo Association, represented by their leader Atome L.. The Jittoo group describes their business as follows:

“This traditional cloth-dying and batik business is located in Oussouye, a town that is modernizing and developing rapidly. The population is around 10,000 inhabitants. Oussouye is 30 km from Cap Skirring, a traditional town that acts as a hub, attracting tourists in the Casamance region with its three bed-and-breakfasts. This has convinced us present to you this proposal for a loan to finance the business activities in which we have been engaged for several years.

The purpose of the loan is:

• To reduce the problem of migration of young women from rural areas to the big cities in search of employment

• To create employment for women

• To help improve nutrition and secure self-sufficiency in food

Our business activities are:

• The production of traditional hand-dyed cloth and batiks

These activities will be conducted here in Oussouye. The products will be sold both in Oussouye and in the numerous tourist hotels and campgrounds of the area.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet. : Ce projet de teinture et de battique est localisé à Oussouye commune, une ville qui se modernise et se développe rapidement. La population est d’environ 10 000 habitants. Oussouye est à 30Km de Cap Skirring site touristique de la Casamance et ville carrefour et traditionnelle ou passent beaucoup de touristes avec trois campements .Ceci nous pousses à vous présenter ce projet pour avoir un financement pour nos activités que nous exerçons depuis plusieurs années.

Objectifs du Prêt : L’objectif du projet est :

- Réduire le problème de l’exode rural des jeunes femmes vers les grandes villes à la recherche de l’emploi

- De créer de l’emplois pour les femmes

- D’aider à améliorer l’alimentation et à assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire

Activités : Les activités du projet sont :

• -La teinture et le battique

Elles se feront à Oussouye même. Les produits sont vendus à Oussouye et dans les nombreux campements touristiques du département. »

loans.use: Purchase of various types of fabric and dye colors; dying equipment such as wax, masks, gloves, tongs, and string; transportation of finished hand-dyed cloth and batiks to market

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Installation of Internet connection, payphone, and copy/fax machine for cybercafe

loans.name: Salimata

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the members of the Katakal women’s association, represented by Salimata D.. The Katakal group describes their business activities:

“The Katakal association is a group of women from the village of Siganar. The village has over 3,000 inhabitants, which is why an agriculture project is a good choice for helping the women to profit from the potentials of this region, from which they have earned income for over ten years. The purpose of our group is to improve the living conditions of our members and increase their income. The business activities planned by our group are:

• Agriculture: This is based on gardening, where the needs are: inputs (seeds, fertilizer, phytosanitary products), and equipment (watering cans, rakes, hoes, pitchforks, etc.)

• Commerce: This is the principal business activity of the group; the women take local products [i.e. fresh produce from their gardens, and perhaps handicrafts such as pottery or mats woven from palm fronds, etc.] produced by the members of the group and market them throughout the region of Ziguinchor. They also make preserves out of fruits and vegetables.”

Original French:

“Contexte du Projet : Le groupement Katakal est un groupement de femmes du village de Siganar Sa population compte plus de 3000habitants et c’est pourquoi un projet d’agriculture viendra au point pour aider les femmes à exploiter les potentiels du milieu qu’elles exploitent depuis plus de 10 ans.

Objectifs du Prêt : l’objectif visé par le groupement est :

- D’améliorer les conditions de vie des membres du groupement et d’augmenter leur revenus.

Activités : Les activités que se propose le groupement sont :

- L’agriculture : elle est basée sur le maraîchage ou les besoins sont : les intrants (semences engrais, produits phytosanitaire), et le petit matériel (arrosoirs, râteaux, pèles, houes, brouettes fourches etc.…)

- Le commerce : Il est le principal activité du groupement ; de par les produits locaux produits par les membres du groupement qui assure elles même la commercialisation de leurs produits au niveau de toute la région de Ziguinchor, elles font aussi la transformation des fruits et légumes. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and vegetable seeds, fertilizer, rakes, watering cans, hoes, and equipment for making fruit and vegetable preserves; transportation of fresh produce and preserves to market

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.en:
This is a group loan, requested by the thirty members of a women’s rotating savings and credit association in the traditional fishing village of Yoff just outside the capital city, Dakar. The group describes their business activities as follows:

“This project is located in the village of Yoff, the traditional village of our country’s capital city. Yoff’s proximity to the downtown area of Dakar doubtless provides it with several strategies for survival, which are integrated simultaneously with local traditional and with modern methods of sustainable development.

The purpose of the loan is to increase the income of the group members in order to reinforce their capacities of production. The business activities the group plans to undertake are:

• The production of traditional hand-dyed cloth

• Purchase and retail of seafood products

• Purchase and retail of various food commodities”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet : Le projet se situ dans le village de Yoff ; village traditionnel de la capitale du pays . Sa proximité du centre de Dakar lui permet sans doute de tenter plusieurs stratégies de survie, intégrées à la fois à la tradition locale et aux nouveaux mots d’ordre de développement durable

Objectifs du Prêt : Augmenter le revenu des membres du groupement pour mieux renforcer leurs capacités de production.

Activités Les activités que compte mener le groupement sont :

- Teinture

- Achat et ventes de produits halieutiques

- Achat et vente de denrées alimentaires »

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and dyes for traditional cloth-dying; bulk purchase of seafood from fishermen; bulk purchase of food commodities (dried red peppers, black peppercorns, garlic, fish bouillion); purchase of a scale; transport of goods to market

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by six women who hail from the village of Youtou in the southern region of Casamance. Represented by group leader Maguette S., the group submitted this business proposal:

“Background: Youtou is a village in reconstruction after having experienced more than ten years under the fire of war with the [separatist conflict] crisis in Casamance. Being in reconstruction, we need financial support which will help us manage our enterprises properly in order to better face this new phase that we are beginning.

Purpose of the loan: To increase the women’s income, improve the living conditions of the villagers with the purpose of contributing to the reconstruction of the village, and to be able to obtain the means to sell our products throughout the country of Senegal.

Business activities: Our group has always specialized in the production of palm oil. We purchase palm kernels from those who produce palm wine, process the palm kernels in order to extract the palm oil, and sell the palm oil to other women who come from every horizon, and they in turn export the product in the interior of the country. Our hope is to produce palm oil and to be able to market it throughout the country.”

Original French :

« Contexte du Projet: Le village de Youtou est un village en reconstruction après avoir vécu plus de 10 années sous le feu de la guerre avec le problème en Casamance. Etant en reconstruction, nous avons besoin d’un soutien financier qui va nous aider à bien mener nos activités pour mieux affrontée cette nouvelle phase que nous entamons.

Objectifs du Prêt : Augmenter le revenu des femmes, améliorer les conditions de vie des villageois dans le but de contribuer à la reconstruction du village, pouvoir obtenir les moins de vendre notre produit dans toute l’étendu du Sénégal.

Activités : Notre groupement à toujours travailler dans l’extraction de l’huile de palme. Nous achetons auprès des récolteurs de vin de palme les régimes de palmiste que nous traitons pour en extraire l’huile que nous vendons à d’autres femmes venant de touts les horizons qui à leur tour exportent le produit dans l’intérieur du pays. Notre souhait et de produire et pouvoir vendre dans tout le pays. »

Background

Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of palm kernals and bottles for palm oil production; equipping a storage facility; transportation of palm oil to market

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Tafa

texts.en: Tafa is married with 10 children. The youngest is 2 years old. This is her fourth loan with SPBD. She has already paid off three since 2004 which she used to develop a flower busines and a canteen business. Her customers for flowers include churches - it is a tradition to decorate churches each Sunday - and people who come to her house. She also runs a canteen 6 days a week from a taxi stand in Apia. Usually her sales from the canteen are about $50 per day. The school fees will be used for her second eldest son who is studying computers.

loans.use: School Fees, bathroom renovation, fertiliser

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray has a number of businesses. He has a vegetable garden where he grows pumpkins, tomatoes, peas and cucumbers. He has a flower decoration business which he sells to church groups and local people. He has also recently started a BBQ fast food business, also from the outside of his house. In fact all these businesses run from the front of his house at Nonoa. 

Ray is one of the few males in the SPBD program. He is the chief of his village lending group in Nonoa, one of 180 in SPBD. The Nonoa center is one of SPBD\'s most reliable and in December Ray was awarded  one of the seven prizes for best chief at the Annual Prizegiving function. He was also engaged by SPBD to decorate the hall for the function, and is pictured here in SPBDs office with some of the flower arrangements ready for the function.

loans.use: Fertiliser, seeds, pots, BBQ meat, timber

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Viole

texts.en:
Viole used her first loan to start an ice cake business, then she used her next two loans to start a small shop, using them to buy stock. The photo shows sweets in the foreground, canned tuna and beef in the background as well as traditionally printed cloths. Her first loan was WST 750 (USD 325) and current loan is WST 3000.

Viole’s family consist of her husband and three children who all attend school. The profit from her shop business helps her to support her family..

In 2005 she was awarded one of the seven best businesswomen awards in SPBD. This was due to the way she built up her business, used her shop to sell products of other SPBD members and the way she conducts herself in the weekly payment meetings.

loans.use: Purchase stock for her store

loans.name: Balabeyim Baylar Giz

texts.en:
Balabeyim is an old internally displaced person (IDP) who is the mother of one child. Her family\'s living condition is not very good. The family income is rather limited.

Since 2000, Balabeyim has supported her family by working as a cook in her small business. Actually, she is very communicative person who loves people and accepts them as they are. In her view, cooking is some kind of art which reflects the feelings and mood of a cook. She likes international cousine but national dishes such as dolma, plov, khingal are her favorite ones.

Now, she needs a loan of $600 to further develop her business, to buy new kitchen appliances, to increse her incomes via diversifying the menu and attracting more clients.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances

loans.name: Alaisea

texts.en:
Alaisea commenced in SPBD in 2004 and is one of only a few women who have progressed through paying off seven loans. Her business is a stall at the main market in the capital of Apia. This is a popular place to buy personal and household items along with Samoan handicrafts and is frequented by both local people and tourists. 
Not only has Alaisea graduated to the highest loan of any member in the SPBD program, she also has won the Businesswoman of the year award two years in a row in 2005 and 2006. This is an award given to seven of the best businesswomen in our program. That is seven out of over 2000. She is the only member to have won it more than once. She has won three times.

loans.use: Purchase stock for her stall at the local market in Apia

loans.name: Vine

texts.en: Vine is married with seven children. One of her sons runs a stall at the local market. Two are at school. The others are married. Vine is on her seventh loan with SPBD. With her first loan back in 2003, she started a business making and selling pork buns. With subsequent loans she developed this into a successful store which is located in front of her house. The shop is open seven days a week from 6AM to 10PM and is run by Vine and her sons. On any one day the shop will sell to 50 or more customers who live in the surrounding area. Vine has one of the largest loans in SPBD and has a perfect payment record. She is also a leader in her village center group.

loans.use: Purchase stock for the store such as sugar, tinned fish, mutton flaps, washing powder, drinks etc

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Madam Jeannette A. was born in 1968 at Tsévié. Daughter of a poor family, she has encountered all kind of difficulty of this world. For lack of means, she neither go to school nor followed a vocational training. Became adult she is married with a man who has decided to well finance her restauration activities (rice, beans, spaghetti), things rare in the surrounding. Unfortunately at the birth of their 3rd child, the husband has lost his job and was found jobless. So, the major part of the household expenditures is set on Jeannette hands, as the meagre income issued from the manoeuvre is only about hardly 45%. Beyond their three children, she has at her dependence her mother and their last child. Despite the difficulties, she is succeeding to well manage her activities. She has the sense of respect of the other property and has succeeded with rigour the two first respective credits of $100 and $300 got are even repaid promptly. She is a trusty woman and deserves to be supported financially to strengthen her activity. Dynamic and honest, she benefits from the respect of her surrounding. This credit of $650 requesting will serve to buy foods at the need of her restauration to strengthen her activity and make it profitable in order to provide for the family needs.

Madame A. Jeannette est née en 1968 à Tsévié. Fille d’une famille pauvre, elle a rencontré toutes les difficultés du monde dans sa vie. Faute de moyens, elle n’a ni fréquenté, ni suivi une formation professionnelle. Devenue adulte, elle s’est mariée avec un homme qui a bien voulu financer son activité de restauration (riz, haricot, spaghetti), chose rare dans le milieu. Malheureusement à la naissance de leur 3ème enfant, le mari a perdu son emploi et s’est trouvé chômeur. Alors, la grande partie des charges du foyer repose sur Jeannette, car le maigre revenu issu du manœuvrage n’y est que 45% à peine. En plus de leurs trois enfants, elle a à charge sa mère et de leur benjamine. Malgré les difficultés, elle arrive à bien gérer ses activités. Elle a le sens du respect du bien d’autrui et a su gérer avec rigueur les deux premiers crédits respectifs de $100 et $300 obtenus et même remboursés promptement. Elle est une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenu financièrement pour renforcer son activité. Dynamique et honnête, elle bénéficie du respect de son entourage. Ce crédit de $650 sollicité servira à acheter des aliments au besoin de sa restauration pour renforcer son activité et la rentabiliser afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: to buy foods for restauration

loans.name: Abra

texts.en:
Madam Abra D. was born in 1974 at Tsévié. Orphan (father and motherless), she has been adopted by a maternal aunt, to whom she has learnt to make cloth trading. Married, she is a mother of two (02) children. The husband is a plumber and hasn’t a fix job. What makes her the victim of all the major charges of the household Madam D. has the sense of businesses and manages well her activities with much faith and rigour. Thanks to her courage and dynamism, she has benefited of $350 which she has well managed and repaid promptly. The current credit of $950 that she requests, will be entirely consecrated to the various clothes selling which she could buy in Lomé and neighbour countries. What will allow her to make profitable her businesses and in addition improve the family existing conditions.

Madame D. Abra est une femme analphabète née en 1974 à Tsévié. Orpheline de père et mère, elle a été adoptée par une tante maternelle, chez qui elle a appris à faire le commerce des pagnes. Elle s’est installée à son propre compte il y a 5 ans et les affaires vont bon train. Mariée, elle est mère de deux (02) enfants. Le mari est plombier et n’a pas un emploi fixe. Ce qui fait que la plupart des charges du foyer repose sur elle. Madame D. a les sens des affaires et gère bien ses activités avec beaucoup de sérieux et de rigueur. Grâce à son courage et à son dynamisme, elle a bénéficié du crédit de $350 qu’elle a su bien gérer et promptement rembourser. Le présent crédit de $950 qu’elle sollicite, sera entièrement consacré à la vente de pagnes de différentes sortes qu’elle pourra acheter à Lomé et dans les pays limitrophes. Ce qui va lui permettre de rentabiliser ses affaires et de surcroît améliorer les conditions d’existence de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase and selling of clothes

loans.name: Berne

texts.en:
Born in 1975 at Tsévié, Mr Berne J. is issued from poor family. Very early, he has abandoned the courses at form 4 to be launched in the small trade as his parents don’t has enough means to take car of his school fees. From activities to activities, he was finally found in the selling of general food produces. He is married and is a father of two (02) children. He good morality and dynamism have made him a respected person in the area. He controls very well his trade and has well repaid his two credits got without incident. Currently, he requests a credit of $850 which will serve to buy rice, oil, and other general food produces in view to strengthen his activity. This will allow him to growth her incomes and improve his family living conditions.

Né en 1975 à Tsévié, Monsieur J. Berne est issu d’une famille pauvre. Très tôt, il a abandonné les études en classe de 4ème pour se lancer dans le petit commerce car ses parents n’ont pas assez de moyens pour lui assurer sa scolarité. D’activités en activités, il s’est finalement retrouvé dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Sa bonne moralité et son dynamisme ont fait de lui une personne respectée dans le quartier. Il a une maîtrise parfaite de son commerce et a bien remboursé ses deux crédits obtenus sans incident. Il sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $ 850 qui servira à acheter du riz, d’huile et autres produits d’alimentation générale en vue de renforcer son activité. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et de facto améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy general food produces

loans.name: Akou

texts.en:
Madam Akou A. was born in 1964 at Tsévié. Mother of tree (03) children, she is married to a farmer who, for a certain moment, face difficulties from her activities due to the climatic ups and downs which are considerably decreasing the incomes. In this situation, Madam A. is abandoned alone to face the family needs. Very dynamic and undertaking, she was launched in the first basic products which she controls very well. Though illiterate, she manages well with a surprising rigour her businesses and has succeeded to repaid the two credits got without incident. She is a trusty woman and deserves to be backed in view to strengthen her activity and make in profitable. Madam Akou A. requests a credit of $850 which will allow her to buy the merchandises in whole (soaps, sugar, milk, tomatoes, etc.) and to supply her shop of various rare products in the area. She could then face the household expenditures and improve the family living conditions.

Madame A. Akou est née en 1964 à Tsévié. Mère de trois (03) enfant, elle est mariée à un cultivateur qui, depuis un certains temps, rencontre des difficultés ses activités dues aux aléas climatiques qui font baisser considérablement le rendement et de facto, ses revenus. Dans cette situation, Madame A. est seule à faire face aux besoins de la famille. Très dynamique et entreprenante, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits de première nécessité qu’elle maîtrise assez bien. Bien qu’elle soit analphabète, elle gère avec une étonnante rigueur ses affaires et a su bien rembourser les deux crédits obtenus sans incident. Elle est une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenu en vue de renforcer son activité et la rentabiliser. Madame A. Akou sollicite un crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre d’acheter les marchandises en gros (savons, sucre, lait, tomate etc.) et d’approvisionner sa boutique de divers produits recherchés dans le milieu. Elle pourra alors faire face aux charges de foyer et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: to buy the merchandises in whole and to supply her shop

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Born in 1970 at Tsévié, Madam Jeanne A. is a mother of two (02) children. Fatherless very early, her mother didn’t have the sufficient means to assure for her a long time her school education. What puts her to abandon the school at form3. She was afterward recuperated by an aunt who has assured her was already repaid. the dress making trading in the mind to be able to provide for her brothers and sisters needs. Married to a building electrician, he has not assured her the must take care of her children, brothers and sisters who are living with them. But thank to her dynamism and activity control, she has much clients who make her trust. To overcome this situation, she had requested and got a credit which Madam Jeanne A. requests today, a credit of $950 which will allow her to equip her workshop with two new sewing machines and to initiate the haberdashery items selling which miss in the area kpali. She could then make income to provide for her family needs.

Née en 1970 à Tsévié, Madame A. Jeanne est mère de deux (02) enfants. Orpheline de père très tôt, sa maman n’a pas eu les moyens suffisants pour lui assurer pendant longtemps sa scolarisation. Ce qui fait qu’elle a abandonnée les études en classe de 4ème. Elle a ensuite été récupérée par une tante qui lui a assuré sa formation en couture dans le souci de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses frères et sœurs. Mariée à un électricien bâtiment, celui-ci ne lui a pas assuré la joie au foyer. Dans cette situation, elle doit s’occuper de ses enfants, ses frères et sœurs qui sont chez eux. Mais grâce à son dynamisme et à sa maîtrise de l’activité, elle a beaucoup de clientes et qui lui font confiance. Pour sortir de cette situation, elle avait sollicité et obtenu un crédit qu’elle avait déjà remboursé. Jeannette sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $950 qui va lui permettre d’équiper son atelier de deux nouvelles machines à coudre et d’initier la vente des articles de mercerie qui manquent dans le quartier Kpali. Elle pourra alors dégager un revenu conséquent pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: to equip her workshop with sewing machines and to sell the haberdashery items

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.en:
Born in 1979 at Tsévié, Mr Yaovi A. is issued from a poor and numerous family. After the class of middle upper six, he was trained in electronics. Encountering with all difficulties to find the spare parts for his work, he has decided to open a house of electronics spare parts. It is in that context that he has benefited from his first credit of $550 which was already repaid. This has shown her ability to well manage her activity. Married, he has beside her own child, her two (02) sisters. Dynamic and very undertaking, he seizes all the opportunities presented to her to growth her businesses. For the current project, Mr Yaovi A. requests a credit of $1200 which will serve to buy spares and used electronics machines such as: television, sets, VCD and DVD drive at the port of Lomé and to resell them at Tsévié. This will allow him to growth his incomes in order to better up keep pres family and to assure his children and sister education.

Né en 1979 à Tsévié, Monsieur A. Yaovi est issu d’une famille pauvre et nombreuse. Après la classe de 1ère, il a fait une formation électronique. Eprouvant toutes les difficultés pour trouver des pièces de rechanges pour son travail, il a décidé d’ouvrir un établissement de vente de pièces détachées électroniques. C’est dans ce cadre qu’il a bénéficié de son premier crédit de $550 qu’il a déjà remboursé. Ceci a démontré sa capacité à bien gérer son activité. Marié, il a à sa charge, en plus de son enfant, ses deux (02) sœurs. Dynamique et très entreprenant, il saisit toutes les opportunités qui se présentent à lui pour accroître ses affaires. Pour le présent projet, Monsieur A. Yaovi sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui servira à acheter des pièces détachées et des appareils électroniques d’occasion tels que : les postes téléviseurs, amplificateurs, des lecteurs VCD et DVD au port de Lomé pour les revendre à Tsévié. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux entretenir sa famille et d’assurer la scolarisation de son enfant et de ses sœurs.

loans.use: to buy spares and used electronics machines

loans.name: Dzogbényuié

texts.en:
Born on 11th October 1978 at Tsévié, Madame Dzogbényuié A. has got the chance to attend school up to the upper low class. Since her father’s death, things became more difficult as her mother hasn’t any income generating activity to assure her school fees. Adopted by an uncle, she has served as house girl and babies keeper. Five years ago, she married a tailor with whom she has got two (02) children. That is the later who has first financed her activities of haberdashery activities before she benefits from a credit of $450 which is already soldered. A woman of good character and always very receptionist, she has succeeded to develop a customary which trusts her entirely. But, her financial means are very limited to respond to her customary numerous demands and requirements. Also, requests her a credit of $900 to buy haberdashery items in view to strengthen her business. This will allow her to growth her incomes and consequently contribute to her living conditions and that of her family.

Née le 11 Octobre 1978 à Tsévié, Madame A. Dzogbényuié a eu la chance de fréquenter jusqu’en classe de 2nde. Dès la mort de son père, les choses sont devenues plus difficiles car sa mère n’a aucune activité génératrice de revenu pour assurer sa scolarité. Adopté par un oncle, elle servi comme garde d’enfant et domestique. Il y a 5 ans elle a épousé un tailleur avec qui elle a eu deux (02) enfants. C’est ce dernier qui a d’abord financé ses activités de mercerie avant de bénéficier d’un crédit de $450 qu’elle a déjà soldé. Femme de caractère et en même temps très accueillante, elle a su développer une clientèle qui lui fait entière confiance. Mais, ses moyens financiers sont très limités pour répondre aux exigences et aux nombreuses demandes de sa clientèle. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $900 pour acheter les articles de mercerie en vue de renforcer son affaire. Ceci permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et de facto contribuer à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery items

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Madam Catherine T. was born in 1965 at Tsévié. Currently, she is living at Davié-Modji where she is doing her small trade of fish and ingredients. Married, she is a mother of five (05) children who are unfortunately abandoned to her as the husband has just taken his 3rd wife. Courageous and full of trusty, she has continued her activity thank to a second credit of $350. What allows her to point out a substantial income to her children elementary needs. Though illiterate, she manages in extraordinary way her activity and is always very correct in the repayment of her credits obtained. She is a trusty woman and deserves to be backed financially in view to growth her activities. This credit of $700 she requests will allow her to buy the cardboard boxes of freezer fish to make smoked fish and other vegetables, okro, tomatoes, etc. With this credit, her turnover could increase and she could invest more in her children education, health and literacy. Finance this woman is not only an act of economy, but rather a humanitarian act.

Madame T. Catherine est née en 1965 à Tsévié. Actuellement, elle réside à Davié-Modji où elle fait son petit commerce de poissons et des condiments. Mariée, elle est mère de cinq (05) enfants qui sont malheureusement laissés à sa charge car le mari vient de doter sa 3ème femme. Courageuse et pleine de confiance, elle a continué son activité grâce à un deuxième crédit de $350. Ce qui lui permet de dégager un revenu substantiel aux besoins élémentaires de ses enfants. Bien qu’analphabète, elle gère de façon extraordinaire son activité et est toujours très correct dans le remboursement de ses crédits obtenus. Elle est une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenu financièrement en vue d’accroître ses activités. Ce crédit de $700 qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter des cartons de poissons congelés pour en faire des poissons fumés et d’autres légumineuses, gombo et tomate, de prendre. Avec ce crédit, son chiffre d’affaires pourra augmenter et elle pourra investir plus dans l’éducation, la santé et la scolarisation des enfants. Financer cette femme est non seulement un acte économique, mais plutôt un geste humanitaire.

loans.use: To buy the cardboard boxes of freezer fish and other vegetables

loans.name: Eya

texts.en:
Madam Eya A. was born toward 1955 at Ahépé (P/Yoto). She is illiterate and mother of six (06) children. Her husband , a volunteer teacher at a private school, with meagre salaries but always irregulars. What puts him to spend several weeks in the village without trying to meet the family giving up a large part of the charges in the woman hands. Dynamic and undertaking, she growths her small activity of food selling before the schools. From that activity which she controls well and in which she is making profit, she assumes as much as possible, her children elementary needs. Honest and rigorous, she has succeeded to manage with rigour, the two credits obtained repaid promptly. She requests today a credit of $550 which will serve to buy cereals in view to strengthen her activities of mould paste. So, she could increase her incomes and provide for the family needs.

Madame A. Eya est née vers 1955 à Ahépé dans la préfecture Yoto. Elle est analphabète et mère de six (06) enfants. Son mari est un enseignant volontaire dans une école privée aux maigres salaires mais encore irréguliers. Ce qui fait qu’il passe des semaines dans le village sans chercher à revoir la famille laissant une bonne partie des charges sur la femme. Dynamique et entreprenante, elle développe sa petite activité de vente de nourriture devant les écoles. A partir de cette activité qu’elle maîtrise bien et en qui elle doit sa survie, elle assume tant que mal, les besoins élémentaires de ses enfants. Honnête et rigoureuse, elle a su gérer avec rigueur, les deux crédits obtenus et promptement remboursés. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $550 qui servira à acheter des céréales en vue renforcer ses activités de vente de boule de pâte. Ainsi donc, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Derrick

texts.en: Derrick is a young masonry who is one of the 6  products of Kraban Support Foundation\'s Learning and Employment for Poverty Redduction and Development Programme (LEAD. This project is expected to lead the youth to disabuse their minds that only \'white-collar\' jobs are good for them upon completion of the Junior Secondary Schools. Derrick has benefitted immensely form the TEACH lending skills programme and is looking for KIVA loan of $1,225 to purchase construction tools to train his apprentice and to equip his construction business

loans.use: CONSTRUCTION EQUIPMENTS - TOOL BOX

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Aunt Sarah is a medium-sized commercial farmer. She cultivates crpos and also rear animals including livestock especially locally bred fowls and goats. She wishes to expand her business after participating in her first TEACH lENDING training. She has deveoped her business and marketing plan. Aunt Sarah therefore wants a credit facility of $1100 from KIVA to hire farm 3 more farm hands to assit her in managing her poultry business.

loans.use: Hiring Farm Hands for Poultry Keeping

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Born in 1977 at Tchêkpo, Madam Ama G. was set at Tsévié for 10 years for her activities of bread selling. She is a single with a child she got while going to school at form 2. The child doesn’t even know his father as the later has left the town before the birth of the child and is never turned back. Before that situation and to show her dependence toward her parents, she has started to sell bread thank to a credit of $100 got and entirely repaid. What will allow her to rent a room that and develop her activities. To develop and increase her activities, Madam Ama G. requests a credit of $850 to buy and sell wheat flour for bread fabrication. This project that she could well manage and make profitable will help her to increase her incomes in order to improve her living condition and her children well being.

Née en 1977 à Tchékpo, Madame G. Ama s’est installée depuis plus de 10 ans à Tsévié pour ses activités de vente de pain. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant qu’elle avait eu sur les bancs d’école en classe de 5ème. L’enfant ne connaît même pas son père car ce dernier a quitté la ville avant même sa naissance et n’y est plus retourné. Face à cette situation et pour marquer son indépendance vis-à-vis de ses parents, elle commença par vendre du pain grâce à un crédit de $100 obtenu et entièrement remboursé. Ce qui lui a permis de louer une chambre et de développer ses activités. Pour diversifier et accroître ses activités, Madame G. Ama sollicite un crédit de $850 pour acheter et vendre de la farine de blé servant à la fabrication du pain. Ce projet qu’elle pourra bien gérer et rentabiliser lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et le bien-être de son enfant.

loans.use: to buy and sell wheat flour for bread fabrication

loans.name: Mèvi

texts.en:
Madam Mèvi E. was born toward 1954 at Tsévié-Xétsiavi. She is married and is a mother of five (05) children. Her husband, a building master does not have a fix job and can’t assume his responsibilities of chief of family despite his good will. Before such a situation of misery, Madam Mèvi E. , tried also from her small trade to contribute to the family needs. Honest and well loved in her area, she enjoys from a good reputation which attract her customary. With the credit of $150 got and regularly repaid, she has succeeded to develop her activities which she controls has the secret. Madam Mèvi E. requests today, a credit of $550 to start again the trade of maize and yams which she was doing before. Dynamic and with good faith, she could well manage and make profit this project which will contribute, surely, to increase her incomes and consequently to assure a best living condition to all her family.

Madame E. Mèvi est née vers 1954 à Tsévié Xétsiavi. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Son mari, un maître maçon n’a pas un emploi fixe et n’arrive pas à assumer ses responsabilités de père de famille malgré sa bonne volonté. Face à cette situation de misère, Madame E. Mèvi, se débrouille également à partir de son petit commerce pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille. Honnête et bien aimée dans son quartier, elle jouit d’une bonne réputation qui lui attire la clientèle. Avec les $150 de crédit obtenu et régulièrement remboursé, elle a su développer ses activités dont elle a la maîtrise et le secret. Madame E. Mèvi sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $550 pour reprendre le commerce de maïs et d’igname qu’elle faisait au paravent. Dynamique et de bonne foi, elle pourra bien gérer et rentabiliser ce projet qui contribuera, à coup sûr, à augmenter ses revenus et de facto, à assurer une meilleure condition de vie à toute sa famille.

loans.use: to start again the trade of maize and yams

loans.name: Afi Akpéné

texts.en:
Madam Akpéné Afi L. was born in 1976 at Lomé. Issued from a numerous family, his parents didn’t have the means to put her to school. She stopped at class five to be launched in the small trade of general food at the big market of Lomé. Married to a man from Tsévié, they were established in that town to follow her trade. Meanwhile, the husband has lost his job and became unemployed for a long time. Since then, he helps his wife to manage her business. Together, they have got two (02) children and have adopted another one like a house girl. Honest and dynamic, she has succeeded to convince by her ability to well manage businesses and to make them profitable. Enjoying from a total trust in her area, she has requested and got two times credit for strengthen her activity, these credits which were well managed and repaid without incident. Currently, Madam Akpéné Afi L. requests a credit of $1000 which will serve to buy first basic merchandises (sugar, rice, oil, etc.) This assistance will help her to increase her business and the family living conditions.

Madame L. afi Akpéné est née en 1976 à Lomé. Issue d’une famille nombreuse, ses parents n’ont pas eu de moyens pour lui assurer une éducation scolaire. Elle s’est arrêtée au CM1 pour se lancer dans le petit commerce d’alimentation générale au grand marché de Lomé. Mariée à un homme originaire de Tsévié, ils se sont installés dans ladite ville pour poursuivre son commerce. Entre temps, le mari a perdu son emploi et est en chômage continu. Depuis lors, il aide sa femme à gérer son affaire. Ensemble, ils ont eu deux (02) enfants et en ont adopté une autre comme domestique. Honnête et dynamique, elle a su convaincre par sa capacité à bien gérer les affaires et à les rentabiliser. Jouissant d’une confiance totale dans son quartier, elle avait sollicité et obtenu deux fois de crédit pour renforcer son activité, lesquels crédits qu’elle avait géré et remboursé sans incident. Aujourd’hui, Madame L. Afi Akpéné sollicite un crédit de $1000 F qui servira à l’achat des marchandise de première nécessité (sucre, riz, huile, etc.). Ce coup de main lui permettra de rentabiliser et d’accroître son affaire. Ce qui entraînera une augmentation de ses revenus en vue de l’amélioration les conditions d’existence de la famille.

loans.use: to buy first basic merchandises (sugar, rice, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.en:
Madam Mawussi A. D. was born on 11th September 1982 at Tsévié. She has opened a hair dressing workshop at Wuto where she is performing her activity associated to the selling of cosmetics produces. Madam D. is a single without children and only reached the primary school. Born from numerous and poor family, she didn’t succeed to continue her studies for lack of support. Thus, she learns the hair dressing. Currently, she has opened her own dressing salon which she is managing without problems thank to a credit of $ 100 which she has already repaid. She requests a credit of $ 850 to buy hair dressers and dressing items in order to strengthen her activities. What will allow her to increase her incomes leading to her financial autonomy.

Madame D. A. Mawussi est née le 11 Septembre 1982 à Tsévié. Elle a ouvert un atelier de coiffure à Wuto où elle fait son activité associée à la vente des produits cosmétiques. Madame D. A.
