Mawussi est célibataire sans enfant et n’a atteint que le niveau d’instruction primaire. Issue de famille nombreuse et pauvre, elle n’a pas pu continuer ses études faute de support. Elle a appris la coiffure. Actuellement, elle a ouvert son propre salon de coiffure qu’elle gère sans difficulté grâce à un crédit de $100 qu’elle a déjà remboursé. Elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour acheter des séchoirs et des articles de coiffure afin de renforcer ses activités. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus conduisant à son autonomie financière.

loans.use: to buy hair dressers and dressing items

loans.name: Ami

texts.en:
Miss Ami D. was born in 1980 at Boloumodji (Tsévié). She is single without children and has a level of elementary studies. Feeling the hard difficult conditions of his future life, she was launched in the cereals produces and general food trading. She is living miserably in a renting house and comes to assist her old aged parents. Very serious and determine to succeed, she has the gift of businesses and show the proof of a young girl of trust from her two credits repaid without incident. To strengthen her activity, she requests a credit of $ 850 which will serve to buy the essential basic products. This project will allow her to hire a descent lodging, to take care of herself, to improve her living conditions and beyond that of her very old parents

Mademoiselle D. Ami est née en 1980 à Boloumodji Tsévié. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est de niveau d’études élémentaire. Sentant son avenir hypothéqué, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits céréaliers et d’alimentation général. Elle vit péniblement dans une maison en location et vient en aide à ses parents avancés en âge. Très sérieuse et appliquée, elle a le don des affaires et fait preuve d’une jeune fille de confiance à partir de ses deux crédits remboursés sans incident. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui servira à acheter les produits de première nécessité. Ce projet va lui permettre de se loger convenablement, de se prendre entière en charge, d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et par delà, celle de ses parents très fatigués.

loans.use: to buy the essential basic products

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Mr Kossi K. has been a shoe cobbler for more than 15 years. Born at Havé in 1965, he moved to Tsévié N’Danyi for his work. He is a shoe maker and sells the commercially. Remarried, he has a child with his former wife who left him due to his very difficult socio-economic situation. As he was living in extreme poverty; sometimes he couldn’t find anything to eat. But his courage and determination have helped him to overcome that situation little by little thanks to his first credit of $ 100 which he repaid without incident. His primary level studies have helped him to well manage his business and make profit thanks to the advices of the credits agents. Which have helped him to get two other respective loans of $ 300 and $ 550 which are all repaid. To improve his business Mr Kossi K. requests a credit of $ 850 which will allow him to acquire material and cobbler articles. The improvement and profitability of his business will allow him to accomplish in a responsible way, the duties of the household chief by improving his existing conditions.

Translated from French by Farron BLANC, a Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Kossi est cordonnier depuis plus de 15 ans. Né à Havé en 1965, il s’est installé à Tsévié N’Danyi pour ses activités. Il fait la réparation des chaussures et en fabrique pour la commercialisation. Remarié, il a un enfant avec son ex-femme qui l’a quitté à cause de sa situation socio économique très déplorable. Car il vivait dans une extrême pauvreté ne trouvant même pas dès fois de quoi manger. Mais son courage et son abnégation l’ont aidé à s’en sortir peu à peu de cette situation grâce à son premier crédit de $100 qu’il a remboursé sans incident. Son niveau d’études élémentaires lui a permis de bien gérer ses affaires et à les rentabiliser grâce aux conseils des agents de crédit. Ce qui lui a permis d’obtenir deux autres crédits respectifs de $300 et $550 qui sont tous bien remboursés. Pour renforcer son activité, Monsieur K. Kossi sollicite un crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre d’acquérir des matériels et fournitures de cordonnerie. Le renforcement et la rentabilité de l’activité va lui permettre d’accomplir, d’une manière plus responsable, les devoirs de père de famille en améliorant ses conditions d’existence.

loans.use: to acquire material and cobbler articles

loans.name: Koku Mensah

texts.en:
Mr Mensah Koku A. was born in 1974 at Tsevié. Married, and the father of three children, he is also still responsible for his younger brother. Due to a lack of support, he had to end his studies at level five and start a small business, which he manages marvellously. However, a shortage of funds prevents his business from developing any further. Thanks to his first loan of $100, which he repaid regularly with no problems, Mr A. gained the necessary experience to manage a more substantial loan. His last two fully repaid loans, of $250 and $550 respectively, strengthen the trust deserved by a loyal and creditworthy client.

Mr Mensah Koku A. is asking for a loan of $900, which will be used to stock up with essential products from the wholesalers. This project will allow him to grow his business, increase his income, and improve living conditions for his family who count on him alone.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, a Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Koku Mensah est né en 1974 à Tsévié. Marié et père de trois (03) enfants, il a encore son petit frère à sa charge. Par manque de support, il a dû arrêter ses études en classe de 5ème et s’est lancé très tôt dans le petit commerce qu’il gère à merveille. Toutefois, l’insuffisance de fonds fait que son commerce n’évolue pas assez bien. Ainsi, grâce à un premier crédit de $100 obtenu et régulièrement remboursé sans incident, Monsieur A. Koku Mensah a acquis une expérience qui lui permet de gérer un crédit plus consistant. Ses deux derniers crédits respectifs de $250 et $550 parfaitement bien remboursés renforcent toute la confiance que l’on peut avoir à un client fidèle et solvable.

Monsieur A. Koku Mensah sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $900 qui va servir à s’approvisionner chez les grossistes des produits de première nécessité. Ce projet lui permettra d’accroître ses affaires pour augmenter ses revenus et de facto améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille qui ne compte que lui seul.

loans.use: to stock up with essential products from the wholesalers

loans.name: Saharatou

texts.en:
Ms Saharatou Y. was born in Sokodé in 1978. She currently lives in Tsévié and runs a teddy-bear business. Married with one child, she has to meet nearly 80% of all household expenses, since her husband has been unemployed for more than two years. With only a fourth-grade education, she is doing the best she can, with help and advice from the authorities. Ms Y. is a trustworthy woman who has successfully handled and repaid two previous loans. She is now facing a need for expansion, which will require more working capital. She is therefore looking for a loan of $750 in order to purchase teddy-bear supplies. If her efforts are successful, the additional income will enable her to do more for her child and her entire family, of which she is now the main support.

Mlle Y. Saharatou est née en 1978 à Sokodé. Elle réside actuellement à Tsévié où elle fait le commerce des nounours. Mariée et mère d’un enfant, presque 80% des charges du foyer lui reviennent car son mari est en chômage depuis plus de deux ans. Avec son niveau de la classe de 4ème du secondaire, elle essaie de gérer au mieux ses affaires grâce aux appuis conseils des agents. Mlle Y. Saharatou est une femme de confiance qui a su bien gérer et rembourser ses deux crédits obtenus. Elle fait face aujourd’hui à un problème de croissance qui nécessite un renforcement de ses fonds roulement. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $750 pour acheter des balles de nounours. La parfaite réalisation de ses activités renforcera ses revenus lui permettant de mieux s’occuper de son enfant et des besoins de toute la famille qui reposent aujourd’hui sur elle.

loans.use: to buy teddy-bear supplies

loans.name: Baba-Toundé

texts.en:
Born in 1968 at Kpatéfi, Mr Baba-Toundé A. is married and the father of a child. His wife, who has been ill since their child was born, has become another dependent for him. The income from his poorly equipped dressmaking and embroidery workshop no longer covers his household expenditures and his wife's treatment. With his education level of class two, he has successfully managed his first two loans with no problems. His impeccable work has made him a popular and busy dressmaker. To keep his clientele and develop customer loyalty, Mr A. needs to be better equipped to respond quickly and efficiently to his customers' demands. He is a trustworthy man who has fully repaid his $350 loan with no problems.

For this purpose, Mr A. is asking for a loan of $950 to acquire a modern embroidery machine, and to buy fabrics to make ready-to-wear clothes. This will increase his income and so improve the well-being of his family, and above all it will assure better treatment for his wife who badly needs this help.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, a Kiva volunteer.

Né en 1968 à Kpatéfi, Monsieur A. Baba-Toundé est marié et père d’un enfant. Sa femme, malade depuis la naissance de leur enfant, devient un autre fardeau pour lui. Les revenus de son atelier de couture et de broderie mal équipé, ne suffisent plus à couvrir les charges du ménage et du traitement de sa femme. Avec son niveau de la classe de seconde, il a su bien gérer ses deux premiers sans incident. Son travail impeccable fait de lui un couturier bien aimé et fréquenté. Pour maintenir sa clientèle et fidéliser, Monsieur A. Baba-Toundé a besoin de mieux s’équiper pour répondre efficacement et rapidement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Il est un homme de confiance grâce au parfait remboursement de son crédit de $ 350 sans incident.

Pour ce faire, Monsieur A. Baba-Toundé sollicite un crédit de $ 950 pour acquérir une machine de broderie moderne et acheter des tissus pour confectionner des habits prêt-à-porter pour la commercialisation. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus pour améliorer le bien-être de sa famille et surtout d’assurer un meilleur traitement de sa femme qui a besoin d’être secourue.

loans.use: to acquire a modern embroidery machine, and to buy fabrics to make ready-to-wear clothes

loans.name: Gadagodo

texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Tabligbo, Mr. Gadagodo S. is married and is the father of four (4) children. He is a motorcycle mechanic and sells spares for bicycles in Tsévié. Having not completed primary school for lack of support, he had to learn mechanics for motorcycles and bicycles in his native village. This career which he has been practicing for ten years is not sufficient really to completely meet the family needs due to the insufficiency of his working capital. So he requested and got an initial credit of $500 which he has repaid without incident to strengthen his business of selling spares. With his sense of good management, Mr. Gadagodo S. deserves to be supported financially to increase his businesses. Thus, he is requesting a credit of $1,200 to buy spares in Nigeria and to resell them in Tsévié. This project will increase his income allowing him to better take care of his family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1963 à Tabligbo, Monsieur S. Gadagodo est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Il est mécanicien 2 roues et vend à Tsévié, des pièces détachées pour vélo. N’ayant même terminé le cours primaire par manque de support, il a dû apprendre la mécanique à deux roues dans son village natal. Ce métier qu’il exerce depuis 10 ans, ne suffit pas réellement pour prendre totalement en charge les besoins de sa famille pour insuffisance de son fonds de roulement. Alors, il a sollicité et obtenu un premier crédit de $500 qu’il a bien remboursé sans incident pour renforcer son commerce de pièces détachées. Ayant le sens de bon gestionnaire, Monsieur S. Gadagodo mérite d’être soutenu financièrement pour accroître ses affaires. Aussi, sollicite-t-il un crédit de $1200 pour acheter les pièces détachées au Nigéria pour venir les revendre à Tsévié. Ce projet augmentera ses revenus lui permettant de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy and sell spares

loans.name: Kokoe Philomène

texts.en:
Manager of a cafe, Madam Philomène Kokoe A. was born in 1954 at Aného (P/Lacs). She manages her own shop at Tabligbo. Widowed with four dependant children, Philomène succeeds well to manage her shop. Very active and dynamic, she masteries well all the aspects of her trade. Despite her solitude, she is always friendly and shows good character. Philomène is a woman full of confidence in whom, and we are certain will use the credit wisely and ensure its prompt repayment. The credit of $ 850 she is requesting will serve to supply her shop with general food produces (milk, tomatoes, beauty products, beer etc). The end result of this project will provide her a substantial income allowing her to improve the family well-being and assure the education of the three orphaned children.

Translated from French by Farron BLANC

Gérante d’une buvette, Madame A. Kokoe Philomène est née en 1954 à Aného (P/Lacs). Elle gère sa propre boutique à Tabligbo. Veuve avec quatre (04) enfants à charge, Philomène arrive bien à gérer sa boutique. Très active et dynamique, elle maîtrise bien tous les aspects de son commerce. Malgré sa solitude, elle est toujours accueillante et jouit d’une bonne moralité. Philomène est une femme pleine de confiance en qui, l’on doit faire confiance pour une utilisation saine du crédit et s’assurer de son prompt remboursement. Le crédit de $ 850 qu’elle sollicite servira à approvisionner sa boutique de produits d’alimentation générale (lait, tomates, les produits de beauté, les bières etc.). La parfaite réalisation de ce projet pourra lui procurera un revenu substantiel lui permettant d’améliorer le bien-être de la famille et assurer la scolarisation des trois enfants orphelins.

loans.use: to supply her shop with general food produces

loans.name: Eya

texts.en:
Ms Eya A., a businesswoman, was born in 1970 in Aképé-Kpawla (P/Yoto). She is married, with one child, and lives an exemplary life with her husband despite being poor. Finding that her husband did not bring in enough to meet their basic household needs, Ms A. went into business by opening a shop, using a $450 loan which she has been steadily paying off without any problems. However, because she has insufficient working capital Ms A. is unable to develop her business properly, in spite of her management abilities and the support of her husband. Her good faith and excellent business sense make her a trustworthy woman deserving of any financial assistance needed by her business.

Ms Eya A. is now asking for a loan of $950 to stock up on general foodstuffs, such as rice, beans, oil, canned tomatoes, sugar, etc., and especially for making cakes, for which she is locally famous. Financial support for this project will increase her income and help her to meet the needs of her household.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY/J.V. Guy-Bray.

Madame A. Eya est une commerçante née en 1970 à Ahépé-Kpawla (P/Yoto). Mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle vit une vie exemplaire avec son mari malgré leur état de pauvreté. Sachant que les revenus de son mari ne suffisait pour les besoins élémentaires du foyer, Madame A. Eya s’est lancée dans le commerce par l’ouverture d’une boutique grâce un crédit de $450 obtenu et régulièrement remboursé sans incident. Mais, pour insuffisance de fonds de roulement, Madame A. Eya n’arrive pas à bien évoluer dans son commerce malgré sa maîtrise de gestion appuyée par son conjoint Sa bonne foi et son sens de bonne gestionnaire font d’elle une femme de confiance pour toute assistance financière au besoin de son commerce. Madame A. Eya sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $950 pour s’approvisionner en produits d’alimentation générale tels que le riz, le haricot, l’huile, les boîtes de tomate, du sucre etc. et surtout le commerce de gâteaux qui fait sa renommée dans le milieu. L’appui financier apporté à ce projet augmentera ses revenus afin de contribuer aux besoins de son foyer.

loans.use: For the purchase of supplies of general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia makes cleaning products like disinfectant, soap, detergent, shampoo, etc. She has been working in this business for about 2 months. She took a course at the Mifex MERIT Centers that taught her basic chemistry and gave her the skills to make her own cleaning products. This type of business is very lucrative in this sector because the manufactured versions of these products are usually too expensive for most to afford. Therefore, Sonia can make her own products at home and sell them to other businesses. Sonia is also a seamstress. As a complimentary source of income she makes different types of clothes that she sells.

She needs the loan in order to invest the chemicals necessary to maker her products. She also wants to invest in cloths for her sewing operation.

Sonia has 4 children, 2 of which are studying in college. Her husband helps her in many of her activities, but he is much older than she is and cannot work much anymore. Part of her home is made out of cement but the other part is still made only of bamboo like wood.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan in order to invest the chemicals necessary to maker her products. She also wants to invest in cloths for her sewing operation.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra needs the loan in order to continue making improvements to the business. Although the front part of her store, which is pictured, is made out of cement, the inside is still wood and is vulnerable to damage from heavy rains. She also wants to invest in toys to sell from her store for the Christmas season.

Alexandra is 40 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is her right hand man in business and in life. They are a very united family and believe firmly in the value of education for the children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan in order to continue making improvements to the business

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia has been running her small restaurant for four years. She sells many types of fast foods like chicken kabobs and tortillas. Silvia has been forced to work from a very young age. Before opening up her restaurant she worked selling clothes around her neighborhood. Because of pain in her legs from the years of hard work, she could no longer continue to sell clothes. She decided to start this restaurant which has been successful.

She needs the loan in order to invest in new tables and chairs. She also wants to build a wall to separate her from her business because she is now using only a large piece of plastic.

Silvia is 46 years old and has 6 children, two of which are independent. She has been separated from her husband for about 15 year. He does try to help his children financially, but he does not provide nearly enough to cover all the basic necessities.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan in order to invest in new tables and chairs.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a clothes saleswoman. She mainly sells to the people in her community, including much of her family and friends. She buys the clothes from a wholesale distributor who asks for 50% of the price of the clothes up front. Once she sells she finishes paying the orders off and she invests in new products. She needs the loan in order to buy clothes and toys for the holiday season.

Martha is 34 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is a construction worker who is very dedicated to his family. Recently one of their daughters fell 4 meters and fractured her skull. Although she is almost fully recuperated, it was a difficult financial and emotional burden on the family. They are currently building their home in a piece of land given to them by Martha’s mother in law.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan in order to buy clothes and toys for the holiday season.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a small general store where she mostly sells office and school supplies. She started off with $200 and bought a display case and a couple of notebooks. She now has a complete line of office supplies including pens, pencils and staplers. She will use the loan in order to buy a photocopier so she may sell copies to the general copy. She has observed that these types of businesses have success and that there is no competition nearby.

Maria is a 35 year old single mother. She feels very happy to have the profits from her business to rely on for food and the education of her child. Her dream is to send her son college and continue to be successful with her store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She will use the loan in order to buy a photocopier so she may sell copies to the general copy.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen sells cosmetics and perfumes. She started off as an assistant for a friend and decided to branch off and start her own operation with a $100 loan from her sister. She now offers cosmetics, perfumes and cleaning products to her customers. She is need of the loan in order to invest in more of these products and also in some clothes. She sees the time of year as a golden opportunity to increase her profits.

Carmen is a single mother of three children. Two of her children are old enough to go to school but the other is still too young. The toughest part of raising her kids on her own has been finding someone to take care of them. When she sees that she must go out and sell in order to make ends meet, she has to leave her youngest child at the care of her 9 year old daughter. She hopes that if she continues to increase profits she will be able to run the business out of her home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is need of the loan in order to invest in more of these products and also in some clothes

loans.name: Soraida

texts.en:
Soraida owns a small restaurant where sells lunch and dinner. She started off by making to-go lunches that she would sell to at construction sites. She saw a business opportunity in her own community and set up her home as a restaurant. With the loan money, she will buy a new grill so she can sell chicken kabobs and other barbecued foods.

Soraida is 29 years and has 3 children. Thanks to her business she has been to help her husband provide for their household. Her major goal is to buy a separate piece of land to run her business from.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: With the loan money, she will buy a new grill so she can sell chicken kabobs and other barbecued foods.

payments.comment: Se le cancelo operación por cambio de negocio sin explicación.

loans.name: Millis

texts.en:
Millis has a general store where she sells office and school supplies. She started the business with the help of her ex-husband who gave her a glass case for her products and $200 worth of merchandise. She has slowly begun to integrate other items into her product line like toys. Millis wants to invest in books and other supplies to sell. Not many people can afford to buy books, but Millis has used payment plans to motivate some potential clients.

Millis is currently separated from her husband. Currently she is taking night school courses at university in order to pursue a degree in commerce. Her dream is to have professional degree and own a successful business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Millis wants to invest in books and other supplies to sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente has a small stand where he sells traditional Ecuadorian dishes. His best dish is encebollado, a stew made with albacore and yucca. Vicente started off as a waiter at a local restaurant, but soon learned how to cook and started his own business. Vicente is looking to take the next step for his business and set up a restaurant. He has already identified the spot he will rent and is looking to make the necessary investments in utensils and chairs.

Vicente is 59 years old and has two children. One of his sons is mentally and physically disabled. He has a speech impediment that makes communication very difficult. Vicente has dedicated his life to providing his son with the best care possible. He wants to save up in order to send him to school for people with disabilities.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Vicente is looking to take the next step for his business and set up a restaurant.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Maria is a clothes saleswoman. Everyday she travels around her community on foot offering her products to her friends, families and acquaintances. She started by selling just shorts and blouses, but she has slowly started to integrate all types of different clothes into her line. She aspires to become a wholesale distributor so she will not have to travel door to door in the hot Guayaquil weather. She will also see much more profits as a major supplier. She will use the loan to invest in a large amount of clothing to sell and to provide to other vendors.

Santa is a single mother with 4 children of which 3 are still in school. Her husband left her four years ago because she would not abort her youngest child. She has faced the tough situation with courage, but relies entirely on her business to support her family. It is very important for her to be able to invest in this activity in order to continue to support for her family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She will use the loan to invest in a large amount of clothing to sell and to provide to other vendors

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella works as a saleswoman. Her main products are shoes and perfume. She learned how to sell by watching her mother who would bring her along when she would go out and sell clothes. She started off by selling lingerie to her close friends and now has moved on to other products. She needs the loan in order to buy her merchandise from wholesalers at better prices. She wants to invest in active wear now that the hottest months are approaching (January – April is the summer season).

Bella is 29 years old and has 2 children. Her biggest aspiration is to be able to giver her kids a complete education. With the extra profits she will help her husband with the construction costs of their new home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan in order to buy her merchandise from wholesalers at better price

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita oponed “Bazar Heidy” three years ago and sold cosmetic goods door-to-door. A year ago, she opened a shop out of her home and has been selling successfully ever since. She mainly markets bazaar items, stationary, and cosmetics. Every day from 8am until 11pm this entrepreneur works hard to support her family, and she is intent on expanding her business to provide them with opportunities that she never had. Margarita’s daughter once loaned her $200 to buy two glass cases to show off her products at the store, and her traveling business has grown steadily over the years. She is applying for this credit so that she can purchase toys, clothes, and invest offer seasonal products. 

Margarita is a single mother of four, and although her children are all adults now, two of them still live with her. Her wish is take out this loan in order to bring in other sources of income from her business.

loans.use: She is applying for this credit so that she can purchase toys, clothes, and invest offer seasonal products.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa J. has been running her business for eight years now. She previously lived with one of her cousins who taught her how to sew. When Rosa was able to earn enough money from sewing, she decided she could do more than just cover her necessities. She wanted to begin selling cosmetics, so she moved in with one of her brothers and they began working together selling these products. Her brother loaned her $30 for the business, but that loan was too small to get her started. Ms. Jimenez is asking for this loan so that she can invest in a wider variety of cosmetics like lipstick, face crème, hair products, and nail polish. Rosa will be able to charge her customers lower prices because she intends to pay her distributor in cash, giving her significant discounts. Most importantly, Ms. Jimenez will be able to open up a storefront in her house, as she only sells her items on weekends. 

Rosa is a 38 year-old single mother who lives with her brother, who is her right-hand man in the business. Right now they rent an apartment, but her goal is to turn her business into a profitable venture and buy a house of their own.

loans.use: Ms. Jimenez is asking for this loan so that she can invest in a wider variety of cosmetics like lipstick, face crème, hair products, and nail polish.

loans.name: Efraín

texts.en: Efraín has been repairing cicycles for twenty years. He works every day from 7am until 11pm helping customers fix their bikes, which for many people are their only mode of transportation. He is applying for this credit so that he can purchase bike components like sprockets, chains, and gears, but he is also planning on using the money to improve the outward appearance of his shop. Efrain is 66 years old, and he lives alone. His wife passed away several years ago, and his four children are grown up. They visit frequently and help him run the shop from time to time. His wish is to continue serving more and more customers, helping them with their bike needs

loans.use: He is applying for this credit so that he can purchase bike components like sprockets, chains, and gears, but he is also planning on using the money to improve the outward appearance of his shop.

loans.name: Inés

texts.en:
Ines has owned her clothing store for twenty years. When she first began at the age of 18, she was looking to support herself when her husband left her. She sold fast food, household items, clothes, and women’s accessories, so now she is mature enough to be considered a seasoned salesperson. Ines wanted to sell clothes because they were her favorite products to sell, and she thought she could make a decent living selling quality products door-to-door. She did that for a period of time, marketing her items mainly to friends and family, as well as local neighborhoods where she knew most of the people. Ines has been able to save enough money to rent a space to store all of her clothes, but she is hoping to use part of the loan funds to rent a location where she can sell her products. 

Ines wants this loan so that she can buy inventory that is seasonal like jackets, sweaters, and pants. This 37 year-old entrepreneur has four children, all of whom still live with her. Two of the children are working and help Ines financially with necessities for the house. Her husband has been working in a factory for the last 15 years, and whenever Ines has to attend to her children or visit her distributors, her husband is able to watch over the business which is open from 8am until 11pm every day.

loans.use: Ines wants this loan so that she can buy inventory that is seasonal like jackets, sweaters, and pants.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.en:
Deisy has seven years of experience selling vegetables. She started selling them during the holidays when her town would hold festivals. When those are not going on, Deisy runs a shop out of her home. When customers started coming, she realized that they were also in need of household items, so slowly she started building an inventory that looked something like a small market. Ms. Holguin moved to a part of Guayaquil call Malvinas five years ago when she bought her house. It is there that she works hard every day from 6:30am until 11pm. She is asking for this loan so that she can attend to the needs of her customers better by keeping more products in stock and offering the best vegetables she can find. 

Deisy is a 26 year-old single mother of three, two of whom are studying in school. When her husband left her, her children were just infants, so she has had to rely on her family to support her. Her wish is to continue building the business and earn higher profits.

loans.use: She is asking for this loan so that she can attend to the needs of her customers better by keeping more products in stock and offering the best vegetables she can find.

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Mr. Komi G. was born in 1967 at Ahépé Akposso in the prefecture of Yoto. He is a sheetmetal welder and merchant. He is married and is the father of four children. Very talented and full of creativity, he is very successful in his business, which he manages rigorously and efficiently. In his neighborhood, he has built his reputation on the quality of his work. Thanks to his first loan, he became a merchant while at the same time working as a welder. Currently, with an ever-growing and demanding customer base, he would like to improve his work performance and to effectively meet the business opportunities that are presented to him on a daily basis.

To do this, he is applying for a $1,200 loan to acquire welding materials and build a stock of electronics-related items, such as batteries and other items for resale. The implementation of this project will ensure that his children are educated and will improve the welfare of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY

Monsieur G. Komi est né en 1967 à Ahépé Akposso dans la préfecture de Yoto. Il est tôlier soudeur et commerçant. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Très doué et animé d’esprit de créativité, il maîtrise parfaitement son activité qu’il gère avec rigueur et efficacité. La qualité de son travail fait sa réputation dans son quartier. Grâce à un premier crédit qu’il a reçu, il exerce le commerce parallèlement à son métier de soudure. Actuellement, devant une clientèle de plus en plus importante et exigeante, il veut améliorer sa prestation et faire face efficacement à la demande qui s’offre à lui quotidiennement.

Il sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $1 200 qui servira à acquérir des matériels de soudure, et aussi à l’achat à la revente des matériels électriques, des batteries et autres produits. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants et d’améliorer le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: to acquire welder materials, and the purchase and resell of electrics materials, batteries and other several products

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo G., born on December 4th, 1971 in Essè-Ana is married and is a father of four (4) children. A welder by trade, he has opened his workshop in one of the busy business areas of Tabligbo. With his elementary study level, Mr. Kodjo G. has always showed a perfect mastery of his profession, and through his well done work, he has been more and more sollicited. But his financial means are very limited to meet to the needs of his customers. This is why Mr. Kodjo G. requests a credit of $1,200 to buy a machine for manufacturing spare parts for "TOUR" motorcycles. The acquisition of that machine will allow him to increase his production capacity in order to better serve his customers. This will increase his income and therefore improve his family living conditions.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur G. Kodjo, né le 04 Décembre 1971 à Essè-Ana est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Soudeur de formation, il a ouvert son atelier dans l’un des quartiers d’affaires et animé de Tabligbo. D’un niveau d’études élémentaire, Kodjo fait preuve d’une parfaite maîtrise de sa profession, et à travers son travail bien fait, il est de plus en plus sollicité. Mais ses moyens financiers trouvent très limités pour répondre aux impératifs de sa clientèle. Pour se faire, Kodjo sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour acheter une machine de fabrication des pièces de motos « TOUR ». L’acquisition de cette machine lui permettra d’accroître sa capacité de production afin de mieux servir sa clientèle. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus et facto, améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille

loans.use: to buy a machine for manufacturing "TOUR" motorcycle parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Perris would like to pay her daughter’s college fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Adjowavi Akofala

texts.en:
Mrs. Akofala Adjowavi T. sells school items and honey. Native of Notsè (P/Haho), she was born on September 24th, 1962, and is married with four children. Having abandoned her studies at secondary level, Mrs. T. became involved in her business, which provides her with a substantial income covering more than 70% of the household costs. She has conscientiously proved herself to be a good manageress with her two loans that have been steadily repaid.

Mrs. T. is now asking for a loan of $850 which will allow her to stock up with honey and school items, and to purchase a machete. This will increase her income for the needs of her children and the home.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, a Kiva volunteer.

Madame T. Adjowavi Akofala est une commerçante des articles scolaires et de miel. Originaire de Notsè (P/Haho), Akofala, née le 24 Septembre 1962 est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Ayant abandonné ses études au cours secondaire, Madame T. s’est attachée à son commerce qui lui procure un revenu substantiel qui lui permet de contribuer à plus de 70% des charges du ménage. Très rigoureuse, elle a fait preuve de bonne gestionnaire et a su bien gérer les deux crédits obtenus et régulièrement remboursés.

Madame T. Adjowavi Akofala sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $850 qui lui permettra de faire un stockage de miel, des articles scolaires et l’achat de coupe-coupe. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus au besoin de ses enfants et de son foyer.

loans.use: to stock up with honey and school items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would like to buy  feeds for her dairy cows

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie was born 40 years ago. She is single with 3 children 2 of whom are in school. Winnie joined WEEC after seeing how her friend’s lives were transformed. She was very determined to follow group rules and regulations. She was enrolled and after sometimes, she was appointed as a group discipline mistress. She started a retail shop of house hold good with her first loan at group level. This shop transformed her life and she is now able to pay her children school fees without much struggle. Due to fees deductions, it has been difficult to her restocking her shop. She hopes to get a loan and buy more goods in large quantity since her son finished high school last year. She feels that her business performance will increase due to enough stock that will attract many customers. From the income she will get, she will make to take her son to college after few months. She plans to repay the loan on monthly basis

loans.use: Winnie would like to buy sacks of sugar, salt, laundry detergents, soft drinks, and cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Amédenta, Mrs. Massan A. is married and is the mother of two (2) children. Her husband is unemployed but has more than one wife. The wife is left to herself; the needs of the family and the children’s upbringing are her responsibility alone. She is very overwhelmed by problems, but never admits defeat. Very persevering, and putting her faith in the future, she is developing her business of selling groceries and also selling donuts in schools. Despite her illiteracy, she keeps her books very well, which deserves to be encouraged, and which has already been proved through credits she has already received and repaid. She is currently requesting $850 to strengthen her business of selling cakes and groceries. The income from her activities will help her to better take care of her children and meet her household’s needs.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1972 à Amédenta, Madame A. Massan est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Le mari est sans emploi mais polygame. La femme est laissée à elle-même, les besoins de la famille, l’éducation des enfants relèvent de sa seule responsabilité. Elle est très accablée par les problèmes, mais ne s’avoue jamais vaincue. Très persévérante et avec sa foi en l’avenir, elle développe le commerce d’alimentation générale et la vente des beignets dans les écoles. Malgré qu’elle soit analphabète, elle tient une comptabilité qui mérite d’être encouragée et qui a déjà fait ses preuves à travers les crédits déjà reçus et très bien remboursés. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui $850 pour renforcer son commerce de vente de gâteaux et d’alimentation générale. Les revenus tirés de ses activités lui permettront de mieux s’occuper des besoins ses enfants de son foyer.

loans.use: to strengthen her business of selling cakes and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mawulawoè

texts.en:
With an educational level of class CM2, Mr Mawulawoè E. was born in 1967 at Dangbessito in the district of Sanguéra. He is a monogamous father of four children, with one other dependent child. His main occupation is raising pigs, and he wishes to improve this business with a loan of $1000. This money would allow him to obtain a better breed of pigs, and to buy veterinary services and food for the animals. His current and potential future clientele represents a major asset for the success and durability of his venture. The ideal fulfillment of this project will allow him to increase his income considerably, with a view to making improvements for his family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, a Kiva volunteer.

Du niveau de la classe de CM2, Monsieur E. Mawulawoè est né en 1967 à Dangbessito dans le canton de Sanguéra. Il est monogame et père de quatre (04) enfants et a un autre enfant à sa charge. Il a pour activité principale l’élevage de porcs qu’il souhaite améliorer à travers un crédit de $1000. Ce fonds lui permettra de se procurer d’une race améliorée de porcs, de s’acheter un service vétérinaire et des provendes pour les bêtes. La clientèle actuelle et potentielle qu’il dispose est un atout majeur pour la bonne réussite et la pérennité de ses activités. La parfaite réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter sensiblement ses revenus en vue de l’amélioration acceptable de sa famille.

loans.use: to obtain a better breed of pigs, and to buy veterinary services and food for the animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Anna would like to buy sacks of flour, sugar, salt, packs of laundry detergents and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Leah would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Perris would like to buy more materials for embroidery of loose covers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy African Attires-curios, textiles, beads and baskets for Exhibition Shows

loans.name: Novissi-

texts.en:
The “Novissi-D.” Women’s Association represents an eight-woman solidarity group. They all run small businesses that bring in a modest income. However, these women and everyone in their village face a serious problem as regards drinking-water, which is desperately lacking locally. The consequences are severe, with continuing elevated rates of diarrhea and related illnesses, as well as infant mortality, in the area.

For reasons of health and daily life, these women are requesting a loan of $2,000 to drill a hole for a well. The resulting drinking water will be managed by the Association and sold to the population. This project therefore has not only an economic aspect but more importantly a humanitarian one, which merits support and financing. The conviction of these women, and especially their ability to manage and make their business activities profitable, is evidence that this project will be a fine achievement for the well-being of the entire village and its surrounding area.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY/J,V. Guy-Bray:

Le Groupement féminin « NOVISSI-D. » est constitué de 8 femmes organisées en groupe de solidarité. Elles ont toutes de petites activités sous la main qui leurs procurent de petit revenu. Cependant, ces femmes et tout le village sont confrontés au sérieux problèmes d’eau potable qui manque cruellement dans le milieu. Les conséquences sont lourdes avec des maladies diarrhéiques et la mortalité infantile encore élevée dans la zone.

Pour les besoins de santé et de vie, ces femmes sollicitent un crédit de $2000 pour construire un forage. L’eau potable sera gérée par le groupement et vendue à la population. Ainsi, ce projet a, non seulement un aspect économique mais plutôt humanitaire qui mérite d’être soutenu et financé. La bonne foi de ces femmes et surtout leur capacité de gérer et de rentabiliser leurs activités est une preuve que ce projet sera une belle réussite pour le bien-être de tout le village et ses environs.

loans.use: To drill a borehole for drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Irene would like to buy sacks of maize and bean , flour, sugar and laundry detergents

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Madame Massan A., age 45, who has six children of her own and two other children in her care, lives her life as if she has never had a husband. It is difficult for her to provide daily food for the the table. She lives with all the children crammed into a small hut, and she feels that the men from Togo's Préfecture du Golfe marry for their own pleasure and not to make their wives happy. Polygamy is their main ambition.

Madame A.'s salvation lies in the mats she weaves as her main occupation, and which provide her with a survival income. Despite all her responsibilities and her meagre income, Madame A. has always shown a certain honesty and good management with other people's money in the full repayment of her first two loans.

Today, due to the quality of these services and an ever-increasing market demand, Madame A. is asking for a loan of $900 to allow her to buy raw materials such as the coloring, high quality threads, and so on, in order to increase her production and therefore her income for the needs of her many children. Financing the activities of this woman means saving a whole family from a difficult economic situation.

Translated from French by Alison Dent.

Madame A. Massan, âgée de 45 ans avec six (06) enfants à son actif deux (02) autres enfants à sa charge vit comme n’ayant jamais eu de mari. Le repas quotidien est difficile. Elle vit avec tous ces enfants entassés dans une petite case laissant croire que les hommes de la préfecture du Golfe du Togo se marient pour être heureux et non pour rendre les femmes heureuses. Voilà pourquoi la polygamie est la clé de leur ambition. Le salut de Madame A. Massan reste dans le tressage de natte qui constitue son activité principale et lui procure un revenu de survie. Malgré toutes ses charges et ses maigres revenus, Madame A. Massan a fait d’une certaine honnêteté et de bonne gestion du bien d’autrui à travers ses deux premiers obtenus et parfaitement remboursés.

Aujourd’hui, à cause de la qualité de ses prestations et de la demande de plus en plus forte sur le marché, elle sollicite un crédit de $ 900 qui servira à acheter les matières premières telles le décorant, les fils de qualité, kéti et autres en vue d’accroître sa production et de facto, augmenter ses revenus pour les besoins de ses nombreux enfants. Financer les activités de cette femme, c’est sauver toute une famille en situation économique difficile.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for mats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy second hand furniture shop business

loans.name: Agbéko

texts.en:
Mr Agbéko K. H. is married and father of one child and has five dependants. They have live at “Mawuli” poultry farm in Klémé since 1993. Having served in the veterinary heath centre of Adidogomé, he mastered veterinary treatments. Today, breeding in Togo remains undeveloped and submitted to the native selection. To that fact, the need for animal protein is a crucial problem which he is passionate about. But those means are very limited to respond to the professional requirements and to the demands of his customers who are becoming more and more important. As a good manager, he has successfully managed his first credit of $ 850 with honesty and rigour, which increased his credibility. Mr Agbéko K. H. requests a credit $ 1 500 to buy and sell the veterinary products of best quality to other breeding people in order to raise the breeding quality in the area.

Translated from French by Farron BLANC, a Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur H. K. Agbéko, marié et père d’un (01) enfant et cinq (05) autres personnes à sa charge, détient la ferme avicole « MAWULI» à Klémé depuis 1993. Ayant servi à la clinique vétérinaire d’Adidogomé, il maîtrise bien les prestations des soins vétérinaires. Aujourd’hui, l’élevage au Togo est resté rudimentaire et soumis à la sélection de la nature. De ce fait, le besoin en protéine animale est un problème crucial qui le tient à cœur. Mais ses moyens se trouvent très limités pour répondre aux exigences de la profession et aux impératifs de sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus importante. En bon gestionnaire, il a su bien géré son premier crédit de $850 avec honnêteté et rigueur, ce qui augmente sa crédibilité. Monsieur H. K. Agbéko sollicite un crédit de $1500 pour acheter et vendre des produits vétérinaires de meilleure qualité aux autres éleveurs afin de relever la qualité de l’élevage dans la zone.

loans.use: to buy and sell the veterinary products

loans.name: Afito

texts.en:
Mrs. Afito T. is a 50-years-old widow with six dependents, including twins. She is still leasing her space. In her neighborhood and at the market, she is so famous for selling medicines that they call her Pharmacy Mom. She runs her business so well that she comes to help her neighbors whenever a life is in danger. Given the strong unmet demand, financial assistance is needed to grow her business. The assistance will not only have a positive effect at home but also on everyone around her. She has already benefited from two previous loans, which she paid off easily.

Mrs. T. is now requesting a $950 loan to expand her stock of medicines which will increase her income to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY

Madame T. Afito est veuve et âgée de 50 ans avec à sa charge six (06) enfants dont deux jumeaux. Elle est encore locataire et la vente des médicaments génériques dans son quartier et dans son petit cabaret au marché lui a donné une certaine réputation si bien qu’elle est surnommée « Maman Pharmacienne ». Elle a si maîtrisé son secteur qu’elle vient au secours de ses voisins quand il y a une vie en danger. Compte tenu de la forte demande qu’elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire, elle a besoin être appuyée financièrement pour accroître ses activités. Ceci produira un effet positif non seulement sur son propre foyer mais sur son entourage. Elle a déjà bénéficié deux fois de prêt qui ont été bien remboursés.

Madame T. Afito sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $950 pour augmenter son stock de médicaments génériques. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus au besoin de sa famille.

loans.use: to increase her first-aid medicines storage

loans.name: Doko

texts.en:
Born in Agbodrafo in 1956, Ms Doko M. A. is married and the mother of four (4) children. Her husband, a longshoreman at the port of Lomé, does not have a stable income. Her father is constantly ill and she still has to look after him. Consequently, nearly all of the family’s responsibilities are on her shoulders. A very dynamic and enterprising person, she went into business in order to meet the basic needs of her increased family. Her well-managed store could be more profitable if she had the working capital she needs. Despite being extremely poor, she is widely respected. This assessment was confirmed by the successful repayment of her two previous loans of $300 and $550 respectively, which were regularly paid off without difficulty.

Ms Doko M. A. is now asking for a loan of $850 to develop her grocery store and thereby increase her income, enabling her to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY/J.V. Guy-Bray:

Née à Agbodrafo en 1956, Madame M. A. Doko est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari, docker au port de Lomé, n’a pas de revenus fixes. Son père est constamment malade est encore à sa charge. Ainsi, presque toutes les charges de la famille repose sur elle. Très dynamique et entreprenante, elle s’est lancée dans les activités commerciales à travers lesquelles, elle subvient aux besoins élémentaires de sa famille élargie. Son commerce qu’elle maîtrise bien pourrait lui plus rentable si elle disposait d’un fonds de roulement consistant. Malgré son état d’extrême pauvreté, elle a le respect du bien d’autrui. Cela s’est confirmé à travers ses deux crédits respectifs de $300 et $550 obtenus et régulièrement remboursé sans incident. Aujourd’hui, Madame M. A. Doko sollicite un crédit de $850 pour accroître son commerce d’alimentation générale et de facto, augmenter ses revenus lui permettant d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kayi d'ALMEIDA was born on February 17th, 1963 in Gabon. She is married with three children. Her husband lost his job and has been unemployed since 2002, therefore almost all the household responsibilities rest on Mrs. d'ALMEIDA. Very bold and persevering, she works hard in her small business which provides her with a subsistence income. Honest and conscientious, she has shown herself to be a trustworthy woman through her first two loans, which were repaid without any difficulty despite her many problems. Her dynamism and mastery of her business are very encouraging when it comes to making a profit from her venture.

Mrs. d'ALMEIDA is currently requesting a loan of $850, which will allow her to stock up her grocery store. This will increase her income, thus providing for her children's education and improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, a Kiva volunteer.

Madame D. Kayi est née le 17 février 1963 au Gabon. Elle est mariée avec trois (03) enfants. Son mari est compressé et es en chômage depuis 2002. C’est ainsi que presque toutes les charges de la famille reposent sur elle. Très audacieuse et persévérante, elle s’attèle à son petit commerce qui lui procure un revenu de subsistance. Honnête et rigoureuse, elle a fait preuve d’une femme de confiance à travers ses deux premiers obtenus et remboursés sans incident malgré ses multiples problèmes. Son dynamisme et sa maîtrise de l’activité sont assez rassurants quant à la rentabilité de son entreprise.

Madame D. Kayi sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $850 qui servira à approvisionner sa boutique d’alimentation générale. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus pour servir à l’éducation de ses enfants et à l’amélioration des conditions de sa famille

loans.use: to supply her grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margrate would like to buy a dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah wants to buy buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rosalid wants to buy a high breed dairy cow

loans.name: Togbé

texts.en:
Born in 1977, at Gninoumé, Mr. Togbé D. is married and the father of two (2) children; in addition, he takes care of his two (2) nieces. He is the owner of an upholstery shop on National Highway No. 2 in Aného, which provides for the basic needs of his household. He is now facing an ever-growing demand that he cannot meet, owing to a lack of working capital. Mr. D. is a trustworthy man who has demonstrated good management by paying off his first loan without difficulty.

He is now asking for a loan of $850 to improve his workshop by acquiring a new machine and equipment that will allow him to better serve his customers and develop his business. Implementing this project will clearly add to his income and enormously improve the quality of life for his family.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY/J.V. Guy-Bray.

Monsieur D. Togbé, né en 1977 à Gninoumé, est marié et père de deux (02) enfants en plus de ses deux (02) nièces qui sont à sa charge. Il détient une tapisserie sur la nationale N°2 à Aného à travers lequel, il subvient aux besoins élémentaires de son foyer. Il fait face aujourd’hui à une demande sans cesse croissante qu’il est incapable de satisfaire à cause de l’insuffisance de fonds de roulement. Monsieur D. Togbé est un homme de confiance qui a fait preuve de sa bonne gestion à travers son premier crédit obtenu et remboursé sans incident. Il sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $850 pour aménager son atelier, acquérir une nouvelle machine et des matériels. Ce qui lui permettra de servir au mieux sa clientèle et d’accroître ses activités. Il est tout à fait évident que la réalisation de ce projet augmentera ses revenus et contribuera énormément à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To improve his workshop by acquiring a new machine and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margrate would like to buy a high breed dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi would like to buy insecticides, pestcides,veterinary drugs and animal feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rachael would like to buy different varieties of clothing materials for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi N., who has very high moral standards, is about fifty years old and lives alone with her four (4) children and her granddaughter. She works selling coal. To get supplies, she travels around the country and brings back her supplies to Aneho, where she resells them. For a while now, coal has been rare and Akouvi wishes to build up a large inventory. This is why she is requesting a credit of $750 to buy and resell wood coal to avoid the upcoming shortage. She is at her 4th credit, which leaves no doubt as to her good faith and her sense of respect for the property of others. Given her mastery of her business and her rigorous management, Akouvi deserves to be supported once again.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Jouissant d’une bonne moralité, Madame N. Akouvi, d’une cinquantaine d’âge, vit seule avec ses quatre (04) enfants et sa petite fille. Elle fait le commerce de charbon de bois. Pour s’approvisionner, elle fait des randonnées dans le pays et ramène ses provisions à Aného où elle les revend. Depuis quelques temps, le charbon de bois se fait rare et Akouvi souhaite faire un stock important. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $750 pour acheter pour revente du charbon de bois pour éviter la pénurie qui s’annonce. Elle qui est à son 4ème crédit, ne faite pas de doute de sa bonne foi et de son sens du respect du bien d’autrui. De par la maîtrise de ses activités et de sa rigueur dans la gestion, Akouvi mérite d’être soutenue une fois de plus.

loans.use: to buy and resell coal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a bull

loans.name: Abra

texts.en:
Mrs. Abra N., an orphan, is married with no children but has charge of three children from her sister, who died two years ago. Her long-unemployed husband has not really managed to provide for his family. And so Mrs. N. feels that the entire weight of her family rests on her shoulders. But because she has a business selling grain, she is doing the best she can to ensure that the basic needs of her family are met. With a high school education, she figured out how to develop her business. And she manages it rigorously ever since obtaining two micro-credit loans, which she has paid off without difficulty. This demonstrates her honesty and dependability.

Mrs. N. is reqeusting a $900 loan to lease a larger store for holding major stocks of grain. This will increase her income and will of course noticeably improve the living conditions of her family, whose is currently living a difficult life.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY

Madame N. Abra, orpheline de père et de mère, est mariée sans enfant mais à en charge trois enfants de sa grande sœur décédée il y a 2 ans. Son mari, en chômage continu, n’arrive pas réellement à subvenir aux besoins de son foyer. De ce fait, tout le poids de la famille repose sur elle. Mais, grâce à son activité de vente de céréales, elle arrive tant bien que mal à assurer les charges élémentaires de la famille. Avec le niveau du cours secondaire, elle a su développer son activité qu’elle gère avec rigueur à partir des deux microcrédits obtenus et remboursés sans incident. Ce qui démontre son honnêteté et la confiance que l’on peut lui faire.

Madame N. Abra sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $900 qui servira à louer un magasin plus grand et à faire un stock important de céréales. Ce qui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et de facto, d’améliorer sensiblement les conditions de vie pénible que connaît sa famille aujourd’hui.

loans.use: to rent a bigger warehouse and to make an important storage of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margrate wants to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Honou

texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Togoville, Mrs. A. Honou has been selling cowry (shells) for over 10 years. She studied in Ghana and speaks English very well. She is a mother of four (04) children. She divorced 5 years ago and has to take care of the children alone. She thus spread into pearls, an activity which she has mastered and manages with rigor. She currently has a large customer base, which she finds it difficult satisfying owing to lack of substantial capital. Thus she requested a credit of $750 to buy a supply of pearl and constitute a secure stock for the end of year. As her activities increase, she will generate enough revenue to take care of her children.

Translated from French by Farron BLANC

Née en 1970 à Togoville, Madame A. Hanou exerce le commerce de cauris depuis 10 ans. Elle a fait ses études au Ghana et elle parle bien l’anglais. Elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Divorcé avec son mari, il y a 5 ans de cela, elle dût prendre toutes ses charges et celles de ses enfants. Elle s’est lancée alors dans le commerce de perles dont elle a la maîtrise et gère avec rigueur. Elle dispose aujourd’hui d’une clientèle assez importante qu’elle n’arrive pas satisfaire pour insuffisance de fonds de roulement. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $750 pour s’approvisionner en perles et constituer un stock sécurisant pour ces fêtes de fin d’année. Avec l’augmentation de ses activités, elle pourra dégager un revenu adéquat lui permettant de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: to buy a supply of pearl and constitute a secure stock

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en: Moldova is a small country and most people rely on public or group transportation. Both people who offer transportation with min-buses (called Rutieras) and those who have private cars need affordable service options to keep their vehicles working. Recently many in the area of Ungheni have come to rely on Servotest, a car repair station owned by Vasile L., a local entrepreneur with 3 years of experience as a mechanic. The five-bay garage offers “anything and everything a car needs,” including oil changes, tune-ups and more extensive repairs. In addition to serving individuals, Vasile has secured auto service contracts with many businesses in the area, such as banks and delivery services. He has just started opening an auto parts store as well, located in the same building and providing anything from air filters to shock absorbers for customers who like to do their own repairs. He would like to stock more items in the store and also to purchase new equipment for the workshop, including a diagnostics machine that will help identify complex problems. As more people working abroad return to Moldova(estimation of 20% of the population work abroad) with late-model cars Vasile wants to be ready to provide high-tech service!

loans.use: Auto repair equipment and parts purchases

loans.name: François

texts.en:
Born in Togoville in 1960, Mr. François N. lost his parents very early in life, which forced him to drop out of school to become a boatman on a dugout canoe. He is married and has five children. His wife died eight years ago. In addition to having charge of his children, he also has charge of his three sister and two brothers. As a boatman, he transports both people and goods from village to village along the river. This work could help him make a good living if he owned a good canoe. Having a dependable canoe is very important in this job because a minor mistake or problem could claim dozens of lives.

He is therefore requesting a loan of $850 to buy a new canoe for renting out and for transporting goods and people. This plan will allow him to meet the needs of his family. The financing of this plan is not only economic in focus but is more importantly humanitarian, in that he may avoid shipwrecking and the possible loss of life.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY

Né en 1960 à Togoville, Monsieur N. François a très tôt perdu ses parents ; ce qui lui a coûté l’abandon de ses études pour devenir un vrai piroguier. Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants, il a perdu sa femme il y a 8 ans. En plus des charges de ses enfants, il supporte également ses trois (03) sœurs et deux (02) frères. Il exerce ce métier de piroguier pour le transport des biens et personnes à travers les villages riverains environnants. Ce travail peut lui rapporter s’il dispose d’une bonne pirogue. Ceci est d’autant très important si l’on sait que pour moindre erreur, c’est la vie des dizaines de personnes qui sont en danger. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $850 pour acheter une nouvelle pirogue pour la location et le transport des biens et personnes. Ce projet lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Le financement de ce projet ne vise pas seulement l’aspect économique, mais plutôt un acte humanitaire pour éviter les naufrages et perdre la vie des gens.

loans.use: to buy a new boat

loans.name: Fiodor

texts.en: Many homes in rural areas of Moldova have no running water or only cold running water, but nevertheless are kept clean through hard work. Since having a presentable house is culturally very important to Moldovans (but cleaning can be difficult in these conditions), good cleaning supplies are necessary. When visiting Fiodor’s table in Ungheni’s central market it can easily be seen that shoppers demand a good variety of cleaning agents. He stocks many kinds of soaps (including traditional natural soaps) and detergents, as well as shampoos, toothpaste, batteries and other household necessities. Despite being close to the Romanian border and having many sourcing options, Fiodor has always tried to support Moldovan suppliers. For six years he has been selling similar goods, but strong competition and increasing wholesale prices can sometimes cut into his profit margin. He is requesting a loan to purchase in bulk from a different supplier to fill his inventory before the busy holiday season.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en: Raisa has a small booth at the market, the space for which she just recently purchased at a relatively high cost. She thinks it will be well worth it, however, since she is excited about her new venture. She has begun selling drapery which she receives from Turkey. Moldovans love decorating their houses in any way possible, and ornate window drapes can be a significant investment. Raisa works with her daughter at her booth, holding up different fabrics and adeptly estimating dimensions as customers assess the different options. She would like to expand the variety of colors and fabric types she offers to give buyers a good selection from which to carefully select something that will match existing decorations; something that will be proudly displayed in their homes for years to come.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.en:
Born in Baguida in 1960, Mrs. Adjovi G. became a widower in 2003. Her husband’s job as a motorcycle engine mechanic was not enough to leave any inheritance for her. Today, she takes care of six (6) orphans who attend school, as well as her parents. With her small savings made from selling ice water on the side of the road, Mrs. G. invested in traditional local chicken raising. In 2004, she received some training in pastoral agriculture, which has given her the strong desire to invest in laying hens. Mrs. G. received a first loan that she repaid before the deadline. Her secondary school education allows her to grasp vital information on credit management. She is currently hoping for a credit of $950 to enhance her poultry house and purchase chicks and feed. The success of this business will increase her savings and strenghten her capacity to meet her needs and those of her orphan children and of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1960 à Baguida, Madame Adjovi G. devenue est veuve depuis 2003. La profession de mécanicien 2 roues de son mari ne lui a pas permis de lui laisser un héritage. Aujourd’hui, elle a à sa charge les six (06) orphelins en scolarité et ses parents. Madame G. a investi sa petite économie tirée de la vente de l’eau glacée au bord des routes dans l’élevage traditionnel des poules ordinaires. Elle a suivi en 2004 une petite formation en Agro pastoral qui suscite aujourd’hui en elle une forte envie d’investir dans les pondeuses. Madame G. a reçu un premier crédit qu’elle a soldé avant la date de remboursement. Son niveau secondaire lui confère une aptitude à mieux cerner les informations et les renseignements sur la gestion des crédits. Aujourd’hui elle attend ce crédit de $950 pour aménager son poulailler et acheter les poussins et des provendes. La réussite de cette entreprise lui fera accroître son économie et renforcer sa capacité de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants orphelins et de sa famille.

loans.use: to improve her poultry house and purchase chicks and feed

loans.name: Dumitru

texts.en: Dumitru loves music! He listens to many genres, artists past and present, and finds inspiration in it all. For ten years he has played the piano, a passion which he eagerly turned into a business when he began performing at events, usually doing traditional Moldovan music and Russian favorites. He sings as well and often performs duets together with his wife, also a talented singer, and his cousin. Much of the time he can be found playing at a restaurant in the center of his hometown, where weddings, baptism celebrations, birthday parties and more are frequently hosted. Dumitru hopes to learn more English to better understand the music he listens to and to begin performing some American classics. He also wants to release a CD soon, but says he will need the use of editing tools or services. Right now Dumitru needs better equipment, primarily a mixer to increase the quality of his live performances and thereby ensure that he will continue to be in high demand for special occasions.

loans.use: Purchase of newer music equipment

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.en:
Born into a poor family, Mrs. Akpéné D. is a dynamic woman struggling to pull herself out of poverty. At the age of 28, she stocks grain and sells it in times of shortage. In this way, she earns a little money to provide for her basic needs. But her resource capital is too meager to amass a large enough stock of grain to meet market demands. However, she has excellent control of her store, which she runs rigorously.

Mrs. D. is asking for a loan of $850 to stock up on grain in order to grow her business. The resulting additional income will go towards the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY:

Issue d’une famille pauvre, Mme D. Akpéné est l’une des dynamique dames qui luttent pour sortir de leur état de pauvreté. Agée de 28 ans, elle fait du stockage de céréales qu’elle revend en période de soudure. Ce qui lui fait gagner un peu d’argent pour subvenir à ses besoins élémentaires. Or, son fonds de commerce est très insuffisant pour constituer un stock assez important pour faire face aux demandes sur le marché. Elle a une maîtrise parfaite de son commerce qu’elle gère avec rigueur.

Mme D. Akpéné sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $ 850 qui servira à acheter et stocker des céréales en vue d’accroître ses activités et de facto, ses revenus au besoin de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy cereal stock

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Mr. Koffi A. was born in 1973. His got his school diploma in 1997, however he could not continue his education because of the death of his older brother, who was the only one supporting him. Realizing that he must support himself, as well as the five children of his deceased older brother, he took the job of motorbike taxi driver under these very difficult conditions. Since he does not own his own motorbike, he ultimately earns very little for all his work. He feels defeated by this harsh reality and is at the end of his wits, particularly since he is married and the father of three children of his own. His greatest wish now is to be able to have his own motorbike, so that he can make more money and provide for his extended family.

To do this, he is applying for a $1,000 loan for a motorbike and the insurance for it. He can then make a secure living as a taxi driver in the city of Aného. This plan will certainly allow him to improve the living conditions of the many family members who depend on him.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY

Monsieur A. Koffi est né en 1973. Titulaire du diplôme de Baccalauréat depuis 1997, il n’a pu continuer les études parce qu’il a perdu son grand frère qui était son seul soutien. Conscient qu’il devrait désormais se prendre en charge et aussi assurer les besoins des cinq (05) enfants de son grand frère décédé, il devient conducteur de taxi moto dans des conditions très pénibles. N’étant pas propriétaire de la moto, il n’en tire pas réellement profit des fruits de son labeur. Il se trouve pratiquement écrasé par les difficultés et ne sait plus à quel sain se vouer car il est maintenant marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Le plus grand souhait exprimé aujourd’hui est de pouvoir conduire sa propre moto pour avoir un revenu plus modeste au besoin de sa nombreuse famille. Pour ce faire, Monsieur A. sollicite un crédit de $ 1000 qui va lui permettre d’acheter la moto et de l’assurer en vue de faire le taxi moto en toute sécurité à travers la ville d’Aného. Ce projet lui permettra à coup sûr d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ces nombreuses personnes à sa charge.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en: Vasile is 23 years old and grew up dreaming of owning a car. He loves driving and has now been doing it professionally for 3 years. He provides transportation services in and around Ungheni and across the Romanian border to nearby cities. His usual customers are simply people who don’t have cars available and need to get somewhere, a need which Vasile efficiently remedies. He has many regular clients, including people from surrounding villages who want their goods brought to the market for sale. Several local businesses also subcontract to him when they need extra transportation. Unfortunately a car accident has caused some problems for Vasile’s business recently, though thankfully no one was seriously injured. His car sustained damage and needed numerous repairs. Already some things have been fixed, including most of the body damage, but the vehicle still needs other repairs and part replacements to run well and allow Vasile to continue with his business. For this and also to be prepared to meet the expenses of scheduled maintenance in the near future he is requesting a loan.

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Mr. Koffi H. dropped out of school at secondary school having lost his means of support. Very early on, he demonstrated a passion for business, since he had to take care of himself. For several years, he has been working as a waiter in bars. Because of his extensive work experience in this area, he decided to open his own bar in order to improve his standard of living. He succeeded in getting a $450 loan and set up his bar in the heart of Aného. He is popular there due to his energy and pride in his work, which are the deciding factors in his line of work. He now has a steady yet ever-growing customer base. So to meet this demand, he feels he should improve his business by enlarging his bar, thus making it more inviting.

To do this, Mr. H. is requesting a loan of $1,200 that will be used to acquire tables and chairs. It will also be enough financial capital to stock beverages direct and in bulk, like pubs do. This will allow him to clear a large enough profit to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY

Monsieur H. Koffi a abandonné ses études au cours secondaire quand il n’avait plus de soutien. Il éprouve très tôt une passion pour le commerce car obligé de se prendre en charge. Il travaille plusieurs années comme serveur dans des bars et acquis une grande expérience dans le domaine. Fort de cela, il décide d’ouvrir lui-même un bar en vue d’améliorer ses conditions d’existence. Il réussit à obtenir un crédit de $450 et installa son bar au cœur de la ville d’Aného.
