Son dynamisme et son sens de travail bien fait l’ont rendu populaire dans la localité, ce qui constitue un atout majeur pour son activité. Il a aujourd’hui une clientèle abondante et régulière et il se trouve dans l’obligation d’augmenter sa prestation d’où le projet d’élargir le bar pour le rendre plus attrayant.

Pour ce faire, Monsieur H. demande un crédit de $1200 qui va servir à l’achat de tables et chaises pour et disposer de fonds de commerce pour commander les boissons en gros directement à la brasserie. Ce qui lui permettra de dégager une marge bénéficiaire importante au besoin de sa famille.

loans.use: Acquision of tables and chairs and constitution of a capital

loans.name: Pamphile

texts.en:
Born in 1961, Mr. L. Pamphile is a holder of a professional certificate in mechanics and welding. Married and father of seven children, he manages his own workshops in Afagna. Remarkable and appreciated for his fines works, he is very rigorous and honest when it comes to handling goods belonging to others. All those qualities make him a trustworthy and respectable man. As the business of Mr. L. starts to expand, the owners of the land he rent want to terminate the contract. Thanks to the first two loans he received, he was able to buy a piece of land and now wants to fully use it. His family burdens prevent him from setting up his new workshop while demand remains strong. Mr. L. therefore requested a new credit of $ 1,500 to outfit his new parcel of land, acquire more modern equipment and open a better performing workshop where there will be services of welding, mechanics, electricity, painting…This activity will make Mr. L., a real micro-entrepreneur and take care of his family.

Translated from French by Farron BLANC, a Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1961, Monsieur L. Pamphile est nanti d’un diplôme professionnel en mécanique et soudure. Marié et père de sept (07) enfants, il tient son propre atelier à Afagna. Remarquable et apprécié de par la finesse dans ses travaux, il est aussi rigoureux et honnête en matière de gestion des biens d’autrui. Toutes ces qualités font de lui un homme de confiance et de respect. Au moment où l’activité de Monsieur L. commence à prendre de l’ampleur, les propriétaires du terrain qu’il a baillé veulent résilier le contrat. Grâce aux deux premier crédits qu’il a obtenus, il est parvenu à acheter lui-même une parcelle et cherche actuellement à l’aménager. Le poids des charges de sa famille l’empêche de mettre en place son nouvel atelier alors que la demande est permanente. Monsieur L. sollicite alors un nouveau crédit de $1500 pour aménager sa nouvelle parcelle, acquérir un équipement plus moderne et ouvrir un atelier plus performant où il y aura à la fois des services comme soudure, la mécanique, la tôlerie, l’électricité, la peinture… A travers cette activité, Monsieur L. va devenir un véritable micro entrepreneur et prendre bien soin de sa famille.

loans.use: to outfit his new piece of land, and acquire more modern equipment

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.en:
Born into a poor family on February 2nd, 1974, in Kétao in the North of Togo, Mrs. Béatrice A. did not have the opportunity to attend school. At a young age she learnt how to make “Tchoukoutou”, a local sorghum-based drink. Married with three children, Mrs. A. runs a business making and selling “Tchoukoutou”. The quality of her beverage, and the rigorous management she applies, yields an acceptable income. She became head of her family as her husband has been jobless for 36 months, but she is overwhelmed by the household expenses. To meet the ever growing demand of her customers, she wants to increase production, but does not have sufficient financial resources to do so.

Mrs. A. is therefore requesting financial support of $750 to purchase sorghum and firewood in order to build up an adequate stock for her business. This will allow her to increase production and therefore revenue, which will help to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, a Kiva volunteer.

Née le 02 Février 1974 à Kétao dans le Nord du Togo d’une famille pauvre, Madame A. Béatrice n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Elle se spécialise très tôt dans la préparation de « Tchoukoutou » une boisson locale préparée à base de sorgho. Aujourd’hui mariée est mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame A. Béatrice fait de la préparation et de la vente du « Tchoukoutou » une activité professionnelle. La qualité de sa boisson et la gestion rigoureuse qu’elle en fait, lui procure un revenu acceptable. Mais cette femme, devenue « chef de famille » parce que son mari est sans salaire depuis 36 mois, elle est écrasée par les charges du ménage. Pour satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle, elle veut augmenter sa production mais ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers.

Pou ce faire, Madame A. Béatrice sollicite un concours financier de $ 750 pour acheter du sorgho et du bois de chauffe afin de disposer d’un stock adéquat au besoin de ses activités. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter sa production et de facto ses revenus qui contribueront à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to purchase sorghum and firewood

loans.name: Akouélé Christine

texts.en:
Miss Akouélé Christine T. was born in Aného on June 19, 1980. She dropped out of secondary school due to lack of resources and started selling various discount products (secondhand items, shoes, underwear, etc) to meet her own needs. At age 26, she is obliged to take care of her two parents who are both suffering from facial hemiplegia after a car accident. But the income from her small business does not cover all of her needs. She thus requested financial support in the amount of $550 which was paid back without incident. Miss Akouélé Christine T. has requested a new credit of $900 that will be used as capital for purchasing and selling soap, perfume and imported drinks. This will increase her revenue and allow her to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mlle T. Akouélé Christine est née à Aného le 19 Juin 1980. Elle arrêta les études au niveau secondaire faute de moyens et entreprend la vente des produits de liquidation (friperie, chaussures, slip…) pour assurer ses propres besoins. Agée de 26 ans, elle se trouve dans l’obligation de prendre en charge ses parents tous 2 atteints d’une hémiplégie faciale après un accident de voiture. Or, le revenu de son petit commerce n’arrive pas à couvrir tous ces besoins. Malgré. Elle sollicita alors un appui financier de $550 qu’elle avait bien remboursé sans incident. Mlle T. Akouélé Christine sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $900 qui va servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente de savon, de parfum et des boissons importés. Ceci augmentera ses revenus pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: to purchase and sell soap, perfume and imported drinks

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Mamaliga (Moldovan corn meal dish), Sarmali (grape or garbage leaves rapped around rice and meat) and borsch soup are typical Moldovan foods and delicious.  If there is an event which needs catering in Ungheni people can choose Galina G.’s catering service.  She sells freshly prepared food at a centrally located store in the center of town. She rents out the kitchen in the backroom to prepare her foods with her two women employees which have worked with her for the last 5 years since she started her business.  She originally studied winemaking but decided to switch to catering; she likes to say “It’s something every Moldovan woman just knows how to do.”

Galina would like a loan to buy an electrical oven, a hot water boiler and to stock up an inventory of ingredients for the future.

loans.use: To purchase a hot water heater and an electrical stove

loans.name: Agbowongbé

texts.en:
Mrs. Agbowongbé A. was born in 1953 in Boko-Kutimé (P'Vo). She is married and the mother of six children. Her business is going well, but the burden of her family's needs does not allow her to use the profit margin to build up the business. She is very kind, highly esteemed and well-loved in her community. She has shown good credit management skills by fully reimbursing her two previous loans. She is a trustworthy woman who deserves to have financial support for the business that she manages so well.

Mrs. A. is asking for a new loan of $750 for the purchase of essential goods such as vegetables, which are in high demand. This will allow her to yield substantial revenue for her family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, a Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Agbowongbé est née en 1953 à Boko-Kutimé (P'Vo). Elle est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Ses activités marchent bien mais le poids de la famille fait que sa marge bénéficiaire ne lui permet pas de constituer un fonds de commerce consistant. Très gentille, elle est bien appréciée et aimée dans son quartier. Elle a fait preuve d’une bonne gestionnaire à travers ses deux crédits obtenus et bien remboursés. Elle est une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenu financièrement dans ses activités qu’elle maîtrise assez bien.

Madame A. sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $750 pour achet les produits de premières nécessités surtout les légumineuses bien demandées. Ce faisant, elle dégagera un revenu substantiel au besoin de sa famille

loans.use: to purchase essential goods such as vegetables

loans.name: Taitiana

texts.en:
A haircut in Ungheni, a regional center within Moldova on the Romanian border can be expensive for Moldovan standards. Prices have been increasing recently to as much as 60Lei ($4.5), but in Pirlita, a village only ten kilometers away one can still get their haircut for 15 lei ($1) from Taitiana P..  Tatiana has been working as a stylist since she was 18 years old.  She used to work at a hair salon but decided that she wanted to start her own business.  She cuts hair in a room adjacent to her house with a separate entrance.  This room is clean and professional though bare because there is a lack of furniture and the lighting is not the best.  Tatiana would like a loan to buy equipment and instruments, additional tables and lighting for her salon. She believes that she will still be able to still charge 15Lei for a haircut and that business will be especially busy soon for the holiday season.  On a busy day she can have as many as 10-20 clients

In the future she would also like to start offering manicures. She is excited about prospect of getting a loan because it can be difficult for women from rural areas in Moldova. Some day she would like to open a massage and comprehensive beauty center.

loans.use: To buy equipment and instruments, additional tables and lighting for her salon.

loans.name: Nonvianyon Victoire

texts.en:
Mrs. Nonvianyon Victoire A. A. is about forty years old. She was abandoned by her husband but is getting by OK with her store selling beverages and food. She has three children and her retired parents to take care of. She is dynamic, ethical, and a very capable woman. She often makes use of micro-credit loans, which she does pay off.

Mrs. A. is requesting a loan of $800 to stock up on beverages for the year-end festivities when business is good. Any profits will then allow her to meet the health needs of her parents and to look after her children who are still in school.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY

Madame A. Nonvianyon Victoire A. est âgée d’une quarantaine d’année. Délaissée par un mari, elle se débrouille avec sa boutique de vente de boissons et de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle a trois (03) enfants à charge et ses parents à la retraite. C’est une femme dynamique et très habile. Elle a une bonne moralité. Elle est habituée aux petits crédits qu’elle rembourse assez bien.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $800F qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat de boisson en ces périodes des fêtes de fin d’année où cette activité marche bien. Le bénéfice dégagé lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins sanitaires de ses parents et d’entretenir ses enfants qui sont encore au collège

loans.use: serve as capital for the purchasing of drinks

loans.name: Awoma

texts.en:
Mrs. Awoma S. was born in Aklakou in 1952 to a family of farmers. She was not able to go to school and began working in farm fields very young. Mrs. Awoma S. is married and has six (6) children; she is worn out by this subsistence farming and has started selling rice, oil and other related commodities. Her husband, who has no fixed revenue, hardly contributes to the needs of the family. Thus she is responsible for most of the household expenses, based on her business. Thanks to a credit of $550 that she obtained and paid back, she was able to establish herself in this business by dint of determination and courage. Her business would have been more profitable if she had had more substantial financial support. Thus, Mrs. S. is requesting a $1,000 loan to buy supplies for her shop (rice, oil, etc.) in preparation for the end of year holidays. With this project, she will be able to gain a substantial revenue to improve the living conditions of her children and household.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mme S. Awoma est née à Aklakou en 1952 dans une famille paysanne. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, elle s’adonna très tôt aux travaux champêtres. Mariée et mère de 06 enfants, Mme S. est aujourd’hui épuisée par cette agriculture rudimentaire et s’est lancée dans le commerce du riz, d’huile et autres produits de première nécessité. Son mari, sans revenus fixe, contribue passablement dans les besoins du foyer. Elle prend alors, à partir de son commerce, la grande partie des charges du foyer. Grâce au crédit de $550 obtenu et bien remboursé, elle a su s’imposer dans ses activités par sa détermination et son courage. Son commerce aurait pu être aussi rentable si elle avait bénéficié d’un appui financier assez consistant. Alors, Mme S., sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour approvisionner son magasin de produits de première nécessité ( riz, huile, etc.) pour ces fêtes de fin d’année. Avec ce projet, elle pourra dégager un revenu plus consistant pour contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de ses enfants et de son foyer.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her shop (rice, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Adoudé

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Adoudé is a divorced vendor in the market of Aneho. She is 38 years old, and was abandoned by her husband who has since started a new family. Thus she has been living alone for two years with her three (3) children, whose needs she provides for by selling pillowcases and bedsheets. Thinking of the future of her children, who receive no support from their father, Mrs. Adoudé A. never rests. She pursues this business which is the only way out for herself and her family. But owing to lack of financial resources to settle in a fixed location, she is obliged to walk long distances in the hot sun each day, causing her to get sick. Mrs. A. requires a credit of $850 that will help her rent a shop and have the capital to purchase in bulk and sell quality bedsheets, pillowcases, and other products. With this project, she will be able to earn a sufficient revenue to better meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Divorcée, Madame A. Adoudé est commerçante au marché d’Aného. Agée de 38 ans, elle est abandonnée par son mari qui a fondé actuellement un autre foyer. C’est ainsi qu’elle vit seule depuis deux ans avec ses trois (03) enfants à qui, elle subvient aux besoins grâce à la vente de draps de lit et de taies d’oreillers. Soucieuse de l’avenir de ses enfants qui ne bénéficient d’aucune aide de la part de leur père, Madame A. Adoudé ne se repose jamais. Elle exerce ce commerce qui reste pour elle son seul salut et pour sa famille toute entière. Cependant par manque de moyen financier pour s’installer, elle est obligée de parcourir de longues distances à pied sous le chaud soleil chaque jour causant chez elle d’autres maladies. Mme A. sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $850 qui servira à louer une boutique et à disposer d’un fonds de commerce pour l’achat en gros et la revente des draps de lit de qualité, des taies d’oreillers et des produits divers. Avec ce projet, elle pourra dégager un revenu adéquat pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants laissés à sa charge.

loans.use: to rent a shop and have the capital to purchase and sell quality bedsheets and pillowcases

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.en:
Ms Tchotcho Thérèse Guedehoussou, the wife of L. H., was born on October 14, 1963 in Aného. Trained as a dressmaker, she is a hard-working woman who has been struggling on a daily basis to meet the needs of her four children, since her husband left home to live in Benin. Having found that dressmaking was not a paying proposition, she decided to open a little café, which she continues to operate enthusiastically. She also continues to sell clothing, which brings in additional income. Ms Guedehoussou now has many customers, and would like to increase her ability to meet the demand for her services.

She therefore requests a loan of $1,200 to enlarge her restaurant and to be able to purchase clothing for resale. Such initiative deserves to be encouraged, since if successful it will enable her to improve the life of her children and her family, of whom she is now the sole support.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY/J.V. Guy-Bray.

Mme GUEDEHOUSSOU Tchotcho Thérèse épouse L. H. est née le 14 octobre 1963 à Aného. Couturière de formation, elle est une femme très courageuse qui se bat au quotidien pour assurer le minimum de bien-être pour ses 04 enfants, car son mari ayant abandonné le foyer pour aller s’établir au BENIN. Ayant constaté que son métier ne lui rapportait pas, elle a opté pour la création d’un mini restaurant qu’elle tient à ce jour avec beaucoup d’enthousiasme. Parallèlement, elle vend des tenues vestimentaires, ce qui lui procure un revenu supplémentaire. Aujourd’hui, la clientèle de Mme GUEDEHOUSSOU est très importante et elle voudrait élargir ses prestations en vue d’être à la hauteur de la demande. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $1200 pour agrandir son restaurant et aussi disposer du fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des tenues vestimentaires. Une telle initiative mérite d’être encouragée car sa réalisation permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et de sa famille abandonnée à elle seule.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant and to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Adadjrosso

texts.en:
Mr. Adadjrosso A. was born on October 25, 1960 in Tchékpo-Dédépoè. He is married and the father of 4 children, and has sold drinks as his business for nearly 12 years. This has allowed him to meet the basic needs of his household and contribute to expenses. Holiday periods are busy times for bartenders. He has a good mastery of his profession and has no difficulties in managing the growth of his business. Mr. Adadjrosso A. requests a credit of $1,200 for buying, storing and selling drinks during the upcoming Christmas and New Year holidays. The project, if successful, will allow him to increase his revenue and thus to improve living conditions of his household.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Adadjrosso est né le 25 octobre 1960 à Tchékpo-Dédékpoè. Marié et pèree de 04 enfants, il exerce le commerce de boisson comme activité depuis bientôt 12 ans. Ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de contribuer de son ménage. Les périodes de fêtes constituent des moments d’intenses activités pour les tenancières de bar. Il maîtrise bien le domaine et n’éprouve aucune difficulté pour bien gérer la croissance de son activité. Monsieur A. Adadjrosso demande alors un crédit de $1200 pour l’achat, le stockage et la revente des boissons pendant ces fêtes de Noël et de Nouvel an. Ce projet, s’il se réalise, va lui permettre d’augmenter ses revenus et de ricochet, d’améliorer les conditions de vie dans le ménage.

loans.use: to purchase, stock and sell drinks

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Mr. Koffi D. was born in Kpémé in 1965. He is married, the father of two children, and guardian of his two sisters since the death of their father. Mr. DETEVI has a business whose name translates as «Light and Life», where he sells lantern fuel in and around Kpémé. The work consists of acquiring the fuel, storing it in a tank, and selling it as needed to the villagers. Thanks to his dynamism, Mr. D. is the top sales leader of lantern fuel in Kpémé. But the village is changing and developing, so the one tank owned by Mr. D. is no longer enough to meet the demands of his ever-growing customer base.

Mrs. D. is therefore requesting financial support in the amount of $1,200 that will be used to acquire a second tank for storing and selling lamp fuel. The work experience that Mr. D. has gained in his field will in essence guarantee his success. And the income from his business will better provide for his children and for the welfare of his family at home.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur D. Koffi est né en 1965 à Kpémé. Marié et père de 02 enfants, il prend également en charge ses 02 sœurs depuis le décès de leur père. M. D. a pour activité la vente du pétrole lampant dans la localité de Kpémé et de ses environs. L’activité consiste à s’approvisionner en pétrole, à le stocker dans une cuve et à le revendre en détail aux habitants du village. Grâce à son dynamisme, M.D. occupe aujourd’hui la 1ère place dans la vente du pétrole lampant à Kpémé. Mais avec l’évolution et le développement du village, la seule cuve de M. D. ne suffit plus pour satisfaire la demande d’une clientèle de plus en plus importante. Monsieur D. Koffi sollicite alors un appui financier d’un montant de $1200 qui va servir à acquérir une 2ème cuve pour le stockage et la revente du pétrole lampant. L’expérience que M. D. a acquise dans ce domaine constitue une garantie pour la bonne gestion de ses activités qu’il maîtrise assez bien. Et les revenus tirés de commerce servira à mieux entretenir ses enfants et à améliorer le bien-être de son foyer.

loans.use: to acquire a second tank for stocking and marketing lantern petrol

loans.name: Kossi Anani

texts.en:
Mr. L. Kossi Anani was born in Kpopé-Tansi in 1977 in the district of Zio. He is married and father of three, and works as a secondary school teacher. His salary is insufficient and irregular and he fails to meet all family needs; therefore he decided to launch a second career. Brave, courageous and hardworking, he decided to go in for market gardening to improve his revenue. Thus very early in the morning he works in his garden before going to the school and does the same the evening after school. His wife provides him with significant support in this activity that is growing larger and larger. Honest and good manager, he was able to reimburse very easily, the loans that he received earlier. Today, Mr. L. wants to expand his market gardening activity and make it an important source of revenue for his family. To that end, he requests a loan of $950 that will help him purchase a motor pump, watering cans, inputs and other necessary equipment for quality and large quantity market gardening.

Translated from French by Farron BLANC, a Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur L. Kossi Anani est né en 1977 à Kpomé-Tansi dans la préfecture du Zio. Marié et père de 03 enfants, il est enseignant dans un collège de la place. Son salaire étant insuffisant et irrégulier pour tous les besoins de la famille, il prit l’initiative d’entreprendre une activité parallèle à l’enseignement. Brave, courageux et bon travailleur, il décide de faire du maraîchage pour améliorer son revenu. C’est ainsi que très tôt le matin, il va travailler dans son jardin avant de partir à l’école et fait la même chose le soir après les cours. Sa femme lui apporte un soutien considérable dans cette activité qui, de plus en plus, prend une allure considérable. Honnête et bon gestionnaire, il a su rembourser facilement les crédits qu’il a déjà eus. Aujourd’hui, M. L. souhaite agrandir son maraîchage et en faire une source de revenu importante pour la famille. Il sollicite à cet effet, un crédit d’un montant de $950 qui va lui permettre d’acheter une motopompe, des arrosoirs, des intrants et autres matériels nécessaires aux cultures maraîchère en qualité et en quantité.

loans.use: to purchase a motor pump, watering cans, inputs and other necessary equipment

loans.name: Gafio

texts.en:
Mr. A. Gafio lives in Glidji with his family. Married and the father of four (4) children who are all in school, he works in agriculture because he inherited land from his parents. As an illiterate, he practices subsistence agriculture for survival. His wife and sometimes his children help him in the fields. For the coming harvest seasons, he has requested a credit of $500 to buy jute bags for storing his produce, and plant health products to better conserve his produce. This will help him to better enjoy the fruits of his labor and to produce more income resources for the education of his children.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Gafio vit à Glidji avec sa famille. Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants tous scolarisés, il a pour profession l’agriculture car ayant hérité de la terre de ses parents. Analphabète, il s’adonne à une agriculture rudimentaire de subsistance. Sa femme et parfois ses enfants l’aident dans les travaux champêtres. Pour les prochaines campagnes agricoles, il sollicite un crédit de $500 pour acheter des sacs de jutes pour stocker sa production, des produits phytosanitaire pour une meilleure conservation de ses produits. Ce faisant, il pourra mieux jouir des fruits de son labeur et dégager un revenu conséquent pour assurer une meilleure éducation de ses enfants.

loans.use: to buy jute bags for stocking his production, plant health products

loans.name: Koko Fafadji

texts.en:
Mrs. Koko Fafadji L. sells printed fabrics. She has been a widow for 5 years and is alone in her struggle to meet the most basic needs of her five children. Both courageous and enterprising, as well as honest, she manages her business with determination and is doing well. She also maintains good relations with her suppliers, who sometimes deliver fabrics directly to her home in Aneho. But Mrs. L. has limited financial resources and often runs short of goods while the demand remains very strong. The situation is coming to a peak because of the impending year-end festivities, when the demand increases even more. She is desperately looking for financial support to grow her business and to make more from it.

This is why Mrs. L. is currently asking for a loan of $1,000 as capital to buy in bulk from fabric suppliers. She can then satisfy her demanding customers and ever-growing customer base.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame L. Koko Fafadji est une commerçante de tissu imprimé. Veuve depuis 5 ans, elle se bat toute seule pour subvenir aux besoins les plus élémentaires de ses cinq (05) enfants. Courageuse, entreprenante et aussi honnête, elle exerce avec détermination ses activités qu’elle maîtrise assez bien. Elle entretien également de très bonnes relations avec ses fournisseurs qui parfois se déplacent pour lui livrer les tissus chez elle à Aneho. Mais Madame L. ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers, et se trouve souvent en rupture de stock pendant que les demandes de sa clientèle abondent. Cette situation est devenue plus aigue à l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année où la demande est de plus en plus forte. Elle cherche désespérément un appui financier pour accroître son activité et en tirer un meilleur profit. C’est ainsi que Mme L. Koko Fafadji sollicite actuellement un crédit de $1000 va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour s’approvisionner en gros chez les fournisseurs de tissus en vue de satisfaire une clientèle qui devient de plus en plus important et exigent.

loans.use: capital for purchasing bulk amounts of goods at suppliers

loans.name: Djagblé Catherine

texts.en:
Ms Djagblé Catherine A., a widow, is the mother of three (3) children who are all in school. Besides her own children, she takes care of two (2) of her nieces who are in a training school. Ms A. sells fabrics, a business she inherited upon the death of her mother. As head of the household after the death of her husband, she concentrated on her business in order to meet the needs of her family. However, she still finds herself limited by a lack of funds. This has a very negative effect on her will to work. With the welfare of her children in mind, she is looking for ways to improve her fabric business. Besides, the year-end festivities are approaching, so business will be booming. Ms A. would like to take advantage of this opportunity to expand her business and increase her income.

For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a range of the new waist-cloth materials that are now becoming available on the market, as stock for the holiday season. Financing this activity will enable Ms A. to have a steady income and to meet the needs of her orphaned children.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY.

Madame A. Djagblé Catherine est une veuve et mère de trois (03) enfants, tous scolarisés. En dehors de ses propres enfants, elle a à sa charge deux (02) nièces qui sont en apprentissage. Mme A. est commerçante de tissu, activité qu’elle a hérité de sa mère à son décès. Devenue chef de famille après la mort de son mari, elle intensifia son commerce afin de pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Mais elle se trouve toujours limitée par les moyens financiers. Ce qui dissipe en elle tout son ardeur au travail. Soucieuse du bien-être de ses enfants, elle recherche des moyens pouvant l’aider à améliorer son commerce de tissus. De plus, avec l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, l’activité promet d’être florissante et Madame A. Djagblé Catherine voudrait profiter de cette occasion pour agrandir son activité et augmenter son revenu.

C’est à cet effet qu’elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $1000 qui servira à l’achat des nouvelles gammes de tissus pagne qui arrivent sur le marché en vue de constituer un stock pour cette période de fêtes. Le financement de cette activité permettra à Madame A. Djagblé de disposer d’un revenu consistant et de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants orphelins.

loans.use: To purchase and sell new ranges of fabrics

loans.name: Marie Adoudé

texts.en:
Mrs. Marie Adoudé A. is a woman of about 45. She resells plastic bags and packaging. She has been in this business for 15 years with the financial resources she could get, for she has no real capital. She received an initial credit of $300 that she was able to manage very well and repay without any difficulties. She later got and easily paid back two (2) other credits, showing how honest and trustworthy she is. As the year ends, she needs a credit of $750 that will help buy a supply of plastic bags and packaging. The credit will stabilize her business, and the profit she earns will allow her to meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Marie Adoudé est une femme âgée de 45 ans environ. Elle est revendeuse de sachets plastiques et d’emballage. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans avec ses moyens financiers de bord car elle n’a pas un véritable fonds de commerce. Elle a bénéficié d’un crédit de $ 300 qu’elle a su bien gérer et rembourser sans incident et en a bénéficié deux (02) autres parfaitement remboursés également. Ce qui fait d’elle une femme honnête et de confiance. A cette période de fin d’année, elle a besoin d’un crédit de $750 qui servira à l’approvisionnement des sachets plastiques et d’emballages. Ce crédit stabilisera son activité et les revenus tirés lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: to buy a supply of plastic bags

loans.name: Assana

texts.en:
Young and dynamic, Miss Assana F. is quite a good cook, practically a chef! She learned from her mother, who was a catering professional. She is single and has no children but is also the guardian of her two young brothers, who are in school. She has an eatery open during lunch where she sells pasta, rice with various sauces, salad, and other dishes. With the encouragement of her customers, Miss F. wants to expand her business into the evening thus transforming her little eatery into a pub. People could go there to eat even late at night. She has saved a little, but it is not enough to make the changes needed. So she is asking for a loan of $850 to buy kitchen utensils, foodstuffs, and other necessities in order to grow her business.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Jeune et dynamique, Mademoiselle F. Assana est un véritable cordon bleu. Elle tient ce don de sa mère qui elle-même est revendeuse de nourritures. Elle est célibataire sans enfant, mais elle a à sa charge ses deux (02) jeunes frères élèves. Elle tient un petit restaurant du jour où elle vend de la pâte, du riz accompagnés de sauces, de la salade et d’autres mets. Avec les encouragements de ses clients, Mlle F. Assana, cherche aujourd’hui à étendre son commerce jusqu’au soir de façon à transformer son Mini Restaurant en cantine où même tard dans la nuit, l’on puisse aller manger. Elle dispose d’un peu d’économie mais cela ne suffirait par pour cette transformation. Elle sollicite alors, un crédit de $850 pour acheter les ustensiles de cuisine et les vivres en vue d’accroître ses activités.

loans.use: to buy utensils and foodstuff

loans.name: Lenko

texts.en: Lenko S. lives in the village of Djerovo, Kardjali district. He is 56 years old, divorced and has a son. Lenko S. starts his sartorial business in 1995. Before that he has been a taylor in a state company for 9 years. He opens an own workshop in his own building in Momchilgrad and has worked in it until 2001 when he hires a small factory and sets his business there. Now Lenko produces clothes which he exports mainly to Turkey. He has 4 employees in his factory. Lenko S. wants to buy two more sewing machines. One of them costs approximately $ 1000, so he needs a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: to buy two more sewing machines

loans.name: Jusein

texts.en:
Jusein S. is 35 years old.  He is a Bulgarian of Turkish origin and lives in the town of Momchilgrar. He is married and has two children – a girl who is 14 years old and a boy of 8. 
For more than 20 years Jusein has worked as a restaurant musician. In 2003 he decided to open his own restaurants and has rented two halls. Now most of the wedding parties in the district happen in his restaurant. Except weddings he also organizes cocktails, birthday parties and any other parties. A year ago he started a parallel business – agriculture and now grows peppers on 18 decares land. Jusein S. needs to buy a small tractor for his agricultural business and needs $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy a small tractor
